loans.name: Doreen

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 36-year-old Doreen from Bulawayo. She is single with two children, one attending school.  Doreen runs an agriculture business producing broilers and rearing layers for egg production. The business has been in operation for one year. 

Doreen says the main challenges faced are competition from imports from abroad. Doreen has requested a loan of $800 to buy feed and vaccines which are crucial to the perfect growth of the chickens and also to egg production. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to pay fees and other household expenses. In the future Doreen plans to increase production so that she will be able to approach bigger retailers who require bulk orders.	
	
The feed costs $31.50 per 50kg bag, and she needs a total of nine bags for every 100 chicks up to maturity. She also needs at least 2 bags per day for her 150-200 layers.

loans.use: to buy chicken mash and feed for her broilers and layers

loans.name: Bahaaeddeen

texts.en:
BahaaEddeen, who appears in the photo, is a 27-year-old engaged young man. He is employed and receives a low salary, which is not enough to cover all his needs.
BahaaEddeen has a small old house and wants to improve its condition to live in it after getting married this summer. Thus, he has taken a USD Youth Loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing and installing new tiles in his house. Taking this loan will create for BahaaEddeen and his future wife a suitable home condition, enabling them to enjoy living in their house.

loans.use: to purchase and install tiles in his house.

loans.name: Con Dios Adelante 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Xiomara is the coordinator of Con Dios Adelante (Forward with God) 1 & 2. This group is made up of ten micro-entrepreneur women. The group is based in the city of La Romana, a rural area of the country dedicated to the harvest of sugarcane, in a batey (company town) founded for sugarcane workers, especially for Haitians. Xiomara lives with her long-term partner and her three children. She says that her most important challenges are to continue improving her business and to provide change for her family.

After her previous loans, her business is expanding and gaining more clients. Xiomara enjoys working and cooking for her family. She is running a sales business where she sells miscellaneous items such as cosmetics, shoes and clothes. She will use her loan to purchase many items to increase her business inventory. She is excited to receive her eighth loan with Esperanza. She has been part of this group for almost five years, and with each loan she has been able to improve her business. With her business profits, she saves and reinvests in her business when she needs to buy bigger orders. Xiomara thanks all of you for your support of her business and her group.

loans.use: to buy products such as cosmetics, shoes and clothes

loans.name: Maa Mangala Group

texts.en:
In the Balangir district of Odisha, India, Baijayanti Pada is one of the slum areas of Balangir Municipality which hails from Ward No.12. There is a special identity of this slum area which is that it is inhabited by the Mahar community (Weavers of Bamboo). Most of the inhabitants of this community are very poor and far away from the basic necessities of life like shelter and education. They reside in small huts and their children get rarely get good education. 

The main business of this community is making hand fans of bamboo and selling them in the market, railway station and bus stop and in nearby villages.The income they get from their business is spent hand to mouth for them. To overcome this situation, in the year 2010 six women of this community formed a Joint Liability Group named Maa Mangala with the objective of accessing a loan from Mahashakti Foundation for the overall development of their family, to improve their existing businesses. Archana, aged about 35, is the featured member, sitting on the extreme left with raised hand. She is married and resides in a small hut with her four-member family, comprised of her husband and two daughters aged 8 & 4.  

The business of Archana (making of bamboo hand fans) is a traditional business of their community. Archana and her husband jointly do the processing work and make hand fans. To procure raw materials, they have to go 100 kilometer away by train and bring back the raw bamboo. Both the wife and husband sell their products in the town market, railway station & bus station. They also supply their products to traders. 

Archana earns a monthly income of Rs.3000 from her business. This small income never meets the minimum needs of the family. So Archana wants to raise her production for more income. From the present loan she is planning to purchase more raw bamboo to last for a long time without any interruptions. She hopes this will help her to increase her income. Archana dreams of revamping her existing hut and constructing a house for her family.

The other five members of the group are Pakani, Nandi, Santi, Dali and Radhika who also do the same business.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing bamboo and coloring.

loans.name: Maa Samlei Group

texts.en:
In the Balangir district of Odisha, India, Baijayanti Pada is one of the slum areas of Balangir Municipality which hails from Ward No.12. A special identity of this slum area is that it is inhabited by the Mahar community (Weavers of Bamboo). Most of the inhabitants of this community are very poor and far away from the basic necessities of life like shelter and education. They reside in small huts and their children rarely get good education. 

The main business of this community is making hand fans out of bamboo and selling them in the market, railway station and bus stations and nearby villages. The income they get from this is used hand-to-mouth for them. To overcome this  situation, in the year 2010 six women of this community formed a Joint Liability Group named Maa Samlei with the positive intention of accessing a loan from Mahashakti Foundation for the all round development of their family, to improve the existing situation. 

Lata, a vocal and active lady aged about 36 is the leader and also the featured member. She is sitting on the extreme right in the photograph with raised hand. She is married and lives with her husband, one daughter of 13, a son of 11, and 9-year-old twins.  

Lata is operating a traditional business of bamboo hand fan making and marketing. Lata and her husband jointly do the processing work and make hand fans. They procure the raw bamboo from a distance of 100 kms. Her husband goes by train to bring back the material. Both the wife and husband sell the finished products in the town market, railway & bus station. Apart from the making of hand fans, Lata also procures finished products from the neighbors and sells them in bulk to traders from other places. 

Lata earns a monthly income of 5000 INR from this business. According to Lata, this small income is not at all sufficient to meet the requirements of her family. So she wants to raise her production for more income. From the present loan she is planning to purchase more raw bamboo to last for a longer period and also purchase finished products to supply. Lata hopes to construct a house and provide better education to her children and lead a prestigious life.

The other five members of the group are Suchi, Kalyani, Surya, Gouri and Ritu who also operate the same business of hand fan making and selling.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing  bamboo, coloring and finished products.

loans.name: Hayel

texts.en: Hayel, who appears in the photo, is a Palestinian single young man. He lives with his family in a small agricultural village. He works in agriculture with the rest of his family members. Hayel wants to contribute to the purchase of seedlings and a water tank to irrigate crops. He is requesting a 1,000 USD loan from FATEN to provide a share of the family's costs of purchasing the seedlings and a water tank to irrigate crops. It will allow Hayel and his family to produce a better crop and, thus, to increase their sales and to improve their income.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and a water tank to irrigate crops.

loans.name: Maa Tarini Group

texts.en:
In the Balangir district of Odisha, India, Baijayanti Pada is one of the slum areas of Balangir Municipality which hails from Ward No.12. There is a special identity of this slum area is that it is inhabited by Mahar community (Weavers of Bamboo craft). Most of the inhabitants of this community are very poor and far away from the basic necessities of life like shelter and education. They reside in small huts and their children rarely get a good education. 

The main business of this community is making hand fans of bamboo and selling them in the market, railway station and bus stand and nearby villages. The income they get from this is hand-to-mouth for them. To overcome this  situation, In the year 2010 six women of this community formed a Joint Liability Group named Maa Tarini  accessing a loan from Mahashakti Foundation for the overall development of their family to improve their existing status. 

Guri, aged about 49, is one of these women, sitting on the extreme left with raised hand in the photograph. She is married and resides with her husband, one son of 26 years, and three daughters of 20, 18 and 10 years. Her second and third daughters are studying in +3 degree and 10th standard respectively. 

Guri is running her traditional business of bamboo crafts (making of bamboo hand fan).All Guri's family members jointly do the processing work and make hand fans. For the raw materials, her husband has to go 100 kilometers away by train and bring back the raw bamboo. Guri also procures ready-made products from the neighbors. Every week traders from 80 kilometers away come to Guri to take away the finished products.  

Guri earns a monthly income of Rs.5000 from her business. With this small income she can barely manage both the family needs and educational expenses of her daughters. On the other hand, her son and elder daughter have also grown up to marriageable age. So Gouri wants to increase the income of her family to  meet those expenses. From Guri's present loan a portion will be used for purchasing more raw bamboo and colour for making more hand fan and another portion will be used for procuring finished products. Guri believes that this will help her to increase her income level to some extent. Guri dreams of arranging the marriages of  her son and daughter in the near future.

The other five members of the group are Droupadi, Padmini, Santosini, Barsarani and Babby who also do the same business.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing bamboo, coloring and finished products.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Unidas está en su primer ciclo del programa de comité, ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza para saber la situación de cada una de ellas, y lo cual mostró que todas están con 
Rafaela, también hizo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza y está en un nivel medio, con ingresos muy básicos.
A través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo, capacitación e incentivo que le da la fundación ella se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza. Rafaela tiene una despensa pequeña en su casa y solicita de este crédito para la compra de insumos para su negocio, como ser frutas, verduras, carnes, panificados y demás, para vender  lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Unidas group is in its first loan cycle for its committee. The group is taking a poll to eliminate poverty and to understand everyone's current situation and to show what everyone has at the moment. Rafaela took the poll and ranked in the middle level, with a very basic income.

Due to her efforts, her work continues. Training and incentives given by the foundation help her improve her situation of living in poverty. Rafaela has a small shop in her home. She is requesting this loan to buy products for her business such as fruits, vegetables, meat, baked goods, and more. She will then sell these, which will help her to have a concrete business plan. This will allow her to improve her profits.

loans.use: to buy fruits, vegetables, meat, baked goods, and more.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.en: Delfina is taking a loan of 1,000 USD to improve her business. She is married, and she is 34 years old. Her husband is a farmer. Delfina runs a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as Coca-Cola, Fanta, Sprite, Sagiko, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, breads, oil, and eggs. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of 200 USD. Delfina is a hard working woman, and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy Coca-Cola, Fanta, Sprite, Sagiko, cigarettes, coffee, sugar, breads, oil, and eggs.

loans.name: Mirabai Group

texts.en:
Baijayanti Pada is one of the slum areas of Ward No.12. of Balangir municipality in Odisha, India. The special identity of this slum area is that it is inhabited by the Mahar community (Weavers of Bamboo).The inhabitants of this community are very poor and far away from the basic necessities of life like shelter and education. They reside in small huts and their children can rarely get a good education. 

The main business of this community is making hand fans of bamboo and selling them in the market, railway station and bus stand and nearby villages. The income they get from this is hand-to-mouth for them. To overcome this  situation, in the year 2010 six women of this community formed a Joint Liability Group named Mirabai to access a loan from Mahashakti Foundation to add some extra income for their family so as to improve their existing status. Bisaya, aged about 41, is one of them. The lady sitting second from right with raised hand in the photograph is Bisaya. She lives with her husband, one son of 25 years and two daughters of 20 and 18 in a small house. 

Bisaya is doing her traditional business of bamboo crafts (making bamboo hand fans).All Bisaya's family members do the processing work and make hand fans. Bisaya procures the raw materials from a distant place, 100 kilometer away. Bisaya sells the finished products in the town, railway station and bus stand. She earns a monthly income of 5000 INR from her business. This small income is barely enough for Bisaya to manage her family expenses. So to meet the expenses smoothly, Bisaya wants to increase the income of her family. From the present loan she is planning to purchase raw bamboo and coloring for making more hand fans. She believes that this will help her to increase her income level to some extent. Bisaya dreams of repairing her house and constructing another room for her family.

The other five members of the group are Gulapi (running a rice business along with tailoring) and Labani, Rabi, Gita and Sonia doing the same business of bamboo hand fan weaving.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing bamboo and coloring

loans.name: Natividad De Maria Group

texts.es:
Natividad de Maria está en su ciclo número 1º del programa de comité de mujeres están aprendiendo a trabajar juntas y tienen como meta crecer y ayudar a sus familias por medio del trabajo en conjunto.
Flora, una de las miembros, se dedica a la venta ambulante de frutas, ella es una persona muy trabajadora, que vio como una gran oportunidad la de formar parte de este grupo, ya que podrá mejorar su economía y también recibir capacitaciones para poder crecer como persona.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de frutas para su negocio que son manzanas, bananas, peras, naranjas, etc, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Natividad de Maria" is in its first loan cycle in the Program for Women's Committees.  They are learning to work together, and they have a goal to grow and to help their families through their joint work.

One of the members is Flora, who has a business selling fruit in an itinerant manner.  She is a very hardworking person who saw a great opportunity in becoming a member of this group, because she will be able to improve her finances and also receive training so that she can grow as a person.

Flora is requesting this loan to buy fruit for her business, including: apples, bananas, pears, oranges, etc.  This will help her to carry out her plan for her business, which will help her to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy apples, bananas, pears, oranges, etc.

loans.name: Suhaieb

texts.en:
Suhaieb, who appears in the photo, is a 26-year-old man who is engaged to be married. He is employed in a foodstuffs company and earns a small salary, which is not enough to cover all his costs.

Suhaieb is preparing his house to get married this summer so he is requesting a 2,000 USD youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost of purchasing necessary construction supplies, such as cement, bricks and tiles. This will enable Suhaieb to complete his house in less time and to prepare a suitable home for his coming life with his new wife.

loans.use: To purchase cement, bricks and tiles

loans.name: Joana

texts.en:
Joana is applying for a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She is 25 years old and married. Her husband is a driver.

She is running a business in her house by selling hard drinks (beer), soft drinks (sagiko, fanta, sprite), eggs, milk, salt, cigarettes, water and bread. She opened her kiosk in 2005 with working capital of $100. She is making a good income from this selling and she wants to buy more stock with the loan. 

Joana is living in a town near the main road, so many people come to buy and she is selling every day. She is happy with this program that helps her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy hard drinks (beer), soft drinks (fanta, sagiko, sprite), eggs, milk, salt, cigarettes, water and bread.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia has been offered a $1,000 loan to improve her business. She opened her kiosk in 2010 with her own working capital. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store like rice, noodles, milk, water, eggs, books and salt. Cecilia is generating a good income from selling. She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing this business. She lives in a town with her family.

loans.use: To buy rice, noodles, milk, water, eggs, books and salt.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia is married. She has a kiosk to generate income for her family. She has been thinking how to run a big business, but she does not have enough working capital. She felt better when she applied for her first loan, with which she will buy some additional supplies to keep in her store, such as soft drinks, hard drinks, body lotions and biscuits. She is happy with TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) that offers loans to poor people.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, hard drinks, body lotions and biscuits.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 36-year-old married man and the father of two sons and three daughters. He is employed and earns a small salary, which is barely enough to cover all the family's needs.

Khaled and his family were in need of a new refrigerator in their house, especially in summer season, so he took a Murabaha loan from FATEN to help him cover the cost. This loan will impact Khaled's family's living condition positively. Khaled's photo was taken in front of the refrigerator he has bought.

loans.use: to buy a new refrigerator for his house

loans.name: Kuña Aty Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Kuña aty está en su ciclo número 8 del programa de comité de mujeres. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde todas ellas a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y las aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza.
Liz, la presidenta cuenta que su grupo esta luchando por salir adelante, mejorar la vida de cada una de ellas y dar a sus familias lo que ellas no pudieron tener. Ellas asisten a capacitaciones que las ayuda a crecer e ir mejorando. Liz se dedica a la venta de verduras, y con ello tiene los ingresos con los que mantiene la casa y los gastos del día a día.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de locotes, cebolla, tomate, espinacas, y demás verduras para seguir invirtiendo en su microemprendimiento.
texts.en:
The group, Kuña Aty, is in its 8th cycle of the women’s committee program. They are doing a survey on the elimination of poverty. Through their efforts, continuing work, and the application of vital behaviors for successful women, all of them are improving their poverty situation.

Liz, the president, says that their group is fighting to get ahead, to improve each woman's life, and to give their families what they couldn’t have. They attend trainings that help them to grow and continue improving. Liz sells vegetables, and with them she makes the income to maintain her house and take care of her day to day expenses.

She is applying for this loan to buy green peppers, onions, tomatoes, spinach, and other vegetables to continue investing in her microbusiness.

loans.use: to buy green peppers, onions, tomatoes, spinach, and other vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en: $1,000 has been offered to Filomena to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as biscuits, noodles, sugar and coffee. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2009. She feels so comfortable running  her business because she can earn money every day.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, noodles, sugar and coffee.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is taking a loan of $1000 to improve her business. She is married and she is 29 years old. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as water, oil, milk, salt, books, cigarettes, soap, rice, fish, slippers and pencils. She opened her kiosk in 2002 with her own working capital of $50. 

Maria is a hardworking woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future. She is happy with TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) that offers loans for poor people.

loans.use: To buy water, oil, milk, salt, books, cigarettes, soap, rice, fish, slippers and pencils.

loans.name: Maa Maheswari-2 Group

texts.en:
Maa Maheswari - 2, a Joint Liability Group, was formed in the year 2010 by four active women of Bhawanipatna town of Kalahandi district in Odisha, India. Simanchlam is one of the members of this group, sitting on the extreme left with raised hand in the photograph. She is 43 years of age and lives with her husband and two sons of 23 and 20 years. Her family migrated to this town in the last 40 years from the neighboring state of Andhra Pradesh in search of employment and settled here permanently. 

Simanchlam is running a goldsmith business in her house with the active support of her husband. Her elder son also helps his father. This is the traditional business of her family. They make different designs of ornaments and do polishing work by using traditional methods. From this business she earns a monthly income of 4000 INR with which is very hard for Simanchlam to manage her family's expenses. So she is thinking to increase the income of her business by adding some design machines and new accessories to her workshop. This will help her to get more output in less time and generate more time to work. 

From the present loan Simanchlam is planning to purchase an ornament-designing machine and some goldsmith accessories. Simanchlam hopes to open another workshop in the town for her sons in the near future. The other three members of this group are Sujata, Rina and Puspa who are running an auto repair center, a general store and an automobile shop respectively.

loans.use: To pay for  purchasing  an ornament-designing machine and  goldsmith accessories

loans.name: Malakiah

texts.en:
Opening a coffee shop has been a long time dream for Malakiah and her business partner April.  From the tantalizing aroma of a fresh hand-poured coffee to the social buzz found at local coffee shops, the full coffee experience has always excited them.  

Last March they decided to finally take the plunge, quitting their jobs and emptying their 401Ks to open Broke Girl’s Coffee Bar in the urban community of Normal Heights.  

The combination of eclectic décor, a large outdoor patio with a performance stage and locally sourced coffee beans make Broke Girls a San Diego gem worth discovering.  However, what makes this café truly special is its two owners with their contagious smiles and their deep care for the community.
Though Malakiah and April were able to complete a lot of the initial build out of their coffee bar with their own funds, they quickly ran out of capital and needed extra help.  They will use their $10,000 Kiva loan to finish the plumbing, as well to finish furnishing and stocking the shop with initial inventory for opening.

There is already a lot of interest from the community that is eager to welcome this new coffee bar to the scene.  Malakiah and April hope that their coffee bar will become a gathering place for the community, featuring the talents of local musicians and artists.  Furthermore, as members of the sober community, they hope to host meetings and gatherings helping people get sober.

video.title: Kiva Borrower Malakiah from United States

loans.use: to finish the plumbing, as well to finish furnishing and stocking the shop with initial inventory

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fabric and thread

loans.name: San Agustin Group

texts.es:
El comité San Agustin se formo con la unión de 15 señoras de la ciudad de Santaní. Cada integrante tiene un microemprendimiento en el cual trabaja y se esmera por ir mejorando. Ellas son mujeres jefas y madres que luchan por sus familias.
Perla es una de ellas, quien se dedica a la cría, faena y venta de animales de corral, como ser cerdos, gallinas y demás. Nos dice que esta oportunidad que está recibiendo es muy valiosa para ella, ya que muchos no le quisieron dar esta chance.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de balanceados para sus animales, para que de esa forma no les falte nada.
texts.en:
The Saint Agustin committee is made up of fifteen women from the city of Santané. Each member has their small enterprise where they work. They hope to improve their businesses. They are in charge of their businesses and are also mothers that struggle for their families. 
Perla is one of the members of the group. She raises, works with and sells domesticated animals such as pigs, chickens and other animals. She told us that this opportunity, of which she is the recipient, is very valuable to her. Many others don’t have this opportunity. She is asking for this loan in order to buy food for the animals. If she can do this she will not lack anything.

loans.use: to buy balanced food for the animals.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is married and has two children. She has her own business. She sells yarn at the city's central market and has her own retail outlet. Elena has 15 years of work experience. She is hardworking and responsible. 
Elena wants to develop her business in order to improve the family's welfare. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 10,000 hryvnia (UAH) to refill an inventory of popular types of yarn.

loans.use: to purchase additional supplies of yarn

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en:
Sofia is a 45-year-old responsible mother of five children living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan along with her husband and children. Her husband is a government employee and three of her children are currently studying in school. Her husband’s income is not enough to meet the household and educational expenses of their children and they are facing many hurdles in life. Sofia is helping her husband with the income by having a cloth business in her house for the past three years. 
She has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan to expand her business. The main purpose of the loan is to open a small boutique in the market. In this way she would get more customers and her sales would be increased. She would save some money from the profit amount and pay the educational expenses of her children. Sofia has a bright vision and this loan could help her to fulfill her dreams. She is very thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva for their support.

loans.use: To open a boutique

loans.name: Joaquina

texts.en: Joaquina is  taking a loan of $ 600 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as slippers, cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta) and biscuits. She opened her kiosk in 2003 with her own working capital of $ 300.00.  She is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy slippers, cigarettes, soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta) and biscuits.

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Caacupé se unieron 14 mujeres que quieren salir adelante y trabajar para poder ayudar a sus familias a dejar la pobreza atrás. Ellas vieron una gran oportunidad de progreso en el programa y decidieron formar su comité.
La señora Heriberta es integrante del comité,  ella solicita su crédito para invertirlo en compra de telas para confección de ropas, ya que ese es su principal trabajo y por medio de esto ayuda a su familia.
Cuenta que desde pequeña ha trabajado y se ha esforzado, todo lo que construyo en la vida es producto de su lucha y fuerza. Agradece por esa oportunidad que recibe, pues le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
In Caacupé city a group of fourteen women meet. These women want to move forward and work in order to help their families and leave their previous lives of poverty. They saw the opportunity to progress with this program and so they decided to form a committee. 
Mrs. Heriberta is a member of this committee. She is asking for this loan in order to buy fabic to sew clothes. This is her main occupation and a way that she can help her family. Since she was little she has been working. Everything that she has earned in her life has been a product of her own struggle and effort. She is thankful for the  opportunity to receive this loan, as it will be a great help to her.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make clothes.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 40-year-old woman and is married to Leonard, 53, who is working at a repair shop. They have five children: Septiadi, 18, who is working; Defrid, 15, a Junior High School student; David, 13 and Samuel, 9, both are in Elementary School; and the last one is Arthen, 5 years old. 
In order to help her husband in generating more income, Ruth cooks the simple lunch for 10 people who are working in a repair shop. The owner of the repair shop pays 350.00 IDR (Indonesian Rupiah) per week to provide food for the employees. 
Her husband plans to resign from his work, to start a new business as a fisherman. Currently, they have a small boat and it is ready to operate but unfortunately they need some money to buy a flashlight, trawl lead, floats, etc. She got information that TLM provides a business loan for small business entrepreneurs like her. She then requested a loan amount of 4,000,000 IDR from TLM .

loans.use: to buy a flashlight, trawl leads, floats, etc

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is 26 years old, married, and has two children. He lives in Taiz, Yemen. He works hard in a small company buying mobile recharge cards then selling them to his customers to get profit. He works hard to complete studying for a bachelor's degree and to improve his family's expenses.  
He is requesting a youth loan for 100,000 YER (Yemeni Rial) from AMB which he will use to purchase mobile recharge cards  to sell to his customers to expand his business. In the future, he hopes to be a successful merchant in order to open a phone accessories store and earn an increased income, which will enable him to provide his household expenditures.

loans.use: to purchase mobile recharge cards  to sell to his customers to expand his business.

loans.name: Kuña Kyrey Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Comité Kuña Kyre’y está en su ciclo número 7mo.  Del programa de comité de mujeres, donde cada una de ellas está trabajando por mejorar sus vidas y las de su familia. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza para saber en qué situación esta cada una, donde 6 integrantes se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir con ingresos muy bajos.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Edith  es una de estas mujeres, ella se encuentra trabajando en la venta de bijouterie y conforme vaya recibiendo las capacitaciones quiere seguir creciendo y mejorando la inversión que está haciendo. Ella es una persona muy humilde, pero con muchos sueños y metas.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de bijouterie para la venta, y por medio de esto siga ganando un poco mas de ingresos para ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The group called Comité Kuña Kyre'y is in its 7th loan cycle with the Women's Committee program, where each one of the members is working to improve her life and that of her family.  They are doing the poverty elimination survey in order to know each member's situation.  Six of the members are below the poverty line; that is, they have very low income.

One of the members, Edith, is one of these women.  She works selling costume jewelry.  Accordingly, as she is receiving training, she wants to continue growing and improving the investment she is making.

She is a very humble person, but with many dreams and goals.  She is applying for this loan to buy costume jewelry for selling.  In this way, she would like to continue earning a little more income in order to help her family.

loans.use: to buy costume jewelry for selling.

loans.name: Edgar Enrique

texts.es:
Edgar es un señor casado de 35 años quien tiene 2 hijos 1 mujer y 1 hombre quienes viven en Sololá.
El se dedica al cultivo de arveja china  y suchini  se ha  dedicado  a esta actividad desde hace 5 años. Eligió esta labor  porque es muy rentable debido a que es un producto certificado,  esto permite que tenga precios aceptables en el mercado nacional e internacional.
El esta solicitando un préstamo de Q 5,000.00 para compra de semilla y fertilizantes para cultivo de suchini.
Su sueño es comprar una cuerda de terreno, para  incrementar su producción ya que actualmente solo cuenta con 2 cuerdas de terreno.
texts.en:
Edgar is a married, 35-year-old man who has two children, one female and one male.  They live in Sololá.  He makes a living cultivating snow peas and zucchini.  He has worked in this activity for five years.  He chose this work because it is very profitable due to the fact that it is a certified product and this allows him to have acceptable prices in the national and international market.

He is requesting a loan of 5,000 quetzales (GTQ) to purchase seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of zucchini.  His dream is to purchase a cuerda (a plot of land) to increase his production since he currently only has two cuerdas of land.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for zucchini cultivation.

loans.name: Mujeres Virtuosas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Virtuosas  está en su ciclo número 8º , según la encuesta de eliminación que ellas han hecho para saber su situación, 15 mujeres se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir con ingresos muy bajos, y es por esa razón que se están esforzando el doble.
Maria, una de las miembros, tiene un negocio de venta de bebidas, cuenta que con este trabajo y sumada a las capacitaciones que recibe, está mejorando y saliendo adelante, y todo lo que aprende aplica a su negocio. Ella comenta que los fines de semana es cuando mas clientes tiene, es por eso que solicita de este crédito para poder comprar bebidas y surtir su negocio con mas vinos, cervezas, gaseosas y demás, y así seguir invirtiendo en su negocio, el cual es su única fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Virtuosas group is in their eighth cycle. According to the survey on the elimination of poverty, 15 women find themselves below the poverty line. Their earnings are very low and so they are striving with twice the effort. 
Maria is one of the members. She has a business selling drinks. With this work and the trainings she has received, she is improving and moving forward. Everything that she learns, she applies to her business. She comments that she has the most customers during the weekends. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase beverages and stock her store with more wines, beers, soft drinks and other items. With this, she can continue investing in her business which is her only source of income.

loans.use: purchase wines, beers, soft drinks and other items in order to sell them.

loans.name: Catarina

texts.en: Catarina is applying for a loan of $1,000.00 to improve her business. She is 31 years old and is married with two children. She is running a business in front of her house in which she sells gasoline. She is making a good income from selling gasoline and she wants to increase her stock with the loan. She is living in a town near the main road, so many people come to buy and she is selling every day. She opened her kiosk in 2009 with her own working capital of $45.00.

loans.use: to buy gasoline to sell.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: Jose, de 47 años de edad , esta casado y tiene 3 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia.Jose se dedica a la venta de repuestos de vehículos motorizados como bujías, cadenas, palieres,  entre otros. También se dedica a la reparación de estos vehículos , arregla motores, sistemas eléctricos, entre otros. Este trabajo lo realiza en un local al interior de su propia vivienda. Lleva muchos años en esta actividad y actualmente cuenta con la ayuda de su hijo, un ayudante y un practicante de un instituto. Comenta que su negocio es rentable porque la inversión lo realiza una sola vez, que es comprar herramientas necesarias para el arreglo de estos vehículos. Espera en el futuro  mejorar su local de atención, poner un  torno y una rectificadora.Por tanto éste será  su préstamo número 05 con Kiva, esta contento por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante.Con el monto solicitado de 1300 soles, comprará repuestos  como bujías, cadenas, palieres, entre otros .
texts.en: Jose is 47 years old, married, and has three children who live with him in his own home.  Jose sells auto parts such as spark plugs, chains, bearings, and other things.  He also repairs vehicles, fixes engines, electrical systems, and other things.  He does this work in a workshop at his home and has been doing this for many years.   He gets help from his son, another helper, and an apprentice from a school.  He says that this business is profitable because he only invested one time, buying necessary tools for fixing vehicles.  He hopes to improve his workshop and add a lathe and grinder.  This will be his fifth loan through Kiva and he's happy to be receiving financial support so that he can continue ahead.  He will use the 1,300 PEN to buy parts such as spark plugs, chains, bearings, and other things.

loans.use: to buy parts.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: A $600.00 loan is offered to Francisca to improve her business. Francisca opened her kiosk in 2010 with her own working capital. She will use the loan to buy stock for her store including oil, slippers, detergent, and soap to sell. Francisca is generating a good income from selling. She has been thinking of running a big business after years of doing business. Francisca is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: to buy oil, slippers, detergent, and soap for her general store.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This Kadiatu. She is in her late twenties and is from Waterloo 2 Western rural area. She is married with 2 children between the ages of 7 years and 11 years. Her children are attending school. She started her business to be able to take care of her children and mother.

Kadiatu runs a retail business; she sells cigarettes, biscuits, and light batteries. She has been running this business for 5 years. She works at the business every day from morning to night. Kadiatu says that the main challenge to her business is lack of funds to expand it.

Kadiatu has requested a loan in order to purchase more cigarettes, biscuits, and light batteries for resale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to change the life of her family and grow her business. In the future, she plans to open a shop. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more cigarettes, biscuits, and light batteries for resale.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Meet 37-year-old Marie from Waterloo, in the western rural area in Sierra Leone. She is married with two children, ages 15 and 20 years. They are currently attending school. 

In 2000, Marie established her palm oil business. She began her business because she needs to create income to support her family. She works at the business every day from morning to night. She says that the main challenges to her business are lack of finances to operate her business and transportation problems.

Marie requires a loan in order to purchase more gallons of palm oil for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to have a permanent business location and increase her business. 

In the future, Marie plans to open a big palm oil store. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more gallons of palm oil for resale.

loans.name: Kuña Aty Tembiapora Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado  Kuña Aty Tembiapora está en su Primer Ciclo  están muy entusiasmadas de formar parte de este programa, ya que saben que les será de mucha ayuda. Ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, que mide sus ingresos, y 3 de las integrantes se encuentran por debajo de la línea de la pobreza, es decir con ingresos muy bajos.
La Sra. Nieve, a través de su esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo se encuentra mejorando su situación económica, y por medio del trabajo que hace en el copetín que tiene es que está saliendo adelante. Ella es una persona con muchas aganas de crecer y salir adelante, es por eso que se está esforzando al máximo.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra de ingredientes para utilizar en su copetín, ya que allí vende comestibles, y quiere comprar carnes, verduras, condimentos, harina, huevo y demás, y de esa forma seguir trabajando y teniendo los medios para ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
the group called Kuña Aty Tembiapora is in its first cycle. They are very enthusiastic to be a part of this program, since they know that this will be a big help for him. They are participating in a poverty elimination study that meaures their income. Three of the members are below the poverty line. That is, they have very low income. 

Nieve, through her hard work and efforts has continued to work to improve her financial situation with her work selling snacks, which is how she is getting ahead. She is a person who really wants to grow and get ahead. That is why she is working as hard as she can. 

She is asking for this loan to buy ingredients to us in her snack shop. She sells food there and will buy meat, vegetables, condiments, flour, eggs and more. This way, she can keep working and having a way to help her family.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, condiments, flour, eggs and more.

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Virgen de fatima está en su ciclo 5 del programa de comité de mujeres. A través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y las aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ellas se encuentran mejorando sus vidas.
Teresa es un ejemplo a seguir, ella se dedica a la venta de remedios naturales en forma ambulante, esos remedios pueden ser utilizados para te, también para mate y terere (Bebidas tradicionales de Paraguay). Ella cuenta que su trabajo es muy sacrificado, pero que está orgullosa de lo que hace, ya que es un trabajo digno y honesto, con el que ayuda a su familia y les da lo que necesita.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de remedios naturales para la venta, y así seguir luchando por su familia.
texts.en:
This woman’s group, called “The Virgin of Fatima”, is on its fifth loan cycle. After continuous hard work and effort, and after describing the behavior of a successful woman, they are improving their lives.
Teresa is a good example. She sells natural remedies door to door. These herbs are used as a tea and also can be added to mate and terere (hot and cold traditional drinks from Paraguay). She sacrifices a lot to do her work, but is proud of her accomplishments. It is a dignified and honest occupation. It helps her family and gives them what they need. 
She is asking for this loan in order to buy natural remedies that she will sell. In this way she can continue to work for her family.

loans.use: to buy natural remedies that she will sell.

loans.name: Mehroj

texts.ru: Мехроджу 34 года. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Его жена Мастура очень добрая и трудолюбивая женщина. Он выпускник Педагогического Колледжа. Данное время работает в средней школе. Он преподает математику и информатику. Мехродж очень любит свою профессию и хочет усовершенствовать свои знания. Он поступил в Педагогический Университет, чтобы получить высшее образование. Он очень хорошо совмещает учебу с работой. Мехродж должен оплатить за учебный договор, но не имеет денег, так как он получает маленькую зарплату и использует эту зарплату для обеспечения семьи. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебы в университете. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Mehroj is 34 years old and he is married with two children.  His wife Mastura is a very kind and hard-working woman.  Mehroj is a graduate of the Pedagogical College and he currently works at a high school teaching math and informatics.  He loves his work and he wants to improve his knowledge.  Mehroj has enrolled in the Pedagogical Institute to receive a higher education, and he is very good at combining work and study.  He needs to pay for his tuition but he doesn't have enough money, since he earns a small salary and he uses it all to support his family.  He is asking for a loan to pay for his university studies.  He awaits your kindness and he is counting on your charity.

loans.use: To pay for his tuition

loans.name: Estella

texts.es: Estella de 46 años de edad, es ama de casa y madre de cinco hijos. Sus ganas de salir adelante y luchar por un mejor porvenir para su familia la han convertido en toda una guerrera. Ha laborado en diferentes empresas del sector comercial, pero hoy  cansada de su inestabilidad laboral, desea iniciar con su proyecto de negocio, razón por la cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito para capacitarse en conservas de frutas, conocimientos que le permitirán ofrecer productos de calidad y mejorar su condición económica.
texts.en: Estella is 46 years old, is a housekeeper, and mother of five children.  Her desire to get ahead and work to improve her family's future have turned her into a real warrior.  She has worked for different companies in the commercial sector, but now she wants to start her own business, so she is asking for a loan to train herself in preserving fruit, which will allow her to offer quality products and improve her financial condition.

loans.use: to train for a business.

loans.name: Katrin

texts.en:
Katrin is a 38-year-old woman who is married to Clement, a 44-year-old man. They are blessed with 2 children: Paskalis, 12, in the 2nd grade of Junior High School; and Maria, 6, in the 2nd grade of Elementary School.

Katrin owns a business selling vegetables, fish and fruits in the market at night. She buys them from local farmers and fishermen. She runs the business to generate more income for her family as the income generated from her husband as a laborer is insufficient to meet their daily needs.

Katrin plans to buy more vegetables and to raise a piglet. Therefore she has requested a loan from TLM amounting to 10,000,000 IDR (Indonesian Rupiah). Katrin is hoping that TLM will help her through the loan assistance for her business improvement.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and a piglet

loans.name: Mbalu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 38-year-old Mbalu from Waterloo Western rural area. She is married with two children, ages 10 and 18 years. Her children are attending school. 

Mbalu runs a palm oil business; she sells palm oil and gari (cassava flakes). She has been running this business since 2000. She works at the business every day from morning to night.  She says that the main challenge to her business is the poor road network to her operation area.

Mbalu has requested a loan in order to purchase more palm oil and gari. The extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and have a permanent business location. 

In the future, she plans to change her business to a grocery shop. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and gari for resale.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
El señor Ricardo tiene 57 años de edad, es casado, tiene 2 hijos por quienes el y su esposa se han esforzado, para poder darles todo lo que ellos no pudieron tener y asi evitar que tengan que pasar por necesidades.
El Sr. Ricardo se dedica a las ventas de carbón, tiene  local propio en su casa. Cuenta que él era taxista, y después cambio de rubro, que hasta hoy le va muy bien, con clientela ya bien formada ya que hace ya un tiempo que se dedica a esto.
Solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de carbón, ya que es el insumo que vende y quiere estar bien surtido. Agradece por la oportunidad que él y su familia están recibiendo.
texts.en:
Mr. Ricardo is 57 years old, married and has two children. His wife and he struggle to provide their children with everything that they need.They didn’t have basic necessities when they were growing up. They don’t want their children to have the same experience.
Mr. Ricardo sells coal from his home. He was a taxi driver but he changed jobs. This has worked out well for him. He has regular customers, as he has been doing this job for a while. 
He is asking for this loan in order to buy more coal. He sells this item and wants to have a sufficient supply. He is thankful for the opportunity that he and his family will receive.

loans.use: to buy coal that he will sell.

loans.name: Nilufar

texts.ru: Нилуфар энергичная и умная женщина. Ей 28 лет. Она не замужем и живет с родителями. Нилуфар более 5 лет работает в медицинском пункте своего района медсестрой. Она честно и качественно выполняет свою работу. Она хочет получить второе образование и поэтому она учится в заочное отделение Институт Экономики и Торговли Республики Таджикистана. Она учится хорошо и отлично. Активно участвует во всех мероприятиях института. В свободное время читает книги и смотрит интеллектуальные телепередачи. Она должна оплатить за учебный договор, но не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Nilufar is an energetic and smart woman. She is 28 years old. She is not married and lives with her parents. 

Nilufar has worked as a nurse at the regional health point for more than five years. She carries out her work honestly and efficiently. She would like to take a second education and therefore she takes a correspondence course at the Institute for Economy and Trade of the Republic of Tajikistan. She studies well and takes an active part in all the institute's activities. In her free time she reads books and watches intellectual TV programs. 

Nilufar has to pay her tuition fees, but does not have money for this. She requests a loan to pay them and awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To pay her tuition fees

loans.name: Flor Soraima

texts.es:
Flor de 40 años de edad, se dedica a las ventas por catálogo desde hace más de 10 años, actividad que le ha permitido colaborarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y la educación de sus dos hijos. 
Hoy se encuentra solicitando un crédito con el fin de capacitarse en cocina básica debido a que desea ampliar sus conocimientos culinarios. 
Asegura que uno de sus grandes deseos es sorprender a su familia con platos innovadores y preparar los eventos especiales.
texts.en:
Flor is 40 years old, sells items via catalog, and has for 10 years.  This has allowed her to share the household and children's education expenses with her husband.

She is asking for a loan so she can train in basic cooking because she wants to expand her culinary knowledge.

She says that one of her greatest desires is to surprise her family with innovative dishes and prepare them for special events.

loans.use: to train in culinary skills.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Zainab from Waterloo Western rural area in Sierra Leone. She is married with 4 children between the ages of 3 years and 16 years.

Zainab runs a retail business. She sells biscuits, cigarettes and alcohol. She has been running this business for 7 years. She works at the business throughout the week moving door to door to sell her goods. She says that the main challenge to her business is transportation problems.  

Zainab has requested a loan in order to purchase more stock including biscuits, cigarettes, and alcohol. The extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her life and her family's well-being. In the future, she plans to expand her business to a shop level. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase stock to sell including biscuits, cigarettes, and alcohol.

loans.name: Gbassay

texts.en:
Gbassay is 27 years old and married with two children. She runs a food stand business in Waterloo 2, in the western rural area in Sierra Leone.

She's been in this business for ten years and sells fish, pepper and cooking seasoning. She says that the main challenge to her business is inadequate finances to expand her business.
 
Gbassay requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase cooking ingredients, including fish, pepper and cooking seasoning. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her educate her children. 

In the future, she would like to renovate her house. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase cooking ingredients, including fish, pepper and cooking seasoning.

loans.name: Tzamjuyub Concordia Group

texts.es:
La señora Florentina Catarina de estado civil casada, tiene 36 años de edad, de escolaridad 3ro. básico, tiene 3 hijos y los 3 están estudiando, ella se dedica a actividades pecuarias, compra pollos para engorde y luego venderlos, inició este negocio con poco capital y hasta el momento lleva 10 años de experiencia. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica al comercio.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo necesita para comprar pollo para engorde y concentrado para los mismos, en el futuro desea que su negocio prospere y tener mas pollos; las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a artesanía y comercio. Una de las integrantes del grupo no pudo asistir cuando tomaron la foto.
texts.en:
Florentina Catarina is 36 years old and married. She has a third grade education and three children who are all in school. She works with livestock, buying chickens to fatten up and then sell. She started this business with little capital and so far has 10 years experience. She has the support of her husband, who is a merchant. 

She is organizing a group and asking for a loan that she needs to buy chickens to fatten up and concentrate to feed them. In the future, she wants her business to prosper and have more chickens. The other members of the group work in artisanal crafts and as merchants. One of the members of the group was unable to attend when the photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy chicken to fatten up

loans.name: Nurullo

texts.ru: Нурулло 29-летний молодой человек. Он женат и является отцом одного ребенка. Нурулло с женой и маленькой дочерью живет в районе Кубадиён, на юге страны. У него среднее образование. Нурулло занимается земледелием. Сейчас он хочет начать бизнес в сфере животноводства. Его интересует купля и продажа крупнорогатого скота. Нурулло планирует закупать по 5-голов крупного рогатого скота, откармливать в течение 30-35 дней и затем продавать на скотном рынке района. У Нурулло имеется сбережение, а также двухэтажный сарай для содержания скота. Однако, чтобы закупить скот он нуждается в кредите и ждет от Вас поддержки.
texts.en:
Nurullo is a young man of 29 years. He is married and the father of a child. Nurullo, his wife and his young daughter live in the Qubadiyon region, in the south of the country. He has high school education. 

Nurullo works with agriculture. Currently he would like to start a business in the area of livestock breeding. He is interested in the buying and reselling of cattle. Nurullo plans to purchase five heads of cattle, fatten them for a period of 30-35 days, and then sell them at the regional livestock market. 

Nurullo has savings, and also a two stories high barn for livestock. However, in order to purchase cattle he needs a loan and awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase cattle for reselling

loans.name: Ergash

texts.ru: Эргаш 49 лет. Он человек с прекрасной душой и прекрасными мыслями. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Его жена работает в птицефабрике. Эргаш более 20 лет занимается скотоводством. В основном он занимается выращиванием мелко – рогатого скота. Данное время у него в обороте имеется 4 голов МРС и поэтому он хочет увеличить количество скота и таким образом развевать бизнес. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 10000 сомони для покупки скота и сено для скота. Он ждет вашу доброту. Этот займ поможет ему развивать бизнес и таким образом улучшить условию проживания.
texts.en:
Ergash is 49 years old. He has a good soul and great thoughts. He is married and raising four children. His wife works at a poultry farm. 

Ergash has worked with livestock breeding for more than 20 years. He mainly raises sheep and goats. Currently he has four sheep and goats and therefore he would like to increase the number of livestock in order to develop his business. He requests a loan in the amount of 10,000 somoni for the purchase of livestock and hay for them. He awaits your kindness. This loan will help him to develop his business and thus improve his living conditions.

loans.use: To buy livestock and fodder

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Meet 40-year-old Zainab from Waterloo, in the western rural area in Sierra Leone. She is married with three children between the ages of 5 years and 20 years. Her children are currently attending school. 

In 2000, Zainab established her retail business. She began her business because she wants to provide upkeep for her family. She works at the business from Monday to Sunday, 8:00 a.m. to 7:30 p.m. She says that the main challenge to her business is transportation.

Zainab requires a loan in order to purchase a variety of soft drinks and bags of sugar. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her life and pay school fees for her children. 

In the future, Zaina plans to build a beautiful house. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of soft drinks and bags of sugar.

loans.name: Maria Teodora

texts.es: Maria, habitante de la ciudad de Granada, de oficio comerciante, es una de nuestras mejores clientes, ella vende cosméticos, sombrillas, productos para el cabello, los crédito han resultado en cambios positivos para su negocio el financiamiento ha logrado vender más y tener productos para vender. Se siente muy agradecida por la confianza que ha tenida en ella. Hoy está solicitando crédito para comprar cosméticos, perfumes, paraguas. Pues la temporada del día de las madres está cerca y las ventas durante esta época son muy buenas y no quiere perder la oportunidad de vender.
texts.en: Maria, who lives in Granada, is a businesswoman. She is one of our best members. She sells cosmetics, umbrellas, hair products, etc. A previous loan has made a positive change in her business. She has been able to sell more and she has more products to sell. She is thankful for the confidence that the lenders have in her. Today she is asking for a loan in order to buy cosmetics, perfumes and umbrellas. Mother’s Day is coming up and sales during this time are very good. She doesn’t want to miss this sales opportunity.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, perfumes and umbrellas.

loans.name: Khulkar

texts.ru: Хулкар добросовестная женщина. Ей 25 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Ее муж Дилшод, работает в фермерской хозяйстве. Хулкар более 4 года, занимается выращиванием риса. Дополнительно она занимается скотоводством. Хулкар выращивает рис на 2 га земли. Полученный урожай она продает на местном рынке и имеет своих постоянных клиентов. Она должна дать земле минеральные удобрения для того, чтобы получать больше и высококачественного урожая. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 4000 сомони для покупки минерального удобрения. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Khulkar is a conscientious woman. She is 25 years old. She is married and raising two children. Her husband Dilshod works at a farm. Khulkar has worked with growing rice for more than four years. In addition she works with livestock breeding. 

Khulkar grows rice on two hectares of land. The harvest she receives, she sells at the local market, where she has returning customers. She should give the land mineral fertilizers in order to receive more and high quality harvest. She requests a loan in the amount of 4,000 somoni for the purchase of mineral fertilizers. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizers for the land where she grows rice

loans.name: Mery Jane

texts.es: Mery, una humilde comerciante, quien se dedica a vender zapato en la ciudad de Granada está muy agradecida por otorgarle su primer crédito Kiva el cual le permitió comprar zapatos y cosméticos para vender esto le abrió las puertas a conseguir más clientes. Hoy requiere esta crédito para comprar más variedad de zapatos para damas  y caballeros pues desea vender en otras zonas fuera de Granada para tener más clientes y lograr poner un taller de zapatos.
texts.en:
Mery is a modest retailer who makes a living selling shoes in the city of Granada.  She's very grateful for her first Kiva loan, which allowed her to buy shoes and cosmetics to sell.  It also opened the door to getting more customers.

She requires this current loan to buy a greater variety of shoes for women and men.

She wants to sell in other areas outside of Granada to have more customers and be able to set up a shoe store.

loans.use: to buy women's and men's shoes

loans.name: Sayligul

texts.ru: Сайлигул 54 года. Она замужем и имеет 2 совершеннолетних детей и 2 внуков. Сайлигул уже несколько лет планирует организовать свой бизнес и найти источник дохода, так как ее муж имеет маленький доход. Сайлигул участвовала в курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованного Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она планирует организовать бизнес скотоводством. Она будет заниматься купле продажей скота. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 10000 сомони для покупки скота. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Sayligul is 54 years old. She is married and has two adult children and two grandchildren. Sayligul has for some years planned to set up her own business and find a source of income, as her husband has a small salary. 

Sayligul took part in the course "To Get Ahead", organized by the Association for Business Women, and received a certificate. She plans to set up a business of livestock breeding. She will work with buying and reselling cattle. She requests a loan in the amount of 10,000 somoni for purchasing livestock. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To purchase livestock for setting up a new business

loans.name: Yanti

texts.en:
Yanti is a 41-year-old lady and is married to Semi, a 41-year-old man. They are blessed with two children: Martison, 25, who is in college; Helmy, 22, who is a worker.
Yanti has a business selling agriculture products such as vegetables, corn, and coconuts. She usually operates her business twice a week at the local market.  
Yanti was thinking she wants to run another business that can help her in generating more income for her family. She planned to raise piglets and then to sell them. She then requested a loan from TLM in the amount of 10,000,000 IDR (Indonesian Rupiah) to buy piglets.

loans.use: to buy piglets.

loans.name: Olandina

texts.en: Olandina is taking a loan of $1000.00 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as salt, sugar, coffee, fish, oil and slippers. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $200.00. Olandina is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy salt, sugar, coffee, fish, oil, and slippers

loans.name: Davaajav

texts.en:
Borrower Davaajav is a 42-year-old married mechanic and he lives with his family in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. He lives with his wife and three children, two of them attend secondary school and the other child attends kindergarten. He really needs to build a house for his family since Mongolia has four seasons and the weather is very changeable, thus he must have a safe house to live in. 

Davaajav is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT (Mongolian tugrik) loan to purchase necessary housing materials such as bricks and vacuum windows.

loans.use: to purchase housing materials

loans.name: Milton Javier

texts.es:
Milton, vive en la ciudad de Granada , 38 años de edad , se dedica vender comida desde hace 2 años junto con sus hermanas, debido a la escasez de trabajo busco esta alternativa para generar ingresos y mantener  a su familia, se siente muy orgullo de esta actividad que realiza con la esperan za de conseguir una mejor calidad de vida. Él está requiriendo el crédito para comprar arroz, frijoles, aceite, pollo, carne, platos desechables. 
Uno de sus planes es mejorar la cocina de su negocio , tener silla y mesas donde le pueda brindar un mejor servicio a su clientela.
texts.en:
Milton, 38, lives in the city of Granada.  He has made a living for two years selling food with his sisters.  Because of a scarcity of jobs he looked for this alternative to generate income and support his family.  He's very proud of the job he does with the hope of having a better quality of life.

He needs the loan to buy rice, beans, oil, chicken, meat, and disposable plates.

One of his plans is to improve the kitchen in his business and to have tables and chairs so he can provide better customer service.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil, chicken, meat, and disposable plates

loans.name: Pedro Alberto

texts.es:
Pedro es un hombre de 49 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Pisco, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Pedro no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Ingeniería Civil que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta hacer deporte y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Mariscos para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Pedro trabaja brindando atención al cliente en un grifo de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Pedro se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea comprar plásticos, cañas Guayaquil, palos gruesos, esteras y otros, los cuales le servirán de mucho para reforzar las paredes de su vivienda, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para logar su gran sueño de tener una vivienda segura y adecuada.
texts.en:
Pedro is single man of 49 years old who lives in the city of Pisco. He is a very kind, hard-working and enthusiastic man, who puts all his effort into getting ahead. 

Unfortunately, due to lack of financial resources and because of the need to work from a young age, Pedro was not able to study for a Civil Engineering degree like he wanted to. In his free time he likes playing sport and sometimes cooks a delicious meal of rice with shellfish to share with his family. 

On his own initiative, with a lot of determination and dedication, Pedro works serving customers at a petrol station in his city. He works every day for about 10 hours and thinks he is doing well because of his good performance and because of the kind way he treats others. 

Pedro is really grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to their help he is able to improve his home. Now he wants to buy plastics, Guayaquil canes, wide sticks, matting and other things, which he will use to reinforce the walls of his house, and so he will continue working and making an effort to achieve his great dream of having a safe and adequate home.

loans.use: to improve his house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy soft drinks (Coca Cola, Fanta, Sprite, Sagiko), hard drinks (beer), noodles, sugar, coffee, eggs and slippers

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone!

This is 21-year-old Kadiatu from Waterloo Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with two children aged two and five years. She got married at a young age because she wanted to take care of her parent. 

Kadiatu runs a food business and she sells fried fish and chicken moving around her environment to prepare the food. She has been running this business for four years. She works at the business nine hours per day and seven days per week.  Kadiatu says that the main challenge to her business is poor business location.

Kadiatu has requested a loan in order to purchase fish and carton chicken to resell. The extra income generated from this loan will allow her to have a permanent business location so she can stop moving around and increase her business. In the future, she plans to go to a catering school and open a restaurant. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase fish and carton chicken to resell.

loans.name: Yenoh

texts.en:
This is 26-year-old Yenoh from Moribatown Bo, Southern area in Freetown. She is married with two children. She started her business because she wanted to contribute to take care of the home.

Yenoh runs a clothing business and she sells shirts, jeans and blouses. She has been running this business for four years. She works at the business eight hours per day and six days per week.  She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and slow purchasing power of customers during the rainy season.

Yenoh has requested a loan in order to purchase different kinds of clothing. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, she plans to import her goods. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase different kinds of clothing.

loans.name: La Rotonda Group

texts.es:
El señor Jose de estado civil casado, tiene 51 años de edad, no tubo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 6 hijos y 3 de ellos estan estudiando, el se dedica a la agricultura, siembra brocoli, papa y arbeja, inició este negocio trabajando con sus padres y ahora ya se queso solo con el negocio y lleva ya 35 años de larga experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que le servirá para la compra de semillas y fertilizante para sus cultivos, en el futuro proximo desea tener diversidad de cultivos para obtener mejores ingresos, los demás integrantes del grupo se dedican también a agricultura.
texts.en:
Mr. Jose is a 51-year-old married man. He hasn’t had the opportunity for an education. He has six children, three of which are students. He is a farmer who grows broccoli, potatoes and peas. He learned this work from his parents and now he is farming on his own. He has 35 years of experience.
He organized a borrowing group and is asking for this loan in order to buy seeds and fertilizer for his crops. In the future he would like to have a greater diversity of crops in order to increase his earnings. The other members of his group are also farmers.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Shukur

texts.ru: У него трудное условия жизни и низкий доход, но доброе сердце и хороший нрав. Он - Шукур из Таджикистана, которому 55 лет, женат и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Более 6 лет он занимается выращиванием сельхоз культуры, как лук, арбуз и пшеница. Полученный доход он продает на рынке. Так как у него высококачественный урожай, так и его товары имеют большой спрос. Его жена помогает ему в ведении бизнеса. С целью обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами он хочет развевать свой бизнес, а для этого он должен получить больше урожая. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 3500  сомони, чтобы купить 1 га. земли. Доход, который он будет получать от бизнеса, будет использовать для улучшения условия жизни. Он нуждается и ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Shukur lives with difficult living conditions and a low income, but he has a kind heart and good disposition. He is from Tajikistan, 55 years old, married, and the father of four children. He has been farming crops such as onions, watermelon, and wheat for over six years. He sells the harvest at market, where there is high demand for his quality produce. His wife helps with the business too. He would like to grow more crops in order to expand his business and better support his family. He is asking for a 3500 somoni loan to buy a hectare of land. The income which he receives as a result will be used to improve his living conditions. He needs and is grateful for your generosity.

loans.use: To buy 1 ha land where he will grow wheat and watermelon

loans.name: Gulhumor

texts.ru: Гулхумору 25 лет. Она не замужем и живет вместе с родителями. С целью обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами 1 год назад она начала свой бизнес куплей продажей женской одежды и ткани. Она вначале занималась шитьем женской одежды, но так как она не получала большого дохода, она перешла на торговлю. Ее брат помогает ей введение бизнеса. Она реализует свой товар на местном рынке. Гулхумор старается обеспечить своих клиентов высококачественными товарами. Она планирует купить товар для нового сезона, но не имеет достаточного средства для этого. Она запрашивает займ на сумму  7500 сомони для покупки товара для нового сезона. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Gulhumor is 25 years old. She is not married and lives with her parents. A year ago, in order to support her family she began her own business selling women's clothing and fabric. At first she worked as a seamstress of women's clothing, but she did not make a good income so she switched to selling instead. Her brother helps run the business. She sells goods at the local market, and she tries to provide clients with high quality. She is planning to buy goods for the next season, but does not have enough funds so she is asking for a 7500 somoni loan to buy new merchandise. She is grateful for your generosity.

loans.use: To buy clothes and cloth for the new season

loans.name: Memuna

texts.en:
Memuna is 25 years-old and married with two children, She runs a fish business in Moriba town in Sierra Leone. She is a hardworking woman who desires to educate her children.  Her mother was a fish seller and she was trained to fish trade so she decided to go to fish selling as her own profession.

She's been in this business for seven years and she sells dry fish within a busy market area.  She says that her business is doing well because when she goes to the market she has more sales.

Memuna requested this loan through Kiva partner BRAC Sierra Leone in order to purchase more fish to resell. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and buy a generator for her comfort. In the future, she would like to export her fish business to neighboring countries. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Santo Domingo Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Santo Domingo está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde cada una de ella quiere seguir creciendo y dejando la pobreza atrás.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. María, quien con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio está saliendo adelante. Ella se dedica a la venta de verduras frescas que todos los días vende desde muy tempranas horas del día. Ella es una persona muy emprendedora y con muchas ansias de crecer y salir adelante.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de verduras, como ser locotes, tomates, zanahorias, cebollas y demás y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas y seguir luchando por mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
This group, called Santo Domingo, is beginning their second loan cycle. Everyone in the group works and helps each other progress. They are trying to eliminate poverty. Each one of the group members continues to grow and leave their roots of poverty in the past.
One of the members of the group is Mrs. María, who, with much effort and sacrifice, is progressing. She sells fresh vegetables each day beginning early in the morning. She is an enterprising woman with a great desire to progress and move forward.
She is asking for this loan in order to buy vegetables such as squash, tomatoes, carrots, onions, etc. In doing this she can continue with her sales and increase her earnings.

loans.use: to buy squash, tomatoes, carrots, onions and other vegetables to sell.

loans.name: San Lorenzo Group

texts.es:
San  Lorenzo  se encuentra en el 1er. Ciclo del programa de Comité de Mujeres cuenta con 15 integrantes actualmente, es caracterizado por su responsabilidad, agradecen por esta oportunidad que ellas y su familia reciben.
Una de las historias dignas de destacar es el de la señora  Natividad de 36 años, ella es tejedora a partir de los 12 años, ella en compañía de su esposo y sus hijos teje todo tipo de hamacas, frazadas y manteles y lo venden en la ciudad de Carapeguá, teniendo su clientela formada. Ella comenta que gracias al esfuerzo que hizo ha podido crecer y llegar a donde hoy esta.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas, hilos, agujas y demás insumos para poder seguir con sus bordados y también aumentar la cantidad de clientes que tiene.
texts.en:
The San Lorenzo group is in its first loan cycle of the women's communal bank programme and currently has 15 members. It is characterized by responsibility, and the members are thankful for this opportunity that they and their families receive.
