One worthy and notable story is that of 36-year-old Natividad. She has been a weaver for 12 years. In the company of her husband and children she weaves all kinds of hammocks, blankets and tablecloths and sells them in the city of Carapeguá, having her customer base there. 

She says that thanks to the effort she has made, she has been able to grow and get to where she is today. She is applying for this loan to invest in buying fabric, thread, needles and other supplies so she can carry on with her embroidery and also increase the number of customers she has.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, needles and other supplies.

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru: Человек с огромным сердцем доброты и прекрасной душой, который живет далеко от города, имеет прекрасную идею, то есть развевать бизнес. Его зовут Рустам. Ему  43 года, женат, и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Климат его местожительство весьма благополучный для выращивания сельхоз культур, а также для скотоводства. Более 3 года он занимается скотоводством. В основном он занимается выращиванием мелко – рогатого скота. Он имеет 1 крупно - рогатого скота. У него большой огород, где выращивает сено для скота. Он продает скот, за которым он присматривался в течение нескольких месяцев. На рынке у него много клиентов. Рустам хочет развивать свой бизнес, но не имеет достаточного средства для этого. Он запрашивает займ на сумму  3000 сомони для покупки 6 голов мелко – рогатого скота, чтобы развевать бизнес. С полученного  дохода он собирается обеспечить своих детей хорошим образованием и современными технологиями. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: This is a man with an enormous heart full of kindness and a wonderful spirit. He lives far from the city, but has had a wonderful idea, to expand his business. His name is Rustam, and he is 43 years old, married, and the father of four children. The climate in his area is great for growing crops, as well as raising livestock. For the past three years he has been raising animals, primarily small livestock, though he does have one cow. He has a large garden where he grows hay for the animals. He sells the animals after he has raised them for a number of months. He has many customers at the market. Rustam would like to expand his business but he doesn't have the necessary capital. He is asking for a 3000 somoni loan to buy 6 head of small livestock. With the income he earns from the expansion he wants to provide his children with a good education and modern technology. He is grateful for your generosity.

loans.use: To buy cattle for developing business

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Meet 29-year-old Kadiatu from Moriba town in Sierra Leone. She is married with two children aged two years and seven years-old. One of her children is currently attending school. In 2008, Kadiatu established her fish business. She began her business because she needed to create her own source of income instead of depending on her husband alone. She works at the business eight hours per day and six days per week.  She says that the main challenge to her business is transporting the fish which is very difficult as sometimes vehicles break on the way.  

Kadiatu requires a loan in order to purchase more fish to resell. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and pay her child's school fees. In the future, Kadiatu plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell.

loans.name: Mariela Irene

texts.es:
Mariela es una joven muy trabajadora y emprendedora, gracias al esfuerzo que ella ha hecho esta saliendo adelante. Este es su segundo crédito en Kiva, el anterior lo utilizo para la compra de insumos, ya que ella se dedica a la venta ambulante.
Ella agradece por la oportunidad que ella ha recibido, ya que con esto pudo mejorar y crecer. Solicita nuevamente de este crédito para la compra de camisas, remeras, zapatos, zapatillas camisillas y demás para poder seguir con sus ventas y creciendo como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la nueva oportunidad que ella esta recibiendo ya que con ello también ayuda a su familia.
texts.en: Mariela is a young worker and entrepreneur. Thanks to her efforts, she is progressing. This is her second loan from KIVA. The last loan she used to buy supplies for her roving sales business. She is thankful for the opportunities she has received, as with them she has been able to improve and grow. She is asking for this new loan in order to buy shirts, t-shirts, shoes, sandals, blouses and other items so she can continue with her sales and increase her business. She is thankful for the opportunities that she has received as with them she can help her family.

loans.use: to buy shirts, t-shirts, shoes, sandals, blouses and other items.

loans.name: Sharif

texts.ru: Шариф житель района Шахритус. Ему 49 лет. У него жена, трое сыновей и две дочери. В данное время двое его сыновей находятся на заработках за пределами страны. Сам Шариф занимается услугой перевозки грузов. Сейчас Шариф хочет начать бизнес в сфере животноводства. Он планирует каждый месяц закупать по 5-голов крупнорогатого скота, откармливать в течение месяца и продавать с наценкой. Для разведения скота у него имеются все условия. Шарифу в новой детяельсноти будет помогать семья. Кредит запрашивает для закупа 5-голов крупного рогатого скота и его корма.
texts.en: Sharif lives in the Shahrituz district. He is 49 years old, married, and has three sons and two daughters. Two of his sons are currently working as laborers outside of the country. Sharif himself works in freight transportation services. He would like to begin his own livestock business. He plans to buy 5 head of cattle each month, feed them for the month, and then sell them for a profit. He has the necessary space for raising animals, and his family will help with this new work. He is asking for a loan to buy 5 head of cattle and their feed.

loans.use: Buy five head of cattle and their feed

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.ru: Мархабо 46-летняя замужняя женщина. У нее двое дочерей и двое сыновей. Она с мужем и детьми проживает в районе Носири Хусрав, в южной части страны. Ее муж в данное время находится заработках за пределами страны. Мархабо занимается земледелием и за счет этой деятельности покрывает половину семейного расхода. Одновременно она хочет заняться и животноводством. У нее имеется опыт в разведении скота, а также при дворе ее дома построен коровник. Мархабо запрашивает кредит для закупа 6-голов крупного рогатого скота с целью откорма и перепродажи.
texts.en: Marhabo is a 46 year old woman. She has two daughters and two sons. She, her children and her husband live in the Nosiri Khusrav district, in the southern part of the country. He husband is currently working as a laborer abroad. Marhabo farms in order to cover half of the family's expenses. She would like to raise animals in addition to what she already does. She has experience with livestock, and has a small barn for them outside of her home. Marhabo is asking for a loan to buy six head of cattle with the goal of fattening and reselling them.

loans.use: buy six head of cattle for feeding and resale

loans.name: Leonida

texts.es:
La señora Leonidas, es casada, su marido trabaja como guardia privado, la señora es dueña de una despensa y a la vez venta de bebidas en general en su propia casa.
 Es un persona muy trabajadora, responsable y muy honesta, cuenta que empezó a trabajar como vendedora en un supermercado en Asunción, su sueño de siempre era de tener una despensa y ventas de bebidas, ahora ya cuenta su propia despensa bien surtida en la cual trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas.
Ella solicita de este crédito para la ampliación de una parte de su salón de la despensa, para que pueda exhibir mas productos a sus clientes y así seguir creciendo. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe, pues le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en: Mrs. Leonidas is married. Her husband works as a private security guard. She has a small store and also sells drinks from her home. She is hardworking, responsible and honest. Previously she worked as a salesperson in a supermarket in Asunción. Her dream was to have a small store and sell drinks. Now she has her own store with a variety of items. She works there everyday from very early in the morning. She is asking for this loan in order to expand a part of her store. In doing this she will be able to show her customers a greater variety of items and continue to grow her business. She is thankful for the opportunity that she has received as it has been a great help.

loans.use: to expand her store.

loans.name: Shavkat

texts.ru: Шавкат 26-летний холостой молодой человек. Он живет с родителями, двумя сестрами и двумя младшими братьями в районе Кубадиён. Шавкат занимается растениеводством. Сейчас он хотел бы начать новый бизнес и заняться куплей и продажей крупнорогатого скота. Климат и природа его района благоприятствует разведению скота. К тому же Шавкат при дворе своего дома имеет коровник, а также у него есть сбережения для закупа корма. Чтобы начать деятельность ему необходимо закупить скот. Поэтому он обратился за кредитом. Шавкат просит кредит для закупа 2-х голов крупнорогатого скота с целью дальнейшего откорма и перепродажи.
texts.en: Shavkat is a 26 year old bachelor. He lives with his parents, two sisters, and two younger brothers in the Qubadiyon  district. Shavkat farms crops, and now he would like to start a new business selling cattle. The climate and environment of his region is favorable for raising livestock. He also has a small barn and place for storing feed on the family property. However he needs to buy animals, so he is asking for a loan. Shavkat is asking for a loan to buy 2 head of cattle to feed and re sell.

loans.use: Buy two head of cattle for feeding and resale

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! 

This is Agnes who is in her thirties and lives in Torkpoi town Bo. She is married with two children aged three and 13 years-old.  Her children are attending school. 

Agnes runs a palm oil business where she sells palm oil paper and okra.  She has been running this business for two years. She works at the business ten hours per day and seven days per week. Agnes says that the main challenges to her business are that sometimes her purchasing power is low because she doesn't have many items on her table and lack of finances to expand her business.

Agnes has requested a loan in order to purchase food items including rice, onions, cooking oil and maggi. The extra income from this loan will allow her to feed her children and increase her business. In the future, she plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase food items including rice, onion, cooking oil and maggi.

loans.name: Jovenes Luchadores Group

texts.es:
El comité denominado Jovenes Luchadores se encuentra en el 1º ciclo con 5 integrantes, son Jóvenes que tienen deseo y ganas de superación por medio de sus actividades cotidianas para solventar los gastos de la familia y progresar económicamente. Los jóvenes comienzan con su primera actividad con el objetivo de generar sus propios ingresos.
Eduardo es macatero, es decir, vendedor ambulante, se dedica a la venta de hamacas, prendas, calzados y demás. El es un joven que tiene mucha visión y ganas de superarse y salir adelante.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas y calzados, y de esa forma poder seguir teniendo `productos que poder vender.
texts.en:
This group, called “The Striving Youth” is in its first loan cycle. There are five members of the group. They are young people that have the desire to succeed from their activities. They would like to contribute their earnings to help with their family’s expenses and progress economically. These young people are starting their first activity with the goal of generating their own income.
Edward is a roving salesperson. He sells hammocks, shirts, shoes and other items. He is a young person with a vision and the desire to progress.
He is asking for this loan in order to buy shirts and shoes. In this manner he will be able to have products to sell.

loans.use: to buy shirts and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Ajina

texts.en:
Ajina is applying for a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She is running a business in her house by selling gasoline and solar. She is making a good income from selling gasoline and solar, and she wants to buy more stock with the loan. 

She is living in a town nearby the main road, so many people come to buy, and she is selling every day. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her working capital of $400. She is very happy with this program that is helping poor people to improve their living conditions. Her husband is a fisherman.

loans.use: To buy gasoline.

loans.name: Jeneba

texts.en:
Jeneba is 45 years-old and a widow with three children.  Two of her children go to school. She runs a firewood business in Moriba town Bo, in Sierra Leone. She began her business when she lost her husband and decided to run a business to support the home.

She's been in this business for ten years and sells wood and charcoal from her house. She does not have any source of income expect her business. She says that at present her business is doing well.

Jeneba requested this loan through Kiva partner BRAC Sierra Leone in order to purchase more charcoal to expand her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve her standard of living and take care of her children's welfare. In the future, she would like to change her business to a provision shop. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal in order to expand her business.

loans.name: Savad

texts.en:
Savad was born in Kapan city. He is 47 years old. After marriage, Savad moved to live with his wife in the village of Geghi, which is in the Kapan area. He has two sons; the elder one is married and lives separately from his parents. Since 1994, Savad has been engaged in an agricultural business with his wife. This is the main source of Savad’s family income. 

Savad has a large plot of land near his house where he grows fruits and vegetables. He has also a large barn for animals; he breeds cows, chicken, and rabbits and has many beehives. The big part of his agricultural income comes from beekeeping. All of his agricultural products, Savad sells in the fruit markets of Kapan and Kajaran cities. 

For Savad, this is first loan from Nor Horizon and Kiva. He needs a loan of 1,100,000 Armenian drams to buy seeds, diesel fuel, seedlings, fertilizers and fodder for his animals. He hopes to receive a good profit in the nearest future.

loans.use: To buy seeds, diesel fuel, seedlings, fertilizers and fodder for his animals.

loans.name: San Pedro Pablo Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Pedro Pablo está en su ciclo número 9º , todas ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza para conocer la situación de cada una de ellas. 4 de ellas están en el nivel rojo, es decir con ingresos muy bajos.
Carmen es una de estas mujeres, ella se dedida a la venta de cosméticos de variadas marcas, comenta que ya tiene una buena clientela pues siempre tiene muy buenos productos que ofrecer a sus clientas. Ella suena con poder tener algún dia un salón donde vender sus productos y no tener que hacerlo de forma ambulante.
Solicita este crédito para invertirlo en la compra de cosméticos, y de esa forma poder seguir haciendo sus ventas e invertir en su microemprendimiento.
texts.en:
The group called San Pedro Pablo is in its 9th loan cycle. All the members are currently carrying out an inquest into the elimination of poverty in order to know the situation of each one of the women. Four of them are at the “red level,” that is to say, having very low incomes.

Carmen is one such woman. She sells cosmetics of varied brands, and comments that she has a good clientele already because she always has very good products to offer her customers. She dreams of being able one day to have a salon where she can sell her products and not have to do so in the streets on foot.

Carmen is requesting her loan to invest in the purchase of cosmetics, and in this manner, to be able to continue making her sales and investing in her micro-enterprise.

loans.use: buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of bananas for resale, to earn more.

loans.name: Atamjon

texts.ru: Атамчон живет в сельской местности, в далёком от города кишлаке. Родился 1965 году. Он имеет большой десятилетний  опыт в сфере животноводство.  Еще его отец занимался разведением скота и Атамчон с детство помогал отцу.  Теперь это и его доход и заработок на жизнь. Он вырос  пошёл по стопам отца. Начал  Атамчон свое дело с пяти голов барана. Поначалу ему было нелегко, особенно в зимнее время.  Но годами опыт доказывал своё и Атамчон стал находить пути решения препятствий и способы для лучшего продвижения своего дела. Теперь на сегодня он имеет более пяти  голов быка и недавно купил корову.  Его жена и пятеро детей также помогают ему  в этом деле.  По мимо разведения скота Атамчон подрабатывает дополнительно разнорабочим  для проживания, обучение детей и  на ежедневные расходы. В связи с сезонностью он не может продать своих скотов сейчас, так как цены на них упали.  Атамчон нуждается в дополнительных  денежных средствах для дальнейшего откорма скота и приобретения нового скота. С этой целью он обратился в МДО «Арванд» за кредитом. На полученный кредит планирует купить скот а также  корм для скота. Выражает благодарность Арванд за содействие и огромную роль в его жизни.
texts.en: Atamjon lives in a rural area, far from the city of Kishlak. He was born in 1965. He has extensive experience in animal husbandry. His father raised livestock and Atamjon helped him from a young age. Now it is his livelihood; he has grown up and followed in his father's footsteps. He began his business with five head of sheep. It wasn't easy at first, especially in winter. But with years of experience he came into his own and found his way to methods and decisions to improve his work. Today he has over five head of cattle, and recently bought a female cow. His wife and five children also help. In addition to animal husbandry Atamjon also works as a contract laborer to earn more money for his children's education and daily expenses. Because of the season he cannot currently sell his animals, as the price has fallen. Atamjon needs additional capital for further feeding and to purchase new animals. With this goal he came to Arvand for a loan. He is planning to use the loan to buy livestock and feed. He is grateful to Arvand for their support and the huge role they play in his life.

loans.use: to buy cattle and cattle feed

loans.name: Nushik

texts.en:
Nushik is a businesswoman who lives in a beautiful town called Kapan. She is a widow and has three sons. Nushik has graduated vocational school and has a trading specialty. Her life has been very hard and tragic.  She was very young and her sons were very small when her husband died and she brought up her children alone. She has worked hard and done her best to bring up kind, honest, diligent and clever people. Today, her sons are grown up. married and live separately with their families. 

Nushik lives alone now and has her own business. Nushik was in an agricultural business but it was too hard for her so she decided to start her own business. She has a private small store in Kapan where she sells candies, sweets, dairy,meat and bakery products, oil, juices, etc. Nushik purchases these products from Kapan wholesale markets and also distributors from Yerevan.  Nushik has many loyal customers who buy their needed products only from her market. 

Even though Nushik has no higher business education she has had great success in the trading business. This is the second loan from Kiva and Nushik wants to cooperate with Kiva lenders and Nor Horizon again in order to enrich the assortment for her market. She needs 1.000.000 Armenian drams in order to do so and she knows that her business will grow with the help of this support.

loans.use: to enrich the assortment of her market.

loans.name: Garik

texts.en:
Garik is 36 years-old and he lives with his family in Kapan. After graduating secondary school, Garik studied at the Art School. Garik is married and lives with his wife, two daughters and retired mother. Garik’s father died when he was very young and Garik became the only breadwinner in their family. Now Garik works at Kapan Mining Combine as a miner. 

From childhood, Garik has liked to do paintings, different sculptures and souvenirs. Garik successfully sells his handmade souvenirs and paintings at the Kapan market but the income is sometimes not enough to cover all the needs of his family, that is why he has asked for a loan of 900.000 Armenian drams in order to buy machine-tools, raw materials (wood) and different tools that he needs. Garik needs this loan very much and he will be very happy and thankful to Kiva to have it as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy machine-tools, raw materials (wood) and different tools.

loans.name: Arevik

texts.en:
Here is a young business lady with a very shining name, Arevik, which in Armenian means ''Sunny.'' She is 36 years old and lives with her husband and two sons in Kapan city. She graduated from Kapan State Medical College, and after graduating, she has worked as a nurse in a Kapan hospital. Her husband is a driver and works in a taxi service in Kapan. 

As her nursing salary is too low, Arevik decided to run her own business in Kapan. Last year, Arevik rented a stall in the Kapan clothes market and started to sell children's and women's clothes, which she buys from the Yerevan wholesale markets and transports to Kapan with her husband's support once a month. Arevik is very appreciated by her new occupation and as she confessed, the trading business is more profitable. Profit from the business allows her to meet her family's needs. At the same time, she couldn't give up her medical profession, and from time to time, she helps people in her surrounding area if they need it.

Arevik asks for a loan from Kiva to buy a new assortment of women's and children's clothes for the summer season in order to sell them in her stall in the Kapan clothes market. She hopes that this first deal with Kiva will be very successful and profitable for her.

loans.use: To buy a new assortment of women's and children's clothes.

loans.name: Copaleras Group

texts.es:
La señora Priscila de estado civil soltera tiene 41 años de edad, curso los 6 años de educación secundaria, tiene 4 hijos y 2 de ellos estan estudiando, ella se dedica a elaboracion de guipiles tipicos, inició este negocio ayudando a su madre y hasta el momento lleva 25 gandes años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de hilos para elaborar guipiles típicos, en el futuro desea tener operarios para producir mas guipiles y vender por mayor, las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a tejer guipiles. En la fotografia aparecen 6 personas, pero solamente se le concedió el credito a 5 de ellas.
texts.en:
Priscila is single and 41 years old.  She has studied six years of secondary school.  She has four children and two of them are studying.  She works making huipiles (traditional garment worn by indigenous women).  She began this business helping her mother and now has 25 years of experience.  

She organized the group and is requesting the loan which she will use to purchase threads to make traditional huipiles.  In the future, she would like to have employees in order to produce more huipiles and sell wholesale.  The other group member also work weaving huipiles.  In the photograph, there are six people shown, but only five of them have been granted the loan.

loans.use: to purchase threads for weaving.

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en:
Ruzanna lives with her family in Bargushat village which is in Syunik Province near Kapan. For 33 years, she has farmed and during these years she and her husband have made their farm bigger and richer. They have five cows, three calves, 12 chickens, 12 sheep, six goats and 10 turkeys. Ruzanna also has rented land which serves as a pasture and a piece of private land where she cultivates vegetables and fruits. 

Ruzanna is an interesting as besides all this work that she is doing at her farm she also works as a librarian at the Kapan library. All the products that Ruzann has from her farm she sells at the Kapan and Kajaran wholesale markets.

Ruzanna has a great practice of cooperation with Kiva lenders and this is the third loan that she wants to take. She is sure that the third loan, in an amount of 1.000.000 Armenian drams for buying three cows, will be as profitable as the first and the second ones.

loans.use: to buy three cows.

loans.name: Gulom

texts.ru:
Гулом мужчина в возрасте 30 лет, живет в сельской местности Дж. Расуловского района.  Он женат имеет, троих детей сын и две дочки.  Дети ходят в детский сад. Жена домохозяйка.    Не смотря на свой  возраст, Гулом очень старательный предприниматель и имеет большой опыт в откорме крупно рогатого скота.    Он покупает  телят , откармливает их 4, 5 месяцев, продает их  мясникам.    
Гулом очень целеустремленный человек,он также в 2010 году решил заниматься купля продажей корма для КРС.   Корм покупает из дальнего региона, привозить и продает.   
На данный момент  Гулом решил получить  кредит, для покупки двух быков для дальнейшего развития бизнеса и   он очень благодарен организации  "Арванд"  за помощь и поддержку.
texts.en: Gulom is a thirty year old man, who lives in rural J. Rasulov district. He is married and has three sons and two daughters. The children are in primary school and his wife is a housewife. Despite his age he is a very diligent entrepreneur and has extensive experience with raising cattle. He buys bull calves, feeds them for four or five months, and sells them to butchers. Gulom is a very goal oriented person. In 2010 he decided to buy and sell cattle feed. He buys the feed from a distant region, transports it, and sells it. Currently Gulom would like a loan to buy two bull calves in order to further develop his business. He is grateful to Arvand for its help and support.

loans.use: to buy a cattle

loans.name: Astghik

texts.en:
Astghik is 64 years-old. She is a pensioner and lives with her husband in Kapan city. She has two daughters and a son which are all married and who live with their families separately.

Pensioner’s stipends in Armenia are very low and Astghik and her husband have to work in order to sustain their family. Since 2008, Astghik and her husband are engaged in a clothing business. They rent a stall in the Kapan clothes market and they sell children and women's clothes which they buy from Yerevan clothes wholesale markets once a month. Astghik is very happy that she is able to meet her family needs and help her children with her business income. 

This is the first deal with Kiva for Astghik and she asks for a loan of 600.000 Armenian drams in order to buy a summer clothes assortment for her stall in Kapan.  She hopes that with Kiva lenders support she will receive good profits.

loans.use: to buy a summer clothes assortment for her stall.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
Cesar  tiene 25 años de edad, es soltero, y  vive aun con sus padres. Cesar se inició en su negocio de  hace 2 años aproximadamente. Comenzó con el capital que su papa le dio para el negocio ya que quería independizarse.
Su negocio es la venta de repuestos para motos, en donde está empezando a ganar sus propios ingresos y de esa forma ayudar a su familia con el día a día.
Este crédito le servirá para comprar más repuestos para motos, como ser  cubiertas, cámaras, pistones, aros, etc. Agradece por la ayuda que este recibiendo, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Cesar is 25 years old. He's single and still lives with his parents. Cesar got his start in the business about two years ago. He started out with the capital that his father gave him for his business, because he wished to become independent.
His business is selling spare parts for motorcycles. Because of it he's beginning to earn his own income and therefore help his family on a daily basis.
This loan will help him to purchase more spare parts for motorcycles, such as tires, inner tubes, pistons, rims, etc. He gives thanks for the help he's getting, since that way he'll be able to keep on growing.

loans.use: to purchase tires, inner tubes, pistons, rims, etc.

loans.name: Unidas Group

texts.es:
Unidas está en su ciclo número 15 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 5 integrantes se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, con ingresos muy bajos.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Carmen, quien cuenta que desde siempre ha tenido que trabajar y esforzarse por salir adelante para darle a su familia lo que necesitan. Ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de todo tipo y es por medio de este trabajo que ella tiene los medios para ayudar a su familia. Su meta es seguir trabajando duro para que poco a poco su negocio vaya mejorando.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra prendas de invierno, ya que se acerca el frío y de esa forma podrá tener más prendas que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Unidas is in its 15th cycle of the Women's Committee program, where they all work and help each other get ahead. They are participating in a study to eliminate poverty, and 5 members are under the poverty line, with very low income. 

One of the members is Carmen. She has always had to work and strive to get ahead to give her family what they need. She sells all types of clothing and this is how she has the means to help her family. Her goal is to keep working hard so that little by little her business will get better. 

She is asking for this loan to buy winter clothing, sine cold weather is coming and this way she can have more clothing to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy winter clothing to sell.

loans.name: Nimer

texts.en:
Nimer, 37, is married and the father to three sons and one daughter. For the past two-and-a-half years, he has operated a motorcycle repair shop (he is pictured here in his workshop). 

Nimer has the ideal experience for this work, and his workshop is the only one of its type in the area where he lives. His workshop has been a profitable project, and the only source of income to the family, but it also needs support to cover costs.

Nimer is requesting a Murabaha loan (see explanation below) from Palestine for Credit and Development to help cover the costs of purchasing a new motorcycle repair kit. This investment will improve Nimer's quality of work and increase demand from his customers to repair their motorcycles. It will also increase Nimer’s income and provide better living conditions for him and to his family.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle repair kit

loans.name: Abeer

texts.en:
Abeer is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo.

Abeer is a 35-year-old married woman and a mother to one son and two daughters. She is a housewife and her husband is a guard in a residential building who earns a small salary which is barely enough to cover the family's needs.

Abeer is requesting a 1,500 USD loan from Kiva partner FATEN in order to help her cover the cost of purchasing new living room furniture and curtains in order to improve the living conditions in her house. Taking this loan will offer to Abeer and her family comfortable furniture so they can enjoy living in their house.

loans.use: to purchase new living room furniture and curtains.

loans.name: Gibrilla  S.

texts.en:
This is 29-year-old Gibrilla. He is married and has two children, aged eight and two. One is a school-going child. In 2009, Gibrilla established his clothing business which sells jeans, shirts, polos, Lacoste, crepe, coats and other items. He began his business because he dropped out of school at Form V due to a lack of sponsorship. His mother-in-law gave him some money to start his business and the business has grown from a stall to a boutique.  

Working seven days a week and eleven hours a day, he earns about Le2, 200,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 6,000,000. Gibrilla has already received and successfully repaid two loans. He now requires a new loan in order to buy more clothing for his business. 

Gibrilla is yet to achieve his dreams of building his own dwelling house, opening an outlet and becoming an international business man. However, he used the proceeds of his last loan to provide livelihood for his family and pay school fees for his child.

Gibrilla's desire is to continue to support his children’s education up to the University level. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more clothing for his business.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
Santiago es una persona muy trabajadora, que se ha esforzado mucho desde joven, empezó con un trabajo de vendedor ambulante y con mucho esfuerzo pudo montar su comedor y venta de bebidas. Hoy en día ya tiene un negocio donde tiene mucha clientela que siempre acude a su negocio.
El quiere seguir trabajando, es por eso que se esfuerza al maximo por salir adelante.El solicita de este crédito para la compra de carne, condimentos, verduras y demás insumos para poder utilizarlos en su comedor y de esa forma seguir dando un buen servicio a sus clientes. Agradece por esta oportunidad que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
Santiago is a very hard-working person who has been trying his hardest ever since he was young. He got his start by working as a street vendor and through a great deal of effort he succeeded in setting up his eatery and beverage store. Nowadays he already owns a business with a large clientele that always comes to his store.
He wishes to keep on working, and that's why he works as hard as he can in order to get ahead. He requests this loan in order to purchase meat, condiments, vegetables and other supplies so that he can use them in his eatery. That way he'll continue to provide good service for his customers. He gives thanks for the opportunity he's getting.

loans.use: to purchase meat, condiments, vegetables and other supplies.

loans.name: Amado Argiro

texts.es:
Amado de 67 años de edad, se ha caracterizado por ser un padre ejemplar, asegura que su familia es su mayor prioridad y la razón fundamental por la que busca un futuro mejor.
Es padre de siete hijos, a los cuales les ha brindado educación gracias a su trabajo. Se dedica a la venta de comida rápida como medio de sostenimiento para su hogar. Hoy se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de insumos con el fin a de aumentar las ventas y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Amado is  67 years old. He is described as being an exemplary father. He says that his family is her biggest priority and the main reason he is looking for a better future.  

He is the father of of seven children whom he has given an education thanks to his work. He works selling fast food as a way of supporting his family. Today he is asking for a loan Today he is asking for a loan that he will invest in buying materials to increase his sales and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic family basket necessities to make fast food.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This borrower is 36 years-old. She is married and has four children aged 9, 11, 15, and 19 years. In 1996, she established her rice business. She started her business because it would help her husband and her family and, also help to build a house on her land. Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 800,000 every month. 

She would like a loan of Le 4,000,000 in order to buy more bags rice. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000.

She used income from her last loan to support her family and pay school fees for her children. Her business improved as she is now having more customers compared to last year.

She was not able to open a new shop because she was not able to get the space. She is very determined and hardworking. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for 80 bags of rice.

loans.name: Adamsay G

texts.en:
This is 37 year-old Adamsay G. She is married to a driver and has five children aged 18, 16, 11, 8 and 4 years. Four of the children are going to school. In 1993, Adamsay G. established her groundnut business. She began her business because her parents did not allow her to go to school as she had to take care of the younger ones and assist her mother in selling local foodstuffs.  After she was fully grown, her mother gave her some money to start her own business. Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,400,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan of Le 5,000,000. Adamsay G. has already received and successfully repaid three previous loans and now requires a new loan to purchase bags of groundnuts for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000.

Adamsay used revenue from her last loan to provide livelihood for her family and pay school fees for her children. 

In the future, Adamsay G. plans to build a house, educate her children to the tertiary level and to have a store. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase groundnuts to sell.

loans.name: Ya Marie

texts.en:
This is 44-year-old Ya Marie. She is widowed and has five children aged 7, 10, 13, 16 and 21. Four are going to school. In 2002, Ya Marie established her tie-dyed clothing business (bedspread, gowns, lappas, etc.). Ya Marie didn't attend school, but used to assist her elder sister in business. When she got married, her husband gave her some money to start a business.  

Working seven days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le1, 600,000 every month. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. Ya Marie requires a loan in order to purchase more clothing for her business.

Ya Marie used profits from her last loan to support her family and pay school fees for her children. She was not able to gather enough money to start building or to travel to perform her Hajj. However, she still plans to eventually build a house, provide quality education for her children and perform Hajj. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to resell.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
A loan of $600.00 is offered to Cristina to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as coffee, sugar, water, cigarettes body loosens, break biscuits and noodles. She has been involving herself in business activities since 2002. She feels comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Cristina independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy coffee, sugar, water, cigarettes, body loosen , break biscuits and noodles.

loans.name: Santina

texts.en: Santina is applying for a loan of $1,000.00 in order to improve her business. She is running a business in her house selling gasoline.  She is making a good income from selling gasoline and she wants to buy more stock with the loan. She is living in a town near the main road so many people come to buy and she is selling every day. She opened her kiosk a year ago with a working capital of $100.00.  Her husband is a farmer.

loans.use: to buy gasoline.

loans.name: Yanoh

texts.en:
This is 39-year-old Yanoh. She is single with a 23-year-old child as well as a foster child, who lives with and is dependent on her. 

In 2009, Yanoh established a business selling necklaces, earrings, bobbles, lip gloss, eye makeup, weaving caps, etc. She began her business because she did not attend school, due to her parents’ lack of interest in education.  

Yanoh used to assist her mother in business and sell to people on commission.  She used her commission to start petty trading. Working seven days a week, 10 hours a day, she earns about 1,325,000 Leones every month from her business. 

Yanoh would like a loan of 3,000,000 Leones to buy additional jewelry and makeup. This loan will help her increase her income. In the future, she plans to open a shop, build a house and educate her foster child.  

Yanoh is a hardworking business woman and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy packets of beads, necklaces, earrings, eye makeup, weaving caps, etc.

loans.name: Joanina

texts.en: Joanina is taking a loan of $1,000.00 in order to improve her business. She is married and is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as noodles, cigarettes, sugar, coffee, gasoline and biscuits. She opened her kiosk in 2011 with her own working capital of $200.00. Joanina is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.  She is very happy that Kiva partner TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) offers loans for poor people.  The loans have improved her living condition and attended for her child to find school. Her husband is a fisherman.

loans.use: to buy noodles, cigarettes, sugar, coffee  gasoline and biscuits.

loans.name: Beda Elid

texts.es: Beda de 32 años de edad, es una mujer llena de sueños y con un proyecto de vida claro. Se dedica al oficio de la confección a terceros desde hace 10 años, el cual se ha convertido en su actividad económica para el sostenimiento de su familia. Sueña con tener un gran taller con su propia marca y brindar la oportunidad de generar empleo  a las personas de más bajos recursos de su localidad. En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de telas con el fin de sacar una producción que le han solicitado. Espera que con dicha inversión pueda mejorar la calidad de vida en su hogar y satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en: Beda, 32, is a woman full of dreams with a clear life project. She has been making garments for third parties for 10 years and it has become her main means of financial support for her family. She dreams of having a big workshop with her own brand and the opportunity to create jobs for people with less economic resources in her area. Currently she asks for a loan to buy fabrics with the goal of finishing a product that has been ordered from her. She hopes that with this investment she can improve the quality of life at home and meet the demands of her customers.

loans.use: to buy fabrics.

loans.name: Brayan Esneider

texts.es:
Brayan es un joven de 18 años de edad, amante a las motocicletas, pasión que le permitió desarrollar el potencial para la mecánica. Desde hace un año se dedica a la reparación de motocicletas. Actividad que se ha convertido en la forma de ganarse la vida y ayudar en su casa con los gastos del hogar. Sueña con ingresar a la universidad y perfeccionar sus conocimientos con el fin de expandir su negocio y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
Con el fin de garantizarles a sus clientes  un se servicio de calidad, Brayan se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de herramientas de mano.
texts.en:
Brayan is an 18 year old young man who loves motorcycles. This passion has allowed him to develop his potential as a mechanic. For a year he has worked repairing motorcycles. This activity has become the way he earns his living and helps his family with the household expenses.  He dreams of going to college and perfecting his knowledge in order to expand his business and improve his family's quality of life. 

In order to guarantee his customers quality service, Brayan is asking for a loan to invest in buying hand tools.

loans.use: to buy hand tools

loans.name: Zahr

texts.en:
Zahr, 41, is married and mother to two sons and two daughters. She is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband, Mamdooh, appears in her Kiva profile. This picture was taken in his grocery store.

Zahr is a housewife; her husband earns a low pension, which is not enough to cover the family's needs. For the past five years, Zahr's husband has had a grocery store, selling different types of groceries. This has been a profitable project but it does not generate enough to cover costs.

Zahr is requesting a Murabaha loan (see below for explanation) from Palestine for Credit and Development to help her husband purchase the basic groceries that customers often request, such as rice, sugar and milk, and to improve the store's condition with the installation of additional shelves. These investments will increase sales and the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase a stock of basic groceries and make improvements to the store's condition

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is applying for a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She is running a business in front of her house by doing motorcycle services. She is making a good income from her motorcycle services, and she wants to buy more parts with the loan and pay for the mechanic who works for her. 

She is living in a town nearby the main road, so many people come to fix their motorcycles. She opened her business in 2002 with her own working capital. Her husband is a mechanic.

loans.use: To buy more parts and pay the mechanic.

loans.name: Maa Tarini Group

texts.en: Ranjita is an active and energetic married lady, who is 45 years old and a permanent resident of Bolangir town of Odisha, India. Bolangir district is one of the underdeveloped areas of Odisha. The lady in the middle with the raised hand in the photograph is Ranjita. Ranjita lives with her husband and two sons, who are 6 and 4 years old. To work and earn some income, Ranjita started a home shop business five years ago with her own investment. In 2010, when Ranjita got confidence in being able to run this business, she and five other like-minded women of her locality formed a group named Maa Tarini for availing loans from Mahashakti Foundation to develop their businesses. Ranjita specially sells ladies fancy items like bangles, talc, plastic items, cosmetics, ornaments, etc., from her house. Apart from that, she has a tailoring machine stitching ladies garments. Ranjita buys stock for her home shop in her town. Presently, she is selling fancy items worth 300 Indian rupees (INR) to 500 INR per day, from which she gets 15 to 20% profit. From this small income, she barely manages her family's expenses. So, she wants to increase the volume of her business to increase her income. With this present loan, Ranjita wants to purchase ladies fancy items and different varieties of bangles. Ranjita is confident enough to have a business of her own and hopes to give a better education to her two sons. The other five energetic group members are Ful, Kousalya, Nirupama, Duhita and Saibalini who are running a carpenter and meals supply, broiler, meals hotel, vegetable vending business and tailoring centre respectively.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing bangles, talc, plastic items, cosmetics, ornaments, etc.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos Alberto de 38 años de edad, considera que haber creado su propio negocio ha sido la mayor bendición que ha recibido. “Gracias a esta fuente de empleo hoy mi familia tiene un futuro mejor” estas son las palabras con las que Carlos narra su principal motivo de felicidad.
Asegura que las ventas en el sector son buenas y que lo único que le ha preocupado son algunos clientes que no cancelan la cuenta. Pero a pesar de inconvenientes como este, el siempre mira adelante con la satisfacción y el anhelo de un mejor porvenir. Hoy desea incrementar su nivel de ventas, por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de surtido (bebidas y mecatos)lo que le permitirá mejorar la calidad de vida en su hogar.
texts.en:
Carlos Alberto is 38 years old.  He believes that starting his own business has been the best blessing he has received.  Carlos says about his motivation for happiness, "thanks to this source of employment, today my family has a better future." 

He ensures that his sales are good and the only thing that worries him are that some customers do not pay off their bill.  In spite of these problems, he always looks ahead with satisfaction and the hope of a better future.  

He wants to increase his level of sales, so he is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of merchandise (drinks and cakes), which will allow him to improve his household's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase drinks and cakes.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 46 years old, married, and a mother to four children. She is a resident of Kagadi, Uganda, and is currently building a home for her family.

Mary owns a retail shop where she sells general merchandise. She has been in this business for 13 years, and also farms to supplement her business. A major challenge she faces is inadequate capital. Mary is requesting a loan to buy sugar, soap, and cooking oil to sell in her shop. 

She dreams of working in the wholesale industry in the future.

loans.use: to buy sugar, soap, and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en: Carolina is applying for a loan of $1,000 from TRM (TubaRaiMetin). She is 30 years old. She is running a kiosk in front of her house. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as soft drinks (CocaCola, Sprite, Fanta, Sagiko), hard drinks (beer), noodles, sugar, coffee, salt bread and fish. She is making good money from selling and she wants to apply for bigger loan in the future. Carolina is living in a town near by the school; her kiosk is located in a strategic place where many people come to buy including students.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks (CocaCola, Sprite, Fanta, Sagiko) and hard drinks (beer), noodles, sugar, coffee, and salt bread.

loans.name: Crhristian

texts.es: Christian de 28 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de mercancía (ropa) desde hace 6 años, debido a que por su inexperiencia en el mundo laboral, le fue difícil conseguir empleo y necesitaba generar ingresos para colaborarle a su madre con los gastos del hogar. Esta actividad, al aprendió de forma empírica y hoy es un gran maestro en el mundo de los negocios. Se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de surtido con el fin de satisfacer la demanda que tiene actualmente. Sueña con tener una cadena de almacenes y comenzar a importar.
texts.en: Christian is 28 years old. He has sold merchandise (clothes) for 6 years. Due to his work inexperience, it was difficult for him to get a job to help his mother with the household expenses. He learned this activity on the job and now he is a master in the world of business. He is asking for a loan to invest in buying stock to satisfy the demand his customers have right now. He dreams of having a chain of stores and starting to import.

loans.use: to buy clothes wholesale.

loans.name: Pert's Group

texts.en:
A married father of three children, Pert is 32 years old and lives in a rural village of Moung Russey, Cambodia. Of his three children, two are still dependent on him for support and attend school. To support their family, Pert and his wife farm rice and plant cassava as a main source of income. They have been in this business for 10 years.

Pert is in his third cycle with VisionFund. He paid back his previous loans, which has helped relieve his family’s burden. He is now leading a group of two to apply for another loan. He plans to use his portion of the loan to purchase fertilizers, pesticides, and seeds for his farmland, as well as to pay for labor. 

He hopes this loan will enable him to increase his family’s income and to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, pesticides, and seeds for his farmland

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel de 21 años de edad, es un joven emprendedor, gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación hoy cuenta con su propio negocio dedicado a la recarga y venta de extintores, Sueña con ampliar su negocio y mejorar las ventas, razón que lo ha motivado a solicitar un crédito que invertirá en la compra de mercancía y la adecuación del local para la prestación de un mejor servicio.
Desea ingresar a la universidad y graduarse como un gran administrador. Asegura que su mayor prioridad es su familia, por lo cual se esfuerza a fin de garantizarle a su madre una calidad de vida digna.
texts.en: Daniel is 21 years old and is a young entrepreneur. As a result of his hard work and dedication, he has his own business refilling and selling fire extinguishers. He dreams of growing his business and improving his sales, and for this reason, he is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of supplies and to improve his store so that he can offer a better service. He hopes to go to college and graduate as a successful businessman. He states that his priority in life is his family, and that is why he will do his best to be able to give his mother a decent quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fire extinguishers.

loans.name: Gabriel Jaime

texts.es:
Gabriel Jaime, es un gran emprendedor, un hombre con grandes retos a nivel personal y profesional. Se encuentra casado y tiene un bebe de tres meses de edad. Asegura que su familia es lo más importante y que su bienestar es su tarea más importante. 
Cuenta que la cocina es una de sus grandes pasiones, por lo cual desea perfeccionar el arte y capacitarse en la elaboración de bizcochos y cubiertas con el fin de crear su negocio en un futuro próximo. En la actualidad no cuenta con los recursos económicos para dicha inversión por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito para comenzar a capacitarse.
texts.en: Gabriel Jaime is a great entrepreneur and a man with great personal and professional challenges.  He is married and has a three month old baby and he assures us that his family is the most important thing and their wellbeing is very important.  Cooking is one of his greatest passions and he wants to perfect the art and train himself on making cookies and coverings so he can start a business in the near future.  He doesn’t have the financial resources so he is asking for a loan so that he can begin training.

loans.use: to attend cooking classes.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 31 years old, and is a father to three children aged between 8 and 2. 

He owns a retail business in Kagadi, Uganda where he sells general merchandise. He has been in this business for five years, and in addition to his retail shop, John carries out farming to supplement his earnings. 

John plans to build a good residential house for his family. Inadequate capital is a major challenge to his business. His dream is to own a wholesale shop. John intends to use the loan to buy sugar, water and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to buy sugar, water and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia, de 67 años de edad, es viuda y madre de ocho hijos a quienes crió y educó durante mucho tiempo sola, ya que su esposo falleció hace ya bastante tiempo, actualmente vive en su casa propia con dos de sus hijos pequeños.Delia se dedica a la venta de bebidas gasificadas por eso acondiciono un lugar en su hogar ,en donde antiende a todos sus clientes. Lleva realizando éste trabajo por 2 años y lo hace sola.
Hace mucho tiempo que se dedicaba a la venta de verduras, pero como fue creciendo su negocio, también quiso hacer crecer su inversión y multiplicar su ganancia, así que decidió cambiar de productos y ahora le va mucho mejor, tiene buenas ventas y eso le permite tener mayor ganancia, ahora desea seguir creciendo y poner una fuente de soda en su local.Este será el segundo préstamo con Kiva y está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero para seguir adelante, además se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.Con el monto solicitado de 1500 soles, comprará bebidas gasificadas en mayor cantidad y variedad .
texts.en:
Delia is 67 years old, widowed, and the mother of eight children whom she raised and educated alone over time because her husband passed away a long time ago.  She lives in a home of her own with two of her youngest children.  Delia sells carbonated drinks and set up an area in her home where she serves her customers.  She has done this work alone for two years.

She was selling vegetables a long time ago, but she began growing the business and also wanted to make another investment and multiply her earnings, so she decided to change products and now things are going much better for her.  She has good earnings and now she wants to continue growing and set up a soda fountain in her place.  This will be her second Kiva loan and she is very happy to know that she has financial backing with which to continue ahead.  She is also committed to being on time with her payments.  She will use the 1,500 PEN from this loan to buy a variety of soft drinks in quantity.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks.

loans.name: Om-Amr Group

texts.en:
This group is called Om-Amr which consists of four ladies who live in Taiz, Yemen. They are helpful members who have known each other for many years. They have applied for a loan of 230,000 YER. 

Dhakra is 25 years old, and is a mother of two children. She is the breadwinner, and works to earn household expenses for her family. Dhakra owns an old house which she intends to remodel. She has requested a youth loan of 60,000 YER from AMB in order to buy construction materials to use for remodelling her home. She hopes to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to use for remodelling her home.

loans.name: Anatoliuos

texts.en:
Anatoliuos is a hardworking man aged 25. He operates an internet cafe in the town Kagadi, Uganda, which he started in 2011. His love for computers and improved technology helped him start up this business. 

He describes himself as an ambitious man and dreamx of buying a vehicle and getting married. Anatoliuos is requesting a loan to buy a laptop for use in the cafe.

loans.use: to buy a laptop for use in the cafe.

loans.name: Faber Alonso

texts.es:
Faber es agricultor desde la edad de ocho años, actividad que aprendió de su hermano mayor. 
Hoy a sus 25 años sigue dedicado a esta actividad, la cual se ha convertido en su fuente de ingresos para su sostenimiento. 
En la actualidad tiene sembrados de papa criolla y maíz, productos que comercializa en el mercado del pueblo. Asegura que una de sus grandes pasiones es la ganadería, por lo cual desea alternar las dos actividades y para ello se  encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de una vaca lechera. Asegura que esta inversión le permitirá mejorar la calidad de vida de su núcleo familiar.
texts.en: Faber has been a farmer since he was eight years old. He was taught how to farm by his older brother. He is 25 years old now and continues working in this area, which has now become his main source of income. He currently has Andean potato and maize crops, products that he sells at the local market. He is passionate about cattle rearing and wants to be able to carry out both agriculture and cattle rearing. For this reason, he is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of a dairy cow. He is sure that this investment will allow him to improve the quality of life of his close family.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Frederman Daniel

texts.es: Frederman, originario de Granada se dedica a ofrecer el servicio de transporte de coche fue beneficiado con su primer crédito Kiva el cual utilizo para comprar accesorios para su coche, logro pintarlo, ponerle llantas y darle una mejor apariencia a su carruaje. Ahora desea adquirir otro coche para ir ampliando su negocio pues desea participar en ferias turísticas para promover sus servicios de cochero en Granada ciudad visitada por muchos turistas. Este crédito lo usara específicamente para comprar un caballo y llantas. Esto le permitirá ir armando poco a poco su segundo coche para trabajar.
texts.en: Frederman is originally from Granada and provides transportation services by car.  He got his first Kiva loan which he used to buy accessories for his car, painted it, bought new tires, and gave it a better appearance.  Now he wants to buy another car so he can grow his business and participate in tourist fairs to provide his services in Granada, a city visited by many tourists.  He will use this loan to buy a body and tires.  This will allow him to build his second car little by little so he can work.

loans.use: to buy a body and tires.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a 26-year-old married man with two children. He currently resides in Kagadi, Uganda. 

Julius operates a retail business, and he has been in business for a period of six years. He also raises pigs, from which he earns additional income to supplement his business. He would like to complete his house which he started despite inadequate capital, which is also affecting his business growth. 

Julius is requesting a loan to buy water, sugar and salt to sell.

loans.use: to buy water, sugar and salt to sell.

loans.name: Anatoli

texts.en:
Anatoli is a 28-year-old married man, and is a father to three children. He lives in Kagadi, Uganda.

He owns a spare parts shop where he sells bicycle and motorcycle spare parts. He has been in this business for four years. He also engages in farming maize to supplement his business income.

He dreams of building a residential house for his family and expanding his business to new areas. Anatoli intends to use the loan to buy spare parts to sell.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to sell.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is a 41-year-old married woman with five children, who are all in school. She is employed by local government as a primary teacher, a service she has offered for a period of 18 years. She was inspired by the teaching profession by the way teachers behaved and their smartness. 

She faces a challenge of being paid a low salary, while her dreams are to educate her children up to university, and to build a permanent residential house. Stella is requesting a loan to buy nails and iron sheets to complete construction of her house.

loans.use: to buy nails and iron sheets to complete construction of her house.

loans.name: Evernice

texts.en:
Evernice is a 32-year-old married woman with three children who are all in school. She is employed by local government as a primary teacher, a service she has offered for a period of 12 years. She was inspired to be a teacher by her desire to nurture young people. 

She faces the challenge of being paid a low salary, while her dreams are to build a permanent house and start a retail shop. Evernice intends to use the loan to buy nails and iron sheets to complete construction of her house.

loans.use: to buy nails and iron sheets to complete construction of her house.

loans.name: Erlita

texts.en:
Erlita is applying for a loan to improve her business. She runs a business from her house selling gasoline. 

She makes a good income from selling gasoline, and she would like to buy more stock with the loan. 

Erlita lives in a town near by the main road, so many people come to buy gasoline, and she sells gasoline every day. She opened her kiosk a year ago.

loans.use: to buy more gasoline to sell.

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en:
Celestina is requesting a loan to improve her business. She runs a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store, such as ice and refrigerated soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta) and rice. She opened her kiosk in 2007. 

Celestina is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future. She is married and has three children.

loans.use: to buy ice and refrigerated soft drinks (Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko and Fanta), and rice to sell in her kiosk.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena is 23 years old, and is single. She runs a business from her house selling gasoline. She opened her business a year ago with a start-up capital of $50.00.

Filomena makes a good income from selling gasoline. She is living in a town near the main road, so many people come to buy gasoline, and she is selling gasoline every day.

She is applying for a loan of $1,000.00 to improve her business. She would like to buy more stock with the loan. 

Filomena is very happy with this loan because it will help her to improve her living conditions, and she hopes to apply for a bigger loan in the future.

loans.use: to buy gasoline to sell from her kiosk.

loans.name: Albertina

texts.en:
Albertina is33 years old, and is married with four children. Her husband is a farmer. 

Albertina runs a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She is requesting a loan to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store, such as soft drinks (Sagiko, Fanta, Coca-Cola, Sprite), beer, noodles, sugar, coffee, salt, eggs and cigarettes. 

She opened her kiosk in 2009 with her own start-up capital of $80.00. Albertina is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future. She is very happy that TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) offers loans for poor people, and she hopes to improve her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks (Sagiko, Fanta, Coca-Cola, Sprite), beer, noodles, sugar, coffee, salt, eggs and cigarettes to sell in her store.

loans.name: Kanchi

texts.en:
Kanchi is 30 years old. She is married and has two children; one is aged 7. In 2000, she established her meat shop business. Working six days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family.  

She has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy chickens for her business. In the future, Kanchi plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.   

In Nepal, the meat is always fresh. In small stalls along busy roads, open-air butcher shops sell chicken, goat, and water buffalo by the kilo. The stalls are piled high with product and sales are brisk. With the help of a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase additional stock at better prices. This increase in purchasing volume creates greater profit margins for the borrower.

loans.use: to buy chickens for her business.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es: Francisco es un campesino de una vereda del municipio de Sonsón, Antioquia. Se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería desde su juventud. En la actualidad tiene sembrados de papa criolla y tomate de árbol y cuenta con dos vacas lecheras. Hoy se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de una vaca con el fin de aumentar la producción de leche la cual comercializa entre sus vecinos, mejorando así la calidad de vida de su núcleo familiar y garantizándoles a sus cuatro hijos menores de edad una buena educción. Sueña con sacar adelante a su familia y permanecer siempre en unidad.
texts.en: Francisco is a farmer from a small community in the municipality of Sonsón, Antioquia. He has been working in agriculture and cattle rearing since he was young. He is currently growing Andean potatoes and tamarillo, and he has two dairy cows. He is requesting a loan to buy a cow so that he can increase milk production which he will sell to his neighbors. In this way, he will be able to improve the quality of life of his close family and guarantee an education for his four young children. His dream is to help his family progress in life and for them to remain united.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Secundino

texts.es:
Secundino es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que lucha por poder salir adelante, el sigue trabajando con su empresa de transportes, y también en su venta de articulo de primera necesidad. Cuenta que el crédito anterior que ha recibido de Kiva lo ha ayudado mucho a seguir con su trabajo.
solicita nuevamente de un crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de artículos de primera necesidad, como ser bebidas, comestibles, verduras, frutas y demás, y con ello poder seguir con su negocio. Esta muy agradecido por esta oportunidad que esta recibiendo, ya que este sería su tercer crédito con Kiva.
texts.en:
Secundino is a very hard-working and enterprising person who fights to get ahead. He continues to work in his transport company and his grocery store. He says that the previous loan he received from Kiva really helped him to continue with his work. 

He is requesting another loan so he can invest it in purchasing basic items, such as drinks, food products, vegetables, fruit, and other items, and continue with his business. He is very grateful for the opportunity he is receiving as this will be his third loan with Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase drinks, food, vegetables, fruit, and other items

loans.name: Spartak

texts.en:
Young businessman Spartak is still engaged in his lavash (Armenian bread) production and food shop managing. 

With the first loan from Kiva, Spartak bought some circulating assets for his bread production. His business is going well and enlarged after Kiva lenders' support. His bread production profit allowed him to start a new agricultural business in his village of Tsovagyugh, which is in Sevan area. Spartak and his father built a barn for animals and started their new farming business. 

Spartak breeds cows, bulls and sheep in his farm. Spartak says that it is too hard to be engaged in bread production and farming at the same time, but with his father's help, he does his best in order to enlarge and increase his newly created farm.
 
This time Spartak needs a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian drams to buy two cows and a young calf and hopes to receive a good profit from farming. Spartak is sure that this second loan will have the same success for him.

loans.use: To buy two cows and a young calf.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
This very hardworking lady, Julieta, is still engaged in farming and animal breeding in her lovely village, Tsovagyugh, which is in the Sevan region. She lives with her husband, and they both work hard day and night in order to sustain their family needs, and sometimes, they help their children’s families. 

Thanks to her previous loan from Kiva, Julieta enlarged her animal breeding business, and she added to the number of her bee families. She started to sell more honey of high quality, and not only to her neighbors. The resellers are coming to her farm and buying her tasty and useful honey from her farm. Julieta is very happy and appreciative of her agricultural business.
 
Julieta asks again for a loan from Kiva lenders to buy a lot of fodder for her animals and to buy new beehives.

loans.use: to buy fodder for her animals and to buy new beehives.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en: Simon is 44 years old and living in Masindi, Uganda. He is married and charged with a responsibility of looking after four of his children. A good father that he is, his dream is to educate them up to the University. He deals in a business of cutting grass, and his major clients are schools and hospitals. He also has a transport business. The high cost of fuel and delays in payment affect his business growth, while his dream is to buy at least five mowing machines and hire workers, who will be remitting to him 70% of the earnings. Simon intends to use the loan to buy a mowing machine.

loans.use: to buy a mowing machine.

loans.name: Karangura Farmers Associations Group

texts.en:
Matiya is a 46-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. His main business is selling palm oil, the business he started in 2008 with an aim of improving his family income. He faces hardships of unpredictable weather changes; however, he has a vision of educating his children up to higher levels of learning. 

Matiya is requesting a loan to buy seedlings for planting. He is a member of the above mentioned group, where each one guarantees the other in accessing a loan.

loans.use: to buy seedlings for planting.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en: Godfrey lives in Masindi, Uganda. He is married and is responsible for looking after three children. He is a farmer producing maize and groundnuts and has been farming since 2003. He earns additional income from a salon business. His major clients are produce dealers. His dreams are to construct a permanent house for his residence and to become a model farmer. Godfrey intends to use the loan to pay labor for weeding and to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: to pay labor for weeding and to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en: Andrew lives in Masindi, Uganda. He is married and is responsible for taking care of 10 children. He is a retired accountant who earns a monthly pension. With his salary, he was able to educate his children and most of them are graduates. His dreams are to live a modest life and build rental houses. Andrew intends to use the loan to buy construction materials, such as bricks and sand, to complete his house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials,such as bricks and sand, to complete his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to extend his workshop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and supplies for her family

loans.name: Alvard

texts.en:
Alvard is 51 years old and lives in Aralez village, which is in the Ararat region. Alvard has three children. She lives with her younger son, daughter-in-law and grandchild. Alvard has a higher education; she graduated from State Armenian Pedagogical University. For more than 30 years, Alvard has worked as a teacher in her village school. She has a good reputation as a teacher and many students. But as her teacher’s salary is not high, Alvard at the same time is engaged in farming and an agricultural business. Alvard breeds cows and sheep, and she has a plot of land near her house where she grows potatoes, tomatoes, cucumbers, etc. The products from agriculture, Alvard and her husband sell in the regional fruit markets and Yerevan wholesale markets. The income from agriculture allows Alvard to meet her big family's needs. 

Alvard decided to enlarge her fruit garden and to establish a new apple orchard in her plot of land. For this purpose, she asks from Kiva lenders a loan of 2,000 U.S. dollars. This deal will help Alvard to have a new apple garden, and after few years, she hopes to receive a good harvest from her new garden.

loans.use: To establish a new apple orchard in her plot of land.

loans.name: Rajab

texts.en: Rajab lives in Masindi, Uganda. He is married and has one child. He is a farmer who grows and sells maize and produce. He has been in business since 1998. His major clients are produce dealers. His dreams are to complete his house and educate his child up to the university. Rajab faces challenges of unpredictable weather changes. Rajab intends to use the loan to pay workers for weeding and to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: to pay workers for weeding and to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Adriano

texts.en: Forty-nine-year-old Adriano lives in Masindi, Uganda. He is married and responsible for taking care of six children. He is a farmer and also earns income from selling charcoal. Thieves hinder his business. His dream is to venture into commercialized agriculture. Adriano is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and pay to weed his farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay to weed his farm.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David lives in Masindi, Uganda. He is married and has a retail shop business selling items such as sugar, salt and other general merchandise. His major clients are the general public. He is challenged with inadequate capital while his dream is to expand his business to new areas. David is requesting a loan to buy general merchandise such as salt and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as salt and soap to sell.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: Luis Alberto de 58 años es padre de tres hijos y desde joven ha trabajado en diferentes oficios. Desde hace algunos años decidió independizarse y crear su propio negocio con el fin de compartir más tiempo con su familia y mejorar calidad de vida en el hogar, Es así como creó su miscelánea la cual administra y abre diariamente. En la actualidad desea invertir en la compra de artículos de papelería con el fin de satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes y mejorar la calidad en el servicio, por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito ya que no cuenta con recursos propios. Sueña con garantizarle a su familia una mejor condición económica y a su hijo menor la oportunidad de realizar sus estudios universitarios.
texts.en: Luis Alberto is 58 years old and is the father of three children.  He has been working in different trades since he was very young.  He decided to go out on his own a few years ago and create his own business so he can spend more time with his family and improve the quality of life in his household.  This is how he created his store which he manages daily.  He wants to invest in paper goods so he can satisfy his customer demand and provide better service, so he is asking for a loan because he doesn’t have his own resources.  He dreams of providing better financial conditions for his family and a university education for his son.

loans.use: to buy paper goods.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Armen is still engaged in furniture production in his basement that has been converted into a workshop. He rents a small furniture shop in his town, where he sells furniture that he produced. 

This is Armen’s second loan from Nor Horizon and second deal with Kiva. The previous one helped him to enlarge his furniture production and to add to the number of furniture assortments. He started to produce sofas and armchairs in his workshop. It was new for him, but he overcame all the difficulties and during six months became able to produce high quality upholstered furniture. He has a lot of clients and orders from them because they prefer to buy Armen’s handmade furniture.

Armen asks from Kiva a loan to buy a lot of raw materials for producing upholstered furniture and kitchen furniture. He hopes to make all his orders on time with Kiva lenders' support.

loans.use: To buy a lot of raw materials for producing upholstered furniture and kitchen furniture.

loans.name: Freda

texts.en: Freda is 45 years old and lives in Masindi, Uganda. She is a single mother of four children and is solely responsible for looking after them. She has been a teacher for the last six years and she was inspired into service by her desire to serve her community. Her dream is to educate her sister and children to attain degrees despite limited income. Freda intends to use the loan to pay tuition for her children.

loans.use: to pay tuition for her children.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet is a 45-year-old hardworking woman living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has been dealing in agriculture since 1990 as well as tailoring to increase her income.
