loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Women Of Faith Group

texts.en: This is 33-year-old Hellen from Harare. She is married with three children and two are attending school. She also takes care of her mother and mother-in-law. Hellen runs a clothing and grocery business which sells men's and ladies' clothes. The business has been in operation for 8 years. She says the main challenges being faced are limited quantities of goods required at the border post and high competition levels in the sector. Hellen has requested a loan of 750 USD to buy new clothes for the winter for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will enable her to send her kids to better schools and improve the family's quality of life. In the future, Hellen plans to have a big shop in town.

loans.use: to buy new clothes for resale

loans.name: Fatos

texts.en:
Fatos, who lives in southeastern Albania with his family, is a father and a loving grandfather to his granddaughters, whom he adores. 

A loan of ALL 120,000 (Albanian lek) will help Fatos to replace some damaged parts of his harvester machine that recently broke down and that he cannot afford to repair with his own money.

Fatos has been serving the villagers with his agricultural harvester machine and has also been planting and selling vegetables to locals. “I have been practicing my services for the last fifteen years now and have been able to make a good income and also enjoy helping my fellow villagers,” Fatos said.

loans.use: to repair his agricultural harvester machine.

loans.name: Dúo Pacorral Group

texts.es:
DUO PACORRAL
Doña Flavia es originaria de la aldea Pacorral tecpan tiene 39 años de edad bajo su responsabilidad esta 1 hija menor de edad, ella se dedica a la elaboración de tejidos típicos a mano y a la crianza de animales.
Desde hace años ella viene realizando estas actividades porque es el medio que la ha ayudado para salir adelante con su hija.
El sueño de ella es ampliar mas su negocio ofrecer a sus clientela variedad de tejidos y de esa forma obtendrá mejores ganancias para  dar a su hija una mejor educación  para un futuro mejor,ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboracion de tejidos tipicos
texts.en:
The "Pacorral" Due

Flavia is orginally from village of Pacorral Tecpan.  She is 39 years old and has a daughter who is under the age of 18.  Flavia makes a living weaving typical handicrafts and raising animals.

She has been doing this work for some years now as it has helped her to prosper with her daughter.

Flavia's dream is to expand her business further, offering her customers a greater variety of woven products.  In doing this she will earn a higher income so that she can offer her daughter a better upbringing and a better future.  Flavia is applying for this loan to buy materials to produce her typical, woven products.

loans.use: to buy materials to produce her typical, woven products that she will then sell.

loans.name: Razeem's Group

texts.en:
A member of a two-person group, Razeem is a 30-year-old woman, living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and two children. 

Since 2004, her husband has been running a small vegetable shop. This is the only source of income for their family. Due to the increase in the demand of the customers, Razeem has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, for the expansion of her husband's shop. 

With the loan, her husband can buy a variety of fresh vegetables and fruits that will allow him to offer more varieties to his clients and increase his sales and income. He would also build one more room, to add some more space to his shop. Her husband is a very hard-working and honest man and is confident about his family’s bright future.

NOTE: In the picture, Razeem is raising her hand.

loans.use: to purchase fresh vegetables and fruits and to expand her husband's shop.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a 28-year-old married man. He lives in Tbilisi, the capital city of Georgia with his wife and parents. His parents have a retirement pension. George requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

George has a Donner fast food in the capital city. This is his only source of income. George requested a loan from Credo to start-up a family business. George has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his credit George will purchase a special apparatus for beer, which will be placed in his fast food and George will offer his clients an additional product. This will increase the income and the number of clients. With the increased income George will be able to expand the business in the future. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a special beer apparatus.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in Nkubu, Meru region of Eastern Kenya on the slopes of Mount Kenya. She has been farming for three years. Her main sources of income are eggs, tea leaves, maize and beans.

She wants to increase her poultry farming and has requested a loan of KES 60,000 from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry. The proceeds from this loan will give her more income and thus improve her living standards.The challenges she faces are irrigation and poor climatic conditions.

In five years, she will have opened a milk bar. Mary says that Juhudi Kilimo offers quick services to the farmers.

loans.use: To purchase poultry.

loans.name: Haseena

texts.en:
Haseena is a 27-year-old married woman. She lives in arural area of Lahore, Pakistan. She belongs to a middle-class family. Her husband is the only earning person in the family. He owns a plastic utensils shop which is the only source of income for his family. His monthly income is inadequate to meet the household's needs. 

Currently, he needs to purchase plastic utensils to sell. However due to the lack of cash he finds it difficult. Therefore, Haseena has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase the things that are needed for her husband's business. She hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband. She wants to provide quality education to her children. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase plastic utensils to sell.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 36-year-old, hard-working, and diligent woman. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. 

Her husband has been running a barber shop for three years. Due to the increase in the number of customers, her husband wants to expand his business. For that purpose, Naseem has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. 

Her husband would purchase some new chairs for his shop. He would also buy some items, like a shaving machine, creams, a dryer, and blades. This would increase his earnings and net income. 

Naseem is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase chairs and other supplies for her husband's barber shop.

loans.name: Nighat

texts.en:
Nighat is a 29-year-old woman living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and three daughters. Since 2006, her husband has been running a small vegetable shop and usually sells his vegetables in the central bazaar. 

Nighat has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for the expansion of her husband's shop. With the loan investment, her husband can buy a variety of fresh vegetables that will allow him to offer more varieties to his clients and increase his sales and income. Her husband is very hardworking and honest man and is confident about his family’s bright future.

loans.use: To purchase fresh vegetables for a shop.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
This is 33-year-old Comfort, from Moriba town Bo, a southern area in Sierra Leone. She is married, with three children between the ages of 2 years and 14 years. Her children are going to school. She started business because she wants to stop depending on her husband alone, instead, creating her own income.

Comfort runs a pharmacy business. She sells pads, malarial drugs, and tabs and injections. She has been running this business for five years. She works at the business, six days per week and twelve hours per day. She says, at present, her business is doing well. Out of the profit, she is able to have her source of living.

Comfort has requested a loan in order to purchase more medical drugs, including pads, malarial drugs, and tabs and injections, to expand her enterprise. The extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her children's school fees and change her status of living. 

In the future, she plans to open a big clinic, so that she can help her community from illness. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase more medical drugs, including pads, malarial drugs, and tabs and injections, to expand her enterprise.

loans.name: Celerina

texts.en:
Celerina is 56 years old and married, with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Celerina runs a rug-vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 19,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional rugs to sell.

Celerina has been in this business for ten years. She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional rugs to sell.

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es: La Sra. Maria tiene 58 años, casada tiene dos  hijos, ella se dedica a tejido de variedad de prendas de vestir, ella tiene catálogos de muestras y realiza el tejido según pedido, tiene su taller en la zona de Mario Mercado, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Maria va a usar este préstamo para la compra de lana por mayor para el tejido de prendas  ya que por esta fechas tiene muchos pedidos,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es incremento de capital de trabajo, la Sra. Maria enfrenta retos en su negocio que son surtir su mercadería y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando por mayor sus materiales para el tejido de sus prendas, la Sra. Maria se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria is 58 years old, married, and has two children. She makes a variety of knitted clothing. Maria has a catalog of samples that she uses for demonstration and produces the knitted items to order. Her workshop is in the District of Mario Mercado. This loan is her first cycle with Emprender. Sra. Maria will use the loan to buy wool in bulk for making knitted clothes since she currently has many orders. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to increase her operating capital.

Sra. Maria confronts challenges in her business, such as restocking her merchandise. She will utilize the benefits of this loan to continue buying in bulk the materials that she needs for making knitted clothes. Sra. Maria feels pleased and is appreciative of Emprender for the support that has been provided.

loans.use: to buy wool for making knitted clothes.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Olga, de 42 años de edad , está casada y es madre de 3 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia.El trabajo de Olga consiste en la venta de comidas en un mercado de su ciudad. Ofrece a la venta carnes asadas combinado con porciones de arroz y papa. Complementa sus platillos con la venta de bebidas envasadas o refrescos naturales. Trabaja todos los días con ayuda de su esposo t lleva en este negocio más de 3 años.Le gusta mucho realizar su trabajo porque tiene tiempo para cumplir otras labores durante el día,  además tiene buenos ingresos económicos que le permiten sobrellevar los gastos de su hogar, le gustaría tener un local propio con todos los implementos que necesita para brindar una mejor atención.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 800 soles y está agradecida por el apoyo financiero que necesita para avanzar con su negocio además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.Con el monto solicitado comprará los ingredientes que necesita para preparar sus comidas tales como arroz, carnes, papa y otros.
texts.en:
42-year-old Olga is married and the mother of three children with whom she lives in her own home.  Olga's business is selling meals in a market in her city.  She sells roasted meat with portions of rice and potatoes.  She complements her meal service by also selling pre-packaged drinks or natural soft drinks.  She works every day, with her husband's help, and has been in this business for more than 3 years.  She very much enjoys her work because it gives her time to carry out other tasks during the day.  In addition, she also makes good income which allows her to cover her household expenses.  Olga would like to have her own business premises with all the equipment she needs to provide a better service to her customers.

On this occasion, Olga is requesting a loan for 800 soles.  She is grateful for this financial support which she needs to make progress in her business and pledges to make her repayments on time.  She will use the sum she has requested to buy the ingredients she needs for preparing her meals such as rice, meat, potatoes, etc.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as rice, meat, potatoes, etc.

loans.name: Husan Bano

texts.en: Husan Bano is 49 years old and a married woman. She has three children, all of whom are studying in college. For the past three years, Husan Bano has been selling different types of ready-made clothes, in the Kalaiya market. She currently has a lot of loyal customers, who frequently visit her shop. She has requested the loan amount of Nepalese Rs (NPR) 100,000, which she will use to expand her stock of merchandise. This will enable her to offer a variety of clothes to the customer. Her future plan is to continue expanding her business and to give her children a good education

loans.use: to pay for additional clothes to increase the stock, so that she can meet ever-increasing demand

loans.name: Zaib Un Nisa

texts.en:
Zaib un Nisa is 25 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in the rural area of Lahore, Pakistan.  Her husband is a tailor, which is the only source of income for the family. His monthly income is inadequate to meet the household needs. He is in need of purchasing a machine, but due to the lack of income he finds it difficult. 

Zaib un Nisa is requesting a loan from BRAC Pakistan, which she will use to purchase a machine for her husband's tailoring shop.  She hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband. She wants to provide a quality education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase a machine for her husband's tailoring shop.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane lives in the Nkubu, Meru region of Eastern Kenya, a very productive area situated along the slopes of Mt. Kenya. She is married and has three children, all attending school. She has been a farmer for 15 years. Her major source of income is growing tea.
She has requested a loan of KES 20,000 from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase rabbits. This will bring in additional income and uplift her family's living standards. The challenge she experiences is pests and diseases. In the next five years, she plans to start a hotel business.
Jane says that Juhudi Kilimo is best for her.

loans.use: To purchase rabbits

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en:
Shaheen is a 35-year-old, hardworking and diligent woman. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan along her husband and three children. Her husband has been running a gem stones business for 10 years. He has a shop in the main market of the city. Shaheen has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan.
With the loan, her husband wants to purchase a new variety of rare gem stones. This would attract more customers and his sales would be increased. From the profits, Shaheen would pay the installments of the loan and save some money for the marriage of her children.

loans.use: To purchase gem stones

loans.name: Dina Carolina

texts.es: La Sra. Dina  tiene 32 años, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad en su  tienda de barrio que se encuentran en la zona de Matienzo,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de mercadería para surtir su negocio como abarrotes, dulces y refrescos,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la mucha demanda que tiene y es ahí donde incrementa sus ventas, y necesita surtir su mercadería La Sra. Dina  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que existen varias tiendas en la zona, va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de mas mercadería para surtir su tienda y seguir creciendo más cada día, su deseo para  su negocio es de seguir vendiendo y tener una tienda surtida, así poder hacer crecer su negocio mejorar sus ingresos y por ende mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y de su familia.
texts.en:
Dina, 32, makes a living selling basic necessities in her neighborhood store in the Matienzo area.

This is her first loan sequence with the institution.  She's going to use it to buy merchandise to stock her business with groceries, sweets, and refreshments.

She's requesting this loan because she has a lot of demand, which will increase her sales, and she needs to stock her merchandise.  The challenge Dina faces in her business is competition because there are several stores in the area.  She's going to use her profits to buy more merchandise to stock her store and keep growing every day.

Her desire for her business is to continue selling and to have a well-stocked store so she can make her business grow, improve her income, and, as a result, improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy corn in bulk.

loans.name: Davaa

texts.en:
Mr. Davaa is 57 years old and lives with his wife in a Ger (a Mongolian Traditional Yurt) in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. His wife Tsetsegbold is 49 years old and runs and small retail business in the local market. Davaa has been running his own business, a butcher shop, in a rented area since 2003. He has built a close relationship with his customers and has served the best products to them over the years. He is a well-experienced man. 

He is building a small house and is now requesting loan of 3,500,000 MNT to purchase insulation material and construction material to build an energy efficient house to stay warm during the harsh Mongolian winter.

loans.use: to purchase insulation material and construction material to build an energy efficient house.

loans.name: Vasilika

texts.en:
Vasilika is requesting a loan for Arben, her husband, who is shown in this photograph with her. The loan that they request is an amount of 200,000 Albanian Lek. They will use it to buy iron metal sheets for his welding business. This will be their fifth loan from the same institution, with the previous ones being paid off.

For the past 10 years, he has been practicing welding skills in the surrounding villages and has been generating a good income. Comments from people in their village: “He is very artistic and the railings he makes are so beautiful." "He is a very good person to deal with.” 

Vasilika and Arben appreciate very much what lenders at Kiva do for people in need around the world.

loans.use: To buy iron metal sheets for her husband's welding business

loans.name: Dorotea

texts.en:
Dorotea, 50, is a married woman with eight children, four in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Dorotea has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Dorotea requested a PHP 50000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials like fabric, threads and buttons for her business.

Dorotea has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Dorotea would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like fabric, threads and buttons for her business

loans.name: Salma

texts.en: Salma is a 32-year-old married woman and mother of  three children. She lives in the rural area of Lahore, Pakistan. She belongs to a middle class family. Her husband owns a spare parts shop which is the only source of income for his family. His monthly income is inadequate to meet the household needs. Presently, he is in need of purchasing motorbike parts, such as chains, wheels, tires, headlights, race cables and brake cables the shop. However, due to insufficient income, he finds it difficult. Therefore, Salma has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase the needed things for her husband's business. She hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband. She wants to provide quality education to her children. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy motorbike parts, such as chains, wheels, tires, headlights, race cables and brake cables

loans.name: Ronny

texts.en:
What is your background?
My name is Ronny. I have two children, aged six and four years old. I am married and my wife runs a farm. When I competed high school in 2002, I did not have money to go to college and so I sold small things in the streets. Street-vending made me the person I am today because I came to learn a lot of things about life and about business. 

What will you use the Kiva loan for?
I will use the Kiva loan to add to my operational capital, so that I can be able to serve customers who come and send and receive money from my shop.

What do you love about your business?
I love every aspect of running my own business, especially the fact that it has made me more sustainable. I am now able to provide for my family. It is also nice that I run a business that provides a service to all kinds of people.

What are the challenges that you face in your business?
So far, my business lacks enough working capital. Monze, as a town, has grown and clients have increased with its growth. So, with a small operating capital, it is very hard.

How does your business benefit customers in your community?
My business provides the quickest, easiest, and safest way of moving money in my hometown.

What are your hopes and dreams for the future?
My greatest dreams are to grow into the largest money transfer agent in Monze and to provide services to the expectations of my clients, and Zoona,  which provides the platform.

How will the loan help you?
The Kiva loan will help to boost my operating capital, so that I do not run out of cash whenever my clients need it.

loans.use: to serve customers who want to send and receive money from his shop.

loans.name: Ricardo David

texts.es:
Ricardo de 65 años de edad, es un hombre emprendedor y un gran padre, así lo aseguran sus hijos. Labora diariamente en su tienda en donde comercializa productos de la canasta familiar. Gracias a su actividad ha podido sacar a sus nueve hijos adelante. En la actualidad desea aprender sobre la elaboración de panes con el fin de ampliar su portafolio de productos y aumentar su nivel de ventas, razón por la cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito ya que no cuenta con recursos propios. 
Asegura que capacitarse es una gran oportunidad para mejorar no sólo su calidad de vida sino la de su grupo familiar.
texts.en:
Ricardo is 65 years old, an enterprising man, and a great father -- or so his children tell him. He works daily in his store, where he sells staple items. Thanks to this work, he has been able to take care of his nine children. Currently, he would like to learn about bread-making. His goal is to increase his portfolio of products and to increase his sales. He is requesting a loan because he does not have the resources himself.

He is sure that learning this skill will be a great opportunity to improve not only his own quality of life, but also that of his entire family.

loans.use: to take a bread-making course

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes tiene 50 años de edad y vive en la ciudad de Pilcopata, ella es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que sale adelante. Su actividad económica principal es la venta de frutas y verduras como por ejemplo plátanos, papayas, piñas, tomates, cebollas, zanahorias y otras cosas más.  Desde hace varios años que pertenece al banco comunal “Chacoq” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar verduras como lechugas, cebollas, tomates, papa y otras.  

(La ciudad de Pilcopata es la capital del distrito de Kosñipata dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo dentro del departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Mercedes, 50, lives in the city of Pilcopata.  She’s a hardworking, enterprising woman who is moving ahead.  Her main economic activity is selling fruit and vegetables like bananas, papayas, pineapples, tomatoes, onions, carrots and others.  She’s been a member of the “Chacoq” communal bank for several years and on this occasion needs the loan to buy vegetables like lettuce, onions, tomatoes, potatoes and others.

(The city of Pilcopata is the capital of Kosñipata District in the Province of Paucartambo in Cusco Department, Peru).

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth tiene 28 años de edad y vive en la ciudad de Pilcopata, ella es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que sale adelante. Su actividad económica principal es la venta de productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, fideos, conservas, gaseosas, galletas, dulces, verduras, frutas y otras cosas más.  Desde hace varios años que pertenece al banco comunal “Chacoq” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar sacos de azúcar y sacos de arroz.  

(La ciudad de Pilcopata es la capital del distrito de Kosñipata dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo dentro del departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Elizabeth, 28, lives in the city of Pilcopata.  She’s a hardworking, enterprising woman who is moving ahead.  Her main economic activity is selling basic staples like rice, sugar, noodles, canned goods, soft-drinks, cookies, candy, vegetables, fruit and others.  She’s been a member of the “Chacoq” communal bank for several years and on this occasion needs the loan to buy sacks of sugar and sacks of rice.

(The city of Pilcopata is the capital of Kosñipata District in the Province of Paucartambo in Cusco Department, Peru).

loans.use: to buy sacks of sugar and sacks of rice.

loans.name: Perebeth

texts.en:
Perebeth is married and lives in Bañadero, Ozamis City. To make a living, she owns and manages a transportation service, providing motor transport services. She earns 12,000 PHP a month and has been in this business for four years. 

Perebeth is borrowing the amount of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC microcredit to pay for the maintenance of her motorbike and to purchase accessories. She joined GDMPC in 2011. She plans to improve her transportation services in the future.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenace of her motorbike and for accessories.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes lives in Nkubu, in the Meru region of Eastern Kenya. This area is known for its productivity and fertile land. She is married and has three children of whom one is still going to school. Her main sources of income are tea leaves, coffee, maize, potatoes and she also has a tailoring and hotel business.

She has requested a loan of KES 30,000 from Juhudi Kilimo that will enable her to put up a water tank to store water for her farming activities. A continuous supply of water in the farm will improve productivity and hence increase her income. This loan will help her to cater for her family's needs.The challenges she faces are pests and diseases.

In five years, she wants to have at least one acre for horticultural activities.Agnes says that Juhudi Kilimo is making her shine in her farming practices.

loans.use: To purchase a water tank.

loans.name: Otar

texts.en:
Otar is 61 years old. He lives in Tbilisi, the capital city of Georgia with his wife. Otar requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Otar works physically in the Bazaar and earns an income. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Otar requested loan from Credo to start-up a family business. Otar has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his credit Otar will purchase a refrigerator. After purchasing a refrigerator, he will place it in the Bazaar and sell frozen meat. This will increase the income of his family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a refridgerator and sell frozen meat.

loans.name: Chanani

texts.en:
Chanani is a 43-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her family. She is a mother of five children and a responsible and hardworking house wife. Her husband owns a furniture shop in the market. This shop is the base of earning for his family. He works very hard to meet the household expenses but due to the insufficient income he is facing problems to meet the needs of his family. 

Chanani has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan With the help of loan amount her husband will purchase variety of furniture for selling purposes. By doing so he will increase his net income and savings for the future. Chanani is hopeful that the loan will be productive one for her husband's business. 

She wants to purchase a computer for her children with the profit. She wishes to provide computer education to her children in the future. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan

loans.use: To purchase furniture to sell.

loans.name: Dúo Mujeres Alegres Group

texts.es:
DUO MUJERES ALEGRES
Doña Rosa es originaria de la aldea Pacorral del municipio de tecpan. Ella tiene 49 años de edad  bajo su responsabilidad está su hijo menor de edad ella se dedica a la elaboración de tejidos típicos a mano y a la agricultura.
Desde hace años ella viene realizando esta actividad porque es el medio que tiene para salir adelante ya que ella es madre soltera y  tiene que trabajar mucho para salir adelante.
El sueño de ella es ampliar mas su negocio  ya que así obtendrá mejores ganancias  y podrá salir adelante con su familia para un futuro mejor.esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboracion de tejidos tipicos.
texts.en:
“MUJERES ALEGRES” (Cheerful Women) Duo

Rosa’s from the village of Pacorral in Tecpan municipality.  She’s 49-years-old and has a minor son that’s dependent on her; she works hand weaving traditional fabric and in agriculture.  She’s been doing this activity for years now because it’s her way of getting ahead and she’s a single mother who must work much in order to get ahead.  Her dream is to expand her business more to obtain more profits and be able to get ahead with her family for a better future.  She’s requesting this loan to buy raw materials for the manufacturing of the traditional fabrics.

loans.use: to buy raw materials.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 52 years old and married with four children. With two children in school, Teresita works very hard to provide for them.

Teresita runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Teresita has been in this business for 13 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future Teresita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Abejitas Trabajadoras Group

texts.es: Nubia tiene 23 años de edad, ella forma parte de un grupo llamado Las abejitas trabajadoras, donde piden créditos a Visión Fund para mejorar sus negocios y así darle a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida, dice Nubia que una amiga la invito a formar parte del grupo y como sabía que no le iba a quedar mal por eso la invito, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y calzado de segunda en los tianguis de su población y afuera de su casa, surte su ropa en otros tianguis donde compra mas barato y ella vende las prendas afuera de su casa para ganarle algo, dice que vende ropa para dama, caballeros y niños. Platica que  puso el negocio porque no tenía un trabajo estable y empezó vendiendo su ropa que no se ponía y como vio que si la vendió rápido mejor se dedico por completo a vender ropa de segunda. Ella ahorita está pidiendo un crédito para surtirse ya que se vienen los meses más fuertes que es en mayo y junio por el día de la madre y las clausuras de las escuelas. Ella le echa muchas ganas a su negocio porque quiere que su hija tenga una mejora calidad de vida y no tenga carencias, el sueño de Nubia es hacer un local en su casa donde este mas establecido su negocio y no le pegue las inclemencias del clima para que no maltrate la ropa y los zapatos que vende. Los otros integrantes del grupo se llaman Cristina, Rosa, Mariana, Jorge, María de Jesús, Adriana, Teresa, Jaime y Norma, ellos invertirán en sus negocios, para la compra de zapatos y ropa de catalogo, en la compra de material para elaborar prendas artesanales, para la compra de insumos para elaborar pan, para la compra de material para realizar manualidades para su venta, para la compra de insumos y elotes para vender preparados y para la compra de ropa de dama y caballero para su venta.
texts.en:
Nubia, 23, is part of a group called “Las Abejitas Trabajadoras” (Little Worker Bees) that asks Visión Fund for loans to improve their businesses in order to provide better quality of life for their families.  Nubia says that a girlfriend invited her to join the group because she knew she wouldn’t disappoint them and that’s why she invited her.

She works selling second-hand clothes and shoes at a street market in her town and outside her house.  She stocks up on clothes in other street markets where she buys them more inexpensively and then she resells them outside her house to earn a little profit.  She says she sells clothes for women, men and children.  She relates that she started the business because she didn’t have a stable job and started selling her own clothes that she didn’t wear anymore and seeing that it sold quickly she decided she’d better go into selling second-hand clothes full-time.

At present she’s asking for a loan to stock up because the months of May and June are of high demand due to Mother’s Day and the end of the school year.  She puts a lot of effort into her work because she wants her daughter to have a better quality of life and want for nothing.  Nubia’s dream is to build a locale at home where her business is better established so that she can be protected from weather inclemency and her clothes and shoes that she sells won’t be damaged.

The other group members are called Cristina, Rosa, Mariana, Jorge, María de Jesús, Adriana, Teresa, Jaime and Norma.  They will invest in their businesses: to buy shoes and clothes by catalog, to buy supplies to make artisanal clothing, to buy bread baking ingredients, to buy supplies to make crafts to sell, to buy ingredients and corn on the cob to then sell cooked and to buy clothes for women and men to resell.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Rukhsana's Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a member of a two-person group. She is a 32-year-old, hard-working woman. She is living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her husband, two sons, and one daughter. All of her children are studying in school. 

Rukhsana and her husband have owned a fast food business for five years, which is the only source of income for their family. Now, for the further growth of their business, Rukhsana has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to purchase some crockery and chairs for the restaurant. 

Since their family expenditures are much higher, as compared to the monthly income and savings, she wants to open a new shop for her husband with the profit. As a result, they can increase their monthly income as well as their savings. Rukhsana dreams for the higher education of her children. She is very much thankful to Kiva for such great help and kindness.

NOTE: In the picture, Rukhsana is raising her hand.

loans.use: to purchase crockery and chairs for their restaurant.

loans.name: Lolensi

texts.en:
Lolensi is a married man aged 44 years with 5 children. He lives in Bigavu-kyango village with his family. Lolensi also takes care of three other children who are orphans. Four of his children are still attending secondary school in Rakai.

He is a farmer who deals in agriculture, specifically coffee growing. He has been in coffee growing since 2008 and he concentrated on coffee growing due to availability of enough land for cultivation, and because he also had experience in coffee growing from his father who used to grow it. He sells his products to traders from Kyotera and Kampala.

He has acquired a 2,000,000 UGX loan in order to buy organic fertilizers and pesticides for his coffee plantation. He hopes to produce coffee in large quantities and build rentals in Kyotera town in the near future. However, he faces the challenge of unpredictable weather changes and high price fluctuations. He describes himself as an honest man and thanks and requests that lenders toalways monitor their client’s businesses for a better partnership.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers

loans.name: Maria Yolanda

texts.es: Doña maria de 62 años de edad  se dedica  a vender tortillas en su lugar de residencia ya tiene varios años de dedicarse a esa actividad que le ha generado buenas ganancias que  le ayudan en los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos,  doña maria esta solicitando un crédito para poder mejorar su casa ya que cuando es la época de lluvia se entra el agua a su vivienda por esa razón solicita un crédito para poder cambiar el techo y comprar los materiales necesarios como: laminas, polines y pagar mano de obra para que ella y sus hijos puedan vivir mas seguros.
texts.en:
Doña Maria is 62 years old and sells tortillas from her home. She has been in business for several years and generates good earnings, which helps with her household expenses. Maria lives in her own home with her three children.

Doña Maria is requesting a loan so that she can improve her home. During the rainy season, water enters into her house. For this reason, she is requesting a loan so that she can replace the roof and buy the necessary materials such as metal sheets and crossbeams, as well as pay for labor. As a result, she and her children will be able to live more securely.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets and crossbeams, as well as pay for labor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase pigs

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en:
Shaheen is 35 years old, married, and has five children.  She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband operates an automobile workshop, which he has been doing for nine years. They are facing financial problems due to low monthly income.

Shaheen is requesting a loan from  BRAC Pakistan, which she will use to invest in her husband’s business by buying new tools for repairing and tuning automobiles. His customer base will increase if he has the latest equipment and tools. In future with the profits, he wants to expand his workshop by adding space.

loans.use: to purchase tools for her husband's workshop

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle is 38 years old and married, with five children. With three children currently in school, Michelle works very hard to provide for them.

Michelle runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

Michelle has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items, such as cooking oil, laundry soap, noodles, eggs, and soft drinks. 

In the future, Michelle would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a 39-year-old, married woman. She is a mother of four children. She lives in the rural area of Lahore, Pakistan. She belongs to a middle class family. 

Shazia's husband is the only earning person in the family. He owns a general store, which is the only source of income for the family. His monthly income is inadequate to meet the household's needs. Presently, he is in need of purchasing a variety of products, like flour, wheat, pulses, eggs, soap, detergent, sugar, and rice, for the store. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult. 

Therefore, Shazia has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to purchase the necessary things for her husband's business. She hopes that the loan will be helpful to her husband. 

Shazia wants to provide a quality education to her children. She hopes that she can prove herself to be a successful mother. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of products to sell in her husband's general store.

loans.name: Imomadin

texts.ru: Имомадину 53 года. Он женат  и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Детям 22 и 19 года. Его жена домохозяйка и не имеет источника дохода. Имомадин является единственным кормильцем семьи. Он опытный гончар. Он изготавливает кувшины и печи для изготовления лепешки «тандур». Этому ремеслу он научился от своих предков. Отличная черта его бизнеса заключается в том, что в ближайшие районы никто кроме него не занимается этим бизнесом, то есть нету конкуренции. Он изготавливает кувшин и тандур с хорошим качеством и местные жители довольны его работой. Местные женщины пекут вкусные лепешки на тандуре, которые купили от Имомадина. Имомадин хочет купить машину для перевозки товара. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 долларов США и обещает погасить займ во время.
texts.en:
Imomadin is 53 years old. He's married and has two children, ages 22 and 19. His wife takes care of their house and doesn't have a source of income, making Imomadin the family's only provider. He's an experienced potter and specializes in making pitchers and clay ovens called "tandoors", which the locals use to bake delicious scones. This trade was passed down to him by his father. 

It's worthy to note that he's the only potter in the region, hence his business benefits from a lack of competition. All his products are made with great care and quality, and his customers are very satisfied with the work.  

Imomadin is asking for a loan in order to buy a car so that he can transport his goods. He promises to repay the loan on schedule.

loans.use: To buy a car to transport his products.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis, de 40 años de edad, es padre soltero de tres hijos y vive junto a ellos en su casa propia.La actividad que realiza Luis está relacionada con el sector deportivo ya que desde hace 3 años tiene su academia de fútbol en donde entrena a muchos niños y jóvenes aficionados a este deporte. Con el fin de brindar un mejor servicio el se encarga de proveer a sus pupilos el uniforme completo que necesitan para cumplir una buena jornada deportiva y otros accesorios como rodilleras, guantes, medias, pelotas, zapatillas y otros. Su local de atención se encuentra instalado en su casa propia mientras que los entrenamientos respectivos lo realizan en los campos deportivos de los parques de su ciudad. Empezó como delegado en otra academia, aprendió lo necesario y vio la oportunidad de emprender solo con ese negocio por lo cual se independizó, siguió cursos académicos y ahora cuenta con todas las acreditaciones que le permiten desempeñar su función sin ninguna restricción. Considera rentable su actividad debido a la cantidad de niños y jóvenes inscritos en su academia y las buenas ganancias que le deja.Le gusta su actividad pues cuenta con un ingreso económico que le sirve para cubrir con las necesidades de sus hijos, pero lo que no le gusta es el cansancio físico que enfrenta al finalizar cada día de trabajo. Sabe que con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación logrará sacar adelante a su familia, es por eso que desea establecer una tienda de ropas y accesorios deportivos y consolidar su amor por el deporte.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000, por tanto se siente agradecido con todas las personas que le brindan el préstamo que necesita para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas.
Con el monto solicitado comprará implementos deportivos como camisetas, calcetines, pelotas y otros.
texts.en:
Luis, who is forty years old, is a single father of three. He lives with his children in the home he owns. Luis' business is connected to the sports industry: he has had a soccer academy for three years, where he coaches many children and teenagers who enjoy playing this sport. In order to offer better service to his pupils, he provides them with their full uniforms so that they can adequately perform their athletic activities. He also provides accessories like knee pads, gloves, socks, balls, shoes, etc. His office is located in his home, while his practice sessions are carried out on the playing fields of the local parks.

He started out as a delegate in a different academy, where he learned what he needed to know in order to start his own business. When he found an opportunity, he became independent. He completed academic courses and now has all the certifications that allow him to perform his work without restrictions. He believes his business to be profitable because of the amount of children and teenagers enrolled in his academy and of the good profit he obtains. He enjoys his work because it provides him with the financial income he uses to cover his children's needs. What he doesn't like is the physical exhaustion he feels at the end of the day's work. 

He knows that through his effort and dedication he will manage to provide for his family, which is why he wants to open a sporting goods store and consolidate his love of sports. This time he is requesting PEN 1,000, and he is grateful to all the people who help grant him the loan he needs in order to achieve his goals. On the other hand, he also promises to make his installment payments. He will use the amount requested to buy sports equipment like jerseys, socks, balls, and other items.

loans.use: to purchase sports equipment like jerseys, balls, socks, and other items.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es:
Florencia tiene 40 años de edad y vive en la ciudad de Pilcopata, ella es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que sale adelante. Su actividad económica principal es la venta de madera.  Desde hace varios años que pertenece al banco comunal “Chacoq” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar madera.  
(La ciudad de Pilcopata es la capital del distrito de Kosñipata dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo dentro del departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Florencia, 40, lives in the city of Pilcopata.  She’s a hardworking, enterprising woman who gets ahead.  Her main economic activity is selling lumber.  She’s been a member of the “Chacoq” communal bank for several years and on this occasion needs the loan to buy lumber.

(The city of Pilcopata is the capital of Kosñipata District in Paucartambo Province, Cusco Department, Peru.)

loans.use: to buy lumber.

loans.name: Rabia

texts.en:
Rabia is a 20-year-old housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of one child. Her husband owns a fruit shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. He sells apples, bananas and oranges in his shop. 

Presently, he is interested in offering more variety to his customers, which will help him to increase his net income and savings as well. However, due to the lack of finances, he finds it difficult. Therefore, his wife Rabia has requested a loan amount of 20,000 PKR (Pakistan rupees) from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase a variety of fruits from the field and sell them in the market at a profitable price. 

With the profit amount, her husband wants to grow his business in the future. Rabia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakiatan.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of fruits to sell.

loans.name: Shafiq

texts.en:
Shafiq is a 38 year old man. He lives in Lahore, Pakistan. He is a father of 6 children. He owns a furniture shop in the market which is the only source of income for the family. He sells chairs, tables, and beds in his shop. 

Presently he is interested in offering more variety to his customers. This will help him increase his net income and savings as well. However, due to the lack of expenses he finds it difficult. Therefore he has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan, so that he can purchase wood for manufacturing furniture. With the profit amount he wants to grow his business in the future. He is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase wood for manufacturing furniture.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is a 43-year-old hard-working woman. She lives in Punjab, Pakistan with her husband and six daughters. Her husband's income is insufficient to meet the family's needs, so Kousar is trying to help him fulfill their needs by stitching clothes.

She has been operating a stitching business very efficiently from the past many years, but she is currently in need of purchasing fabric for her business. To do that, she has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner BRAC Pakistan, so she can continue her business. With the profits she will pay the household expenses and buy sewing machines. She is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for them.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics for her business.

loans.name: Shahzia

texts.en: Ms Shahzia is a 31-year-old vigorous married lady and a mother of three; she has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. She has gain years of experience in this field and attained regular list of customers but due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers. For this reason she requested a loan of Rs 20,000 to Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors with the packs of laces, zippers and buttons. It would help her to meet the orders of her customers on time. She expects boost in her earnings and wishes to spend the part of revenue on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in various colors, as well as packets of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Meet 29-year-old Zainab, from Torkpoi town, in the southern area of Freetown. She is single, with one child, five-years-old; also her mother lives with her. 

In 2007, Zainab established her soft drink business. She began her business to get a permanent source of income to support herself and her child. She works at the business 12 hours per day and seven days per week. She says that, sometimes, the price of drinks is expensive in the market. 

Zainab requires a loan in order to purchase a variety of assorted drinks. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and to take care of her child. In the future, Zainab plans to expand her enterprise more than ever. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase variety of assorted soft drinks for her business.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a divorced woman. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

For years, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passers-by. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuation in her business. She dreams of establishing a hotel in the future. 

With the 20,000 KES, she wants to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat, and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase three bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat, and sugar.

loans.name: Davlatali

texts.ru: Давлатали 39 лет. Он женат, имеет двоих детей и проживает со своей семьей в районе Кумсангир. Давлатали вместе с женой занимается земледелием. Одновременно Давлатали намерен заняться куплей и продажей крупнорогатого скота. Он обратился в ХУМО за кредитом в размере 3000 долларов для закупа 5-голов крупнорогатого скота и его корма. У Давлатали имеются все условия для разведения скота. Местность, где проживает Давлатали имеет благоприятный климат и природу для скотоводства. Давлатали ждет и надеется на вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Davlatali is 39 years old. He lives with his wife and 2 children in Tajikistan's Qumsangir region. They make a living by farming the land, but Davlatali wants to start a cattle business as well.

He approached "MLO Humo and Partners" for a loan in order to buy 5 heads of cattle with feed. The region that he lives in boasts favourable climate and conditions for cattle breeding, which will provide a great boost to Davlatali's fledgling business. He's hoping for your help and support.

loans.use: to buy cattle and cattle fodder.

loans.name: Gulzat

texts.ru:
Гульзат  40 лет, имеет 4 детей, из которых старшая дочь является студенткой. Гульзат в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством, стартовав 12 лет назад с  покупки скота на 2 000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Гульзат в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний  день имеется  2 головы крупного рогатого скота с приплодом, ежемесячный доход составляет 7 000 сом (KGS). 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гульзат  обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS)  на увеличение поголовья скота за счет покупки 2 голов крупного рогатого скота.  Доходы от кредита Гульзат планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на обучение младших детей также.
texts.en: Gulzat is 40 years old and has four children. Her oldest daughter is a student. Gulzat raises farm animals, which is the primary source of income for her family. She began 12 years ago when she purchased livestock for 2,000 som. Thanks to her hard work, Gulzat now has two head of cattle and calves, and earns 7,000 som per month. In order to further develop her business, Gulzat has asked the microfinance institution Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 60,000 som to purchase two additional head of cattle. Gulzat plans to use the income from this loan to continue to increase the size of her herds, and also to save money for her younger children's education.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Muslima

texts.ru: Муслима 48-летняя замужняя женщина. У нее пятеро детей. Она проживает в районе Носири Хусрав, расположенный на юге страны. Старший ее сын находится на заработках за рубежом. Муслима занимается растениеводством вот уже 4 года. У нее имеется небольшой участок земли, на котором она выращивает овощи и бахчевую культуру. В посеве и сборе урожая ей помогает муж. Муслима запрашивает кредит для посева помидора и арбуза и приобретения минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Muslima is a 48-year-old married woman. She has five children. She lives in the Nosiri Khusrav region, located in the south of the country. Her oldest son is working abroad. Muslima has been involved in agriculture for four years. She has a small plot of land, on which she grows vegetables and melons. Her husband helps her sow and harvest the crops. Muslima is requesting a loan to sow tomatoes and watermelons and to buy mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to plant tomatoes and watermelon and to buy mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Caro's Group

texts.en:
Caro, Rosemond, Elizabeth and Agnes are the members in this group. They sell provisions, do hairdressing, sell footwear and sell soft drinks respectively. They reside in the Dansoman community. They have been together from January, 2012 to date. 

Caro is a 39-year-old provision seller (milk, Milo, sugar, toffees, rice, and biscuits) who is married to Jonas, a 48-year-old driver. They are blessed with two children, both in school. Caro has been with ID Ghana for the past year and is doing very well with her business. 

She has been doing this business for eight years now. She works from Mondays through Saturdays. Without ID Ghana’s training on savings she would not have made it this far. This is her 3rd loan and she needs GHS 1,200 to buy more provisions to sell to her customers. 

The group members need a total amount of GHS 3,300 to buy more goods to sell to their customers in the community.

loans.use: To buy milk, Milo, sugar, toffees, rice and biscuits to sell to customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more padlocks, key locks, nets, plywood and boards to sell

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: Mariée à un agent immobilier, Ablavi vit avec son enfant de 15ans à Lomé. Pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille, elle a démarré la vente des produits d’alimentation générale, activité qu’elle mène depuis 2009. Disposant de nombreux clients et n’arrivant pas à les satisfaire à cause de manque de marchandises, Ablavi sollicite son premier crédit à WAGES pour renforcer son activité. Les profits tirés de la vente lui permettra d’ouvrir d’autres boutiques et d’assurer l’épanouissement de la famille. Notons qu’elle est âgée de 44ans.
texts.en:
Married to a real estate agent, Ablavi lives with her 15-year-old child in Lome.

She began selling grocery products to meet her family's needs, and has been in business since 2009.

She has numerous customers which she is unable to satisfy due to a lack of merchandise. Therefore she is seeking her first credit loan from WAGES to bolster her business.

Sales profits will enable her to open more stores and ensure her family's well-being. Note that she is 44 years old.

loans.use: Buy grocery products

loans.name: Davlatkhuja

texts.ru: Давлатхуже 49 лет. Он женат и отец двоих детей. У него сын и дочь. Давлатхужа трудолюбивый и предприимчивый человек. Он живет и трудится в районе Шахритус. У него среднее образование. Давлатхужа занимается земледелием, в этой сфере он работает в течение 7 лет. Давлатхужа планирует начать бизнес в области животноводства и заняться купле-продажей крупного рогатого скота. Он имеет коровник и корм для скота. Давлатхужа планирует закупать скот, после 35 дней откорма, продавать с наценкой на скотном рынке своего района. Кредит запрашивает для закупа 2-х голов крупно-рогатого скота.
texts.en: Davlatkhuja is 49 years old, married and a father of two children.  He has a son and a daughter.  Davlatkhuja is a hardworking and entrepreneurial person.  He lives and works in the Shahrituz district.  He has a secondary education.  Davlatkhuja is involved in farming and has been in this business for 7 years.  Davlatkhuja plans to start an animal husbandry business and get involved in buying and selling cattle.  He has a cowshed and feed for livestock.  Davlatkhuja plans to buy livestock and then sell it with a markup at the district's livestock market after 35 days of fattening up.  He is requesting this loan to buy 2 heads of cattle.

loans.use: to buy 2 heads of cattle for fattening up and resale

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es: Luzmila, de 36 años de edad, es una mujer joven, amable y trabajadora, está casada y tiene dos hijos de 11 y 5 años de edad respectivamente, vive en su casa propia lado de su pareja y sus dos hijos.El trabajo de Luzmila consiste en la venta de productos comestibles tales como arroz, azúcar, leche, papel higiénico, azúcar, aceite , ademas de productos para el hogar como sábanas, ollas, sartenes, bandejas y otros. Su tienda está instalada en el frontis de su casa y es la única de su barrio por lo cual sus ventas están aseguradas y sus ganancias económicas estables. Lleva trabajando en esta activad mas de 2 años , se inició vendiendo productos en pequeñas cantidades, ahora vende mucho más y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 600, está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero para seguir adelante , además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.Con el monto solicitado comprará arroz, azúcar, leche y huevos para que continúe vendiendo en su tienda.
texts.en:
Luzmila, who is 36 years old, is a kind and hardworking young woman. She is married and has two children, who are eleven and five years old, respectively. She lives in her own home with her husband and children. Luzmila works selling grocery items like rice, sugar, milk, toilet paper, sugar, and oil, as well as household items like sheets, pots, pans, platters, and other items. Her store is set up in the front of her house and is the only one in her neighborhood, which guarantees her sales and the stability of her financial earnings. She has been in business for over two years. She started out selling products in small quantities, but now she sells a lot more and things are going very well for her. 

This time she is requesting PEN 600. She is very happy to know she will have the financial support she needs to keep going. She also promises to pay her installments on time. She will use the amount requested to buy rice, sugar, milk, and eggs to sell in her store.

loans.use: to purchase products like rice, sugar, milk, and other items.

loans.name: Guljamila

texts.ru: Гулжамила жительница района Кубадиян, расположенный на юге страны. Ей 57 лет. Она замужем и мать восьмерых детей. У нее шестеро дочерей и двое сыновей. Муж и дети работают в дехканском хозяйстве. Сама Гулжамила является главой дехканского хозяйства. Дехканское хозяйство это индивидуальное или коллективное частное хозяйство, в котором занимаются выращиванием сельскохозяйственной культуры. Гулжамила на 5 га участке земли выращивает пшеницу, картофель, арбуз. Она занимается этой деятельностью уже 4 года. Кредит берет для приобретения минерального удобрения, топлива и семян арбуза. Гулжамила надеется получить богатый урожай.
texts.en: Guljamila lives in the Qubadiyon region, located in the south of the country. She is 57 years old, married, and the mother of eight children. She has six daughters and two sons. Her husband and children work on the farm. Guljamila herself is the head of the farm. The farm is an individual or collective private enterprise, which is engaged in crop-growing. Guljamila has 5 hectares of land on which she grows wheat, potatoes, and watermelon. She started this business 4 years ago. The loan is for the purchase of fertilizer, fuel, and watermelon seeds. Guljamila hopes to have a rich harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, fuel, and watermelon seeds

loans.name: Mehriniso

texts.ru: Мехринисо 41 года. Она замужем на доброго человека, которого зовут Сафар. Она имеет 1 ребенка, которому 20 лет. Ее муж Сафар не имеет постоянное место работы в Таджикистане и поэтому он является трудовым мигрантом. Мехринисо опытная портниха и создает шедевры таджикских национальных платьев. Она занимается шитьём женской одежды более чем 12 лет. Ее бизнес является основным источником дохода семьи. Она имеет своих постоянных клиентов. Недавно ее муж приехал домой увидеться семьёй и теперь он должен уехать обратно, но не имеет денег для покупки авиабилета. Мехринисо  запрашивает займ на сумму 2500  сомони для покупки авиабилета для мужа. Она надеется на вас и вашу доброту.
texts.en: Mehriniso is 41 years old. She is married to a good man, who is named Safar. She has one child who is 20 years old. Her husband Safar has no permanent work in Tajikistan, and is therefore a migrant worker. Mehriniso is an experienced dressmaker and creates masterpieces of Tajik national dress. She has been sewing women's clothes for more than 12 years. Her business is the main source of income for her family, and she has regular customers. Recently her husband came home to see his family and now he has to go back, but they do not have the money to buy a ticket. Mehriniso is requesting a loan of 2,500 Somoni to buy a ticket for her husband. She looks forward to your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a plane ticket for her husband.

loans.name: Celmira

texts.es: Celmira de 57 años de edad, es madre de cuatro hijos; se dedica desde hace más de 15 años a la confección de prendas de vestir. Aprendió la labor gracias a una amiga quien le enseño. Labora en su taller ubicado en su vivienda todos los días de 8:00 am a 6:00 pm. En la actualidad desea comprar una maquina plana y una fileteadora con la cual podrá mejorar los tiempos de entrega de los pedidos. Espera incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Su mayor deseo es tener un gran taller de confecciones y con este generar empleos directos para las personas de su localidad.
texts.en:
Celmira, 57, is the mother of four children.  She has earned a living making clothing for more than 15 years.  She learned the work thanks to a friend who taught her.  She works in her shop in her home every day from 8 a.m. until 6 p.m.

Currently she wants to buy a tabletop sewing machine and a serger to improve the time it takes to deliver her orders.

She hopes to increase her income and improve her family's quality of life.  His biggest desire is to have a great tailor shop and create direct jobs for people in her town.

loans.use: to buy a tabletop sewing machine and a serger

loans.name: Yonatan

texts.es:
Yonatan es un joven de 28 años de edad. Se dedica al oficio de la ebanistería desde hace cuatro años, actividad que aprendió gracias a un curso gratuito que recibió por parte de la alcaldía de su localidad. Después de terminar el curso se empleó, allí adquirió la experiencia y afianzó la técnica, lo que le permitió crear su propio negocio y convertirse en un microempresario. Aunque apenas se encuentra iniciando su negocio, Yonatan es muy optimista y asegura que ha tenido buena acogida en el mercado local, lo que le brinda confianza y seguridad. En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de una pulidora con el fin de garantizarles a sus clientes un mejor servicio. 
Sueña con seguir creciendo y ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Yonatan is a 28-year-old young man who has made a living in woodworking for four years.  He learned the job thanks to a free course he received from the mayor's office in his town.  After finishing the course he got a job where he acquired experience and learned the technique.  This allowed him to create his own business and become a micro-entrepreneur.

Yonatan is very optimistic even though he has barely started his business.  He's certain he has had a good reception in the local market, which gives him confidence and security.

Currently he's requesting a loan to invest in buying a polishing machine so he can guarantee better customer service.

He dreams of continuing to grow and giving his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a polishing machine

loans.name: Saboatkhon

texts.ru: Сабоатхон жительница города Дангара. Ей 46 лет. Она вдова с одним ребенком. Сабоатхон одна воспитывает дочь, которая учится в средней школе. Сабоатхон образованная женщина. Она работает педагогом в профессиональном колледже в течение 26 лет. Сабоатхон в свободное от работы времени занимается разными видами  плетения, в частности она плетет платки, шерстяные шапки, носки и т.д. Она запрашивает кредит для приобретения различных ниток, чтобы продолжить деятельность.
texts.en: Saboatkhon is a resident of the city of Dangara.  She is 46 years old and a widow with one child.  Saboatkhon is raising her daughter, who attends a secondary school, by herself.  Saboatkhon is an educated woman.  She has been working as a teacher at a professional college for 26 years.  Saboatkhon is involved in various types of weaving, especially scarves, wool hats, etc., in her time free of work.  She is requesting this loan to purchase various threads in order to continue her business.

loans.use: purchase various threads in order to continue her business

loans.name: María Elizabeth

texts.es:
María de 50 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora y con grandes deseos de sacar adelante su familia. Después de sufrir el abandono de su pareja, esta mujer decidió ponerse los pantalones y luchar por el bienestar de sus cuatro hijos. Inició con la cría, engorde y venta de pollos y cerdos, actividad que  actualmente realiza y le genera los ingresos necesarios para la educación y el alimento de sus hijos.
Con el fin de crecer dentro del sector, María se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de concentrado, cerdos y reparaciones de las cocheras. 
Desea mejorar su calidad de vida y garantizarle a su familia mejores oportunidades.
texts.en:
Maria is 50 years old and is a very enterprising woman.  She has a great desire to help her family get ahead.  After suffering the abandonment of her husband, this woman decided to put on the pants herself and to struggle for the well being of her four children.  She began breeding, fattening and selling chicken and pigs, an activity which she continues with today and which generates the necessary income to educate and feed her children.

In order to grow within this sector, Maria is asking for this loan to invest in animal feed, pigs and to make repairs to her garage.  Her greatest wish in life is the guarantee better opportunities for her family.

loans.use: to buy animal feed, pigs and to repair her garage

loans.name: Las Pulgas De Ancud Group

texts.es: Carmen Gloria, que esta al costado derecho de la pantalla con una parka azul y cuello celeste y su bolso cruzado, pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Pulgas de Ancud, este banco se formó en la ciudad de Castro, Chiloé ubicado en la X Región de Los Lagos en Chile. Los socios de este Banco tiene diversos negocios tales como venta de ropa usada, venta de empanadas, milcao, bazar, paquetería, repostería, tejidos chilotes, y Carmen Gloria, tiene su negocio de venta de ropa usada que comenzó hace 4 años, junto a sus amistades que le ayudaron  a perder la vergüenza de empezar a vender en la calle, ahora gracias a su esfuerzo y junto con amigas han podido arrendar entre todas un pequeño puesto en la feria, está muy contenta de poder contar que ha tenido muchas más éxitos en su negocio, ya que le ha ayudado a poder tener más dinero lo que significa que ha podido aportar un poco más en su hogar. Con el crédito que est6á solicitando podrá comprar fardos de ropa usada y poder empezar a mejorar la mercadería que ofrece a su clientela, es por este que está muy contenta y segura de que le irá muy bien durante este período. Entre las cosas que más le han gustado de trabajar junto a Fondo Esperanza es el hecho de que les puedan enseñar a invertir, y a mejorar la venta de sus productos, aprender a comprar para ofrecer una mejor mercadería a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Carmen Gloria is standing on the right side of the screen, wearing a blue parka with a blue collar. She has a handbag strapped across her body. Carmen Gloria is a member of the Communal Bank “Las Pulgas de Ancud”, which was established in the city of Castro, Chiloé, which is located in Region X of Los Lagos in Chile. The members of this Communal Bank engage in various businesses such as selling used clothing, selling empanadas, making potato pancakes, managing a bazaar, operating a parcel service, making desserts, and producing woven items.

Carmen Gloria started her business of selling used clothing four years ago. With the help of her friends, she was able to overcome her shyness so that she could begin selling products on the street. Thanks to her efforts, she and her friends have been able to rent a small vending stall at the fair. She is very pleased that she has had more success with her business since the extra money means that she can provide a bit more support for her household. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy bundles of used clothing so that she can improve the inventory of merchandise that she offers to her customers. For this reason, Carmen Gloria is very pleased and is confident that she will do well during this period. Among the things that she enjoys most about working with Fondo Esperanza include learning how to invest, how to improve the sale of her products, and how to make purchases so that she can offer the best merchandise to her customers.

loans.use: to buy bundles of used clothing.

loans.name: Batbayar

texts.en:
Mr. Batbayar is 62 years-old and lives with his wife and son in a house in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. His wife, Horoloo, is retired and stays home to take care of her husband and son. His son, Otgonlhagva, is 29 years-old and runs a transportation service in town. Batbayar started his business of a cafeteria in a rental place in 1990.  He herds his livestock and produces organic dairy products which he sells in the local market. 

He is now requesting a loan of 5,000,000MNT in order to purchase insulation and an energy efficient economic stove to install in his son's house to stay warm during winter. He said "my son is already reached the age of marriage and now I am building him a house and let him start his family in there".

loans.use: to purchase insulation and an energy efficient economic stove to install in his son's house to stay warm during winter.

loans.name: Quetzal Group

texts.es: María Concepción tiene 38 años de edad,0 dice que unos meses atrás una amiga la invito a formar parte de un grupo llamado Quetzal, los cuales piden créditos para mejorar sus negocios. Conchita, como de cariño le dicen, se dedica desde hace 3 años a la elaboración de tortillas hechas a mano ya que no tenía trabajo estable porque ella no tiene estudios y se le hace difícil conseguir un trabajo porque no sabe leer ni escribir, ella no fue a la escuela porque a sus papás no les alcazaba para los gastos de sus útiles escolares. Es por eso que Concepción decidió poner su propio negocio y con la ayuda de su esposo logró comprar un comal y poner un puesto de tortillas en su casa, las cuales hace a diario y vende por docenas, dice ella “las más ricas y baratas del lugar”, y también puso el negocio para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de sus hijos ya que lo que él gana como empleado no le alcanzaba. Platica que al principio sí le era difícil conseguir clientes ya que hay mas personas que venden tortillas pero ahorita tiene ya sus propias clientes ya que ella elabora sus productos 100% de maíz y eso le gusta a las personas porque las tortillas duran un poco más y tienen mejor sabor. A diario, ella se levanta a muy temprana hora a poner el nixtamal y lo lleva a moler  para obtener la masa con la cual hace las tortillas, ella usa un comal de barro y leña porque dice que así obtienen un mejor sabor las tortillas. Platica que está pidiendo un crédito para la compra de maíz, leña, cal y otro comal ya que nada más le dura 3 meses de tanto uso y es que este material también es más delicado. La meta de Conchita es  tener más clientes y hacerse de un puesto en la central de abastos de una población cercana a la de ella para obtener más ganancias. Los demás integrantes del grupo se llaman Anastasia, Gonzalo, Maribel, Ma. del Pueblito, Noheli Alejandra, Maricela, Virginia, Martha Isabel y Norma Edith, ellas invertirán en sus negocios en la compra de insumos para elaborar antojitos mexicanos como tacos, pambazos, quesadillas, etc, para la compra de insumos para elaborar pan para vender, compra de insumos para vender en tienda de abarrotes, para dar mantenimiento a un vehículo de fletes y mudanzas, para la compra de material para la elaboración de bisutería, para la compra de material para elaborar servilletas bordadas y para la compra y venta de frutas y legumbres de temporada.
texts.en:
María Concepción, 38, says that a girlfriend invited her some months ago to become part of a group called “Quetzal” that asks for loans to improve their businesses.  Conchita, like she’s affectionately called, has worked for the last three years making hand-made tortillas since she had no job because she never went to school and it’s hard for her to get a job since she doesn’t know how to read or write.  She never attended school because her parents didn’t have enough to pay for school supplies.  This is why Concepción decided to open her own business to help her husband with their children’s expenses since what he earns as an employee isn’t enough.   She relates that at first it was difficult to get customers because there are other people who sell tortillas but now she has her own customers because she makes tortillas 100% of corn and people like that because the tortillas last a little longer and taste better.  

She rises very early every day to start the ‘nixtamal’ [maize boiled in lime water] and then take it to be ground into dough to make tortillas.  She uses a clay griddle and firewood because she says the tortillas taste better that way.  She relates that she’s asking for this loan to buy corn, firewood, lime powder and another griddle because they only last three months because of all the use they get and this material is also more delicate.  Conchita’s goal is to have more customers and to get a stand in the wholesale food market in a town nearby so she can earn higher profits.

The other group members are called Anastasia, Maribel, María del Pueblito, Nohelí Alejandra, Maricela, Virginia, Martha Isabel and Norma Edith.  They will invest in their businesses which are: Mexican fast-food snacks like tacos, ‘pambazos’ [bread filled with chorizo and potatoes and dipped in red chili sauce], quesadillas [flour tortilla filled with cheese and other ingredients], and others, grocery store, moving and storage vehicle repair, costume jewelry making, materials and supplies to make embroidered napkins and seasonal fruit and vegetable sales.

loans.use: to buy supplies and ingredients to make hand-made tortillas.

loans.name: Zubayda

texts.ru: Зубайда 30-летняя молодая женщина, проживающая в районе Шахритус. Она замужем и в данное время живет у родителей, так как муж находится на заработках в загранице. Зубайда ответственная и добрая женщина. У нее среднее образование. Сейчас она хотела бы начать торговый бизнес. На рынке своего района она имеет торговую точку для продажи. Зубайда хочет начать деятельность в области продажи женской одежды и ткани. Она планирует оптом закупать товар с города Душанбе и продавать их по розничной цене на рынке своего района. Чтобы начать бизнес Зубайда берет кредит для приобретения женской одежды и ткани. Она надеется на Вашу поддержку.
