With a Kiva loan, Lifise will be set up with a “Business in a Bag”, a kit containing a personalized mix of small-scale clean energy products, marketing materials and training on energy literacy, SMS tracking of sales, and basic business skills.  Lifise would like to sell solar energy desk lamps with mobile phone charging capability. She wants to sell clean energy products because he likes business and wants to participate in the environmental protection of Haiti.

loans.use: to purchase stock for a clean energy business.

loans.name: Selnys

texts.en: Selnys started out his business with EarthSpark clean energy products by selling solar light bulbs and solar desk lamps in his community. His business has since expanded and he has now added charcoal efficient stoves to his product line. He is taking out another loan to be able to add to his stock.

loans.use: to purchase stock for a clean energy business.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.es:
La Sra. Lilian Tiene como profesión Peluquera y comerciante. Es dueña de una mercería donde ejerce su profesión y a la vez vende ropas calzados y artículos de mercería. 

Además de todo ello es dueña de salones comerciales los cuales alquiela. Ella cuenta que es madre de un joven muy trabajador y luchador, y que ambos se ayudan mutuamente.

La señora Lilian ha demostrado ser una persona muy responsable y honesta en sus compromisos y está solicitando el crédito para la refacción de los salones comerciales que alquila, ya que es muy importante tener bien sus inmuebles para dar un buen servicio a sus clientes. Agradece por la a oportunidad que está recibiendo, ya que le será de mucha ayuda y podrá seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Lilian is a hairdresser and retailer.  She owns a general store where she practices her profession and sells clothing, footwear, and notions.  

In addition to all that she owns commercial salons that she rents.  She says she's the mother of a hardworking young man who's a striver, and they both support each other.  

Lilian has shown herself to be a very responsible and honest person in her commitments. She's requesting the loan for refurbishing commercial salons because it's important to have her property in good shape to give her customers good service.

She's grateful for the opportunity she's receiving because it'll be a big help to her and help her to keep moving forward.

loans.use: refurbishing rental space

loans.name: Tam's Group

texts.en: Tam is 52 and a mother of 3 kids. Two of her children are in school and one is helping in the family business. Tam grows rice on one and one half hectares of land. The current business has returned her about 8,800 KHR per day. Including this loan, she is a third-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has completely repaid her past loan, which has improved her business gradually. Now, she leads a group of four to apply for a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to pay for the plowing fee for her farmland. She hopes to plow her farming area and to replant her cash crop on time.

loans.use: To pay the plowing fee for her farmland

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto is 54 years old and married with six children. He resides in Sebasi of Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Roberto operates an agriculture business. He plants and harvests corn and vegetables to sell in the local community in order to earn a living. He has been in this business for many years. Each month, he earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of business. After harvesting his farm,He requested a loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC, which he joined in 2008, in order to purchase seeds and seedlings. 

In the future, Roberto would like to save in order to create an emergency fund for the future and to improve his farming business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and seedlings

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 37 years old and married with five children, four of whom are in school. Arlene works very hard to provide for her family.

Arlene runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Arlene has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items, such as bread, soft drinks, sardines, and other groceries. 

In the future, Arlene would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Leonides Sr.

texts.en: Leonides Sr. is a 55-year-old fisherman from Ubay, Bohol. He is a married man and a father of four children. Loenides Sr. has been engaged in his fishing business for more than 20 years now. This is the source of his income. Leonides Sr. is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, and paint for the boat. Through this loan, he will be able to improve his fishing business as well as his income. In the future, Leonides Sr. dreams of making his business successful and stable.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, and paint for the boat

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
Meet 20-year-old Adama from Moriba Town around Bo in Southern Province, Sierra Leone. She has had no schooling and is married with a child who is five years old.

In 2007 Adama began selling firewood because she was married at a young age and had to help support the family. She works every day from morning to night. She says that her main challenge is a lack of money to build up her business.

Adama is applying for a 900,000 SLL loan through BRAC Sierra Leone in order to buy additional wood to sell. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will help pull her family out of poverty and assist her in learning how to be a caterer. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy additional wood to sell.

loans.name: Marhila

texts.en:
Marhila is 31 years old and she is a hardworking woman with a great desire to be a perfect businesswoman. She is married and has three children. They live in a house that is located in a village. 

Marhila is one of the successful businesswomen of her village. For more than three years, she has been busy with animal sales. She knows all aspects of her business very well. Her experiences and skills have helped her to develop her business and in this way improve her living conditions. She manages the business alone. 

She wants to develop her business further, but her income is small and she needs your help and mercy. She is asking for a loan of 3,000 USD to buy cattle. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle for developing her business.

loans.name: Khayal

texts.en:
Khayal is 29 years old and the father of two children. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his wife and children in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. He is a Jabrayili refugee. 

Khayal grows fruits and vegetables. He plants tomatoes, potatoes, eggplant and other vegetables and fruits. He says, even though this business is very hard, together with his wife he has been handling the business for five years without any difficulty. 

Khayal grows vegetables and fruits and sells them in the bazaar. His income from selling produce is 150 AZN. He has more plans for the future, such as obtaining more land for cultivation. Khayal is looking forward to increased sales in the summer, because people purchase fruits a lot.

He needs a loan of 1,900 AZN. This loan is for the purpose of getting new fertilizer and seeds. It will help him to grow more vegetables and fruits in order to get more revenue in the coming summer, which will help him to support his family’s needs. He has a good loan history; this is his third loan.

loans.use: to purchase new fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Rayta

texts.en:
Ms Rayta, 50 years old, has been making shoes for the past 20 years. A mother of six children and eager to support her family, she is responsible for meeting the basic needs of her children including food and health. She is also accountable to improve their standard of living. Her children help her in her business.

During a year of her business Rayta had little capital due to many problems receiving payments on time and was unable to expand her business activities. At that point, reluctant to take an informal loan from relatives, she contacted Kashf Foundation upon the suggestion of her neighbor. By the support of Kashf Foundation, she is now fulfilling her dreams and able to manage her children’s basic necessities.

Now in her her fifth year with Kashf Foundation, Rayta is requesting a loan of Rs. 35000 to buy additional shoe-making materials including leather, artificial leather and plastic soles. The loan will enable her to meet the growing demand for her products in the market and allow her to better support her family.

loans.use: to buy additional shoe-making material including leather, artificial leather and plastic soles.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Ms. Razia is a married woman who is living with her husband and three children in Punjab, Pakistan. For about 15 years she has been doing embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand, and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. To help her continue her operations, she has requested a loan of Rs 20,000 to buy reels of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment. In this way she will be able to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful to get an increase in her income by targeting more customers. Razia dreams for her children's bright future and desires to build her own house since she is living in a rented house with her family. She is very much thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: To buy reels of threads in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana is applying for a loan of $600.00 to improve her business. She is married and she has six children. She is running a business in front of her house by selling gasoline. Juliana is making a good income from selling gasoline and she wants to buy more stocks with the loan. She lives in a town near by the main road, so many people come to buy and she is selling every day. She started her business a year ago with her own working capital.

loans.use: To buy gasoline

loans.name: Konna

texts.en:
This is 50-year-old Konna from Torkpoi town Bo, in the southern area of Sierra Leone. She is married with five children between the ages of 11 and 25 years old.

Konna runs a local soap business; she sells local soap at her house. She has been running this business for three years. She works at the business throughout the week and eight hours per day. She also receives income from her elder son. She says that the main challenges to her business are insufficient capital to run her business and price inflation.

Konna has requested a loan in order to purchase palm oil and detergent for making soap. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and put a roof on her house to protect her residence from the rainy season. In the future, she plans to expand her business to a soap making factory. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil and detergent for making soap.

loans.name: Ghazala's Group

texts.en:
Ghazala is 36 years old and married. She lives in the rural area of Lahore, Pakistan. She belongs to a middle class family. Her husband is the only earning person in the family. He owns a butcher shop, which is the only source of income for his family. His monthly income is inadequate to meet the household needs. 

Presently, Ghazala's husband is in need of purchasing chickens to sell. However, due to the lack of income, he finds it difficult. Therefore, Ghazala, as a member of two-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband to purchase products for his shop. She hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband. She wants to provide a quality education to her children. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase chickens to sell.

loans.name: Kazim

texts.en:
Kazim is 45 years old and married with three children. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his wife and children in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. He is a Fuzuli refugee.  

For past ten years, he has been raising sheep because mutton is in high demand in this region. Kazim is a retired person with an income of 100 AZN monthly from this business. This is a very profitable business and Kazim is doing it together with his wife.

He is keeping a flock of sheep in his own yard. He fattens them and takes their meat to the central bazaar, where butchers and customers purchase from him. People use mutton for traditional dishes like kababs, dolmas, pilovs, etc.

He has taken loan from Aqroinvest before and has a good loan history. This is going to be his third loan. This time he requires 1,700 AZN in order to purchase 12 sheep s that he can sell more meat in the summer. He is optimistic about this loan, because in summer, more people consume meat due to holidays and increased customers in restaurants.

loans.use: to purchase 12 sheep in order to sell more meat in the summer.

loans.name: Ramiz

texts.en:
Ramiz is 32 years old and the father of two sons. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his wife and children in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. He is a Fuzuli refugee. His wife stays at home. 

A few years ago,  Ramiz decided to open his own business, selling basic grocery items needed in his neighborhood. Today, he is a person who enjoys his neighbors' and his family's respect.

He has been in this business for eight years. He sells food products in his shop, such as macaroni, rice, candies, cookies, sugar and beverages. His wife helps him in this business. His monthly profit is 300 AZN. As this is the main source of income, his profit is used for family needs. The profit he earns is not enough to reinvest in his business in order to meet customer demand, so he is suffering for this reason. 

Ramiz would like to increase his sales and invest additional capital in the business. For this purpose, he applied for a 2,000 AZN loan. He will buy and diversify foodstuffs to sell at his store. This will be his third loan, and he has a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy more products for resale.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Ms. Razia is a married woman. She, along with her husband, is in the business of making jewelry and has been doing this for many years. The man shown in the photo is Razia’s husband. The business has great potential for growth, and Razia is actively helping her husband as this business is the only source of income for them. They have three children, and two of them are school going. The couple wishes to send all of their children to school by increasing their earnings. In order to meet the orders on time and boost their sales, Razia requested a loan of 10,000 PKR to purchase materials such as silver, gold and dozens of artificial gems and pearls. She hopes to increase their net income and wishes to spend a part of their profits on providing quality education for their children.

loans.use: To purchase materials such as silver, gold and dozens of artificial gems and pearls

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Ms. Nasreen is a married woman and a mother of seven. She has been running a business of trading cloth for many years. She purchases a variety of cloths from the main city and after fixing stones, as per customer requirement, she sells them to the people in her community. She has become famous for selling good-quality cloths in her community and makes enough to contribute to her family's income.  Currently, Nasreen is requesting a loan of Rs 30,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy different cloths for the summer season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she will be able to earn more income through her greater sales. She is in her 3rd loan cycle and hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: To buy different cloths for the summer season

loans.name: Víctor Manuel

texts.es:
Víctor tiene 29 años de edad, esta acompañado  y tiene dos hijos. Se dedica a la agricultura desde su niñez; fue su padre quien le enseño. Los insumos que necesita para sus actividades productivas y para el hogar las adquiere en una ciudad que esta a 35 kilómetros de su casa; son dos horas y media en autobús, por que es bastante escaso el transporte. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 4 bolsas de semilla de maíz, 24 quintales de abono, fertilizantes, herbicidas y pesticidas. Con la inversión, comprara todos los insumos de una sola vez, ahorrándose tanto viaje y más con la dificultad del trasporte en el lugar en donde vive, los aplicara a tiempo y en las cantidades correctas para que le genere una buena cosecha. Su deseo es que sus hijos terminen de estudiar, comprar un terreno, seguir trabajando en la agricultura y con mayor enfoque en las hortalizas y cultivo de frutas, aprovechando que en la zona en donde vive permite este tipo de cultivos.
texts.en:
Víctor, 29, has a spouse and two children.  He’s worked in agriculture since childhood; his father taught him.  The supplies he needs for his productive activities and for his home he gets in a city that’s 35 kilometers from his house; it takes two-and-a-half hours by bus because transport is quite scarce.

The loan he’s asking Fundación Campo for is to buy four sacks of corn seeds, 24 quintals of manure, fertilizer, herbicide and pesticide.  With this investment he will buy all the supplies at the same time so he won’t have to make several trips that are so difficult to do because of the transportation situation where he lives.  He will be able to apply them in a timely fashion and in the right amounts so that his crop yields will be good.

He hopes his children will complete their schooling, to buy a piece of land and to continue working in agriculture focusing for the most part on vegetables and fruit taking advantage of the zone he lives in which is propitious  for these types of crops.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Annie

texts.es: Annie, de 40 años, es una mujer muy valiente y luchadora, es madre de dos hijos de 18 y 9 años quienes son fruto de su matrimonio, ella tiene una casa propia en donde comparte todos los días el gusto de criar a sus hijos y trabajar mucho para brindarles lo mejor, además de ellos también vive ahí un joven que les ayuda en el trabajo que realizan a diario.El negocio que tiene Annie esta relacionado al sector salud, Tiene un consultorio médico en un local alquilado y ahí recibe diversos pacientes que llegan con dolencias leves para encontrar soluciones a sus malestares. Estudió enfermería y hoy pone en práctica a diario todo lo que aprendió desde suturas, curaciones, inyecciones y otros. Lleva en esta actividad 5 años y hasta el momento le va muy bien. Trabaja con ayuda de otra enfermera.Le gusta su negocio pues le permite aplicar todo lo que aprendió en sus estudios, además siente satisfacción cuando sus pacientes regresan a casa contentos por haber solucionado sus malestares.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 3800, está agradecida y contenta al saber que sigue contando con el apoyo financiero que necesita para avanzar con el progreso de su negocio.El monto solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de agujas, jeringas, alcohol, gasas, medicinas de mayor uso y guantes quirúrgicos para que pueda seguir realizando su trabajo.
texts.en:
Annie, 40, is a brave, hardworking woman.  She’s the mother of two children who are 18 and 9 years of age; they are the fruit of her marriage.  She owns her house where she daily enjoys the pleasure of raising her children and working hard to give them the best.  In addition to them, another young man who helps them with the work they do also lives there.

The business Annie has is related to the health sector.  She has a medical office in a rented space where she receives patients who come by with various minor complaints seeking remedies for their discomforts.  She studied nursing and every day she puts into practice what she learned from suturing, to first aid treatments, to applying injections, etc.  She’s been in this activity for five years and to date is doing very well.  She works with the help of another nurse.  She likes her business because it allows her to apply everything she learned in her studies and she also gets much satisfaction when her patients return home happy to have had their discomforts taken care of.

On this occasion she will ask for 3,800 soles and she’s grateful and happy to know that she’ll continue having financial support needed to advance in her business to rely on .  She will use the requested amount to buy needles, syringes, alcohol, gauze, surgical gloves and the medicine she uses most so that she can continue doing her work.

loans.use: to buy syringes, alcohol, gauze, etc.

loans.name: Angel Patricio

texts.es:
Patricio tiene 35 años de edad es casado tiene dos hijos viven en San Jose de Chimbo junto con la familia, esposa e hijos en casa arrendada.

Patricio es chofer en una cooperativa de transporte de buses. Solicita el crédito para la compra de una coputadora e impresora. 

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar el computador para que los hijos realicen los trabajos del colegio y la impresora para que puedan imprimir y así evitar que bayan a centros de computo y ahorrar dinero.

El sueño es tener siempre trabajo y dar lo mejor a la familia, en los tiempos libres de gusta reunirse y conversar con la familia y amigos.
texts.en:
Patricio, 35, is married and has two children.  He lives in San José de Chimbo with his family, his wife and children, in a rented house.  

Patricio's a driver with a bus cooperative.  He's requesting the money to buy a computer and printer. 

With the help of this loan his children will be able to do their homework and print in order to avoid the cost of going to an internet cafe.  

His dream is to always have work to give his family what they need.  In his free time he likes to get together with his friends and family to talk.

loans.use: to buy a computer and a printer

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is in her late forties.  She is married with six children and also has five additional dependents at home. She runs a retail business in Kandeh town Bo, in the Southern area of Sierra Leone. She started this business because her husband does not have a job and  she needed to get a source of income to support the home. 

She's been in this business for 16 years and sells palm oil and wood from her house.  She says that the main challenges are transporting her goods is very difficult and improper business location.

Theresa requested this loan through Kiva partner BRAC Sierra Leone in order to purchase more palm oil and wood to resell. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to be responsible for her family feeding and to have a permanent business location. In the future, she would like to open a local food store enterprise. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and wood to resell.

loans.name: Mariyam

texts.en:
Mariyam is a 35 year-old married woman. She lives in the rural area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of five children. She belongs to a middle class family. Her husband is the only earning person in the family. He is a tailor by profession which is the only source of income for his family. His monthly income is inadequate to meet the household needs. Presently, he needs to purchase a machine.  However, due to the lack of funds he finds it difficult. 

Therefore, Mariyam has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase the needful things for her husband's business. She hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband. She wants to provide a quality education to her children. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a machine for her husband's tailoring shop.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Aminata is 38 years old and married with seven children, three of whom are going to school. The family lives in Moriba Town around Bo in Southern Province, Sierra Leone.

For the past nineteen years Aminata has sold dried fish within a busy market area. This business is the her only source of income, but she says that her business is good because out of her profits she is able to feed her children.

Aminata is applying for a 900,000 SLL loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy additional fish to sell. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve her family’s standard of living and pay her children’s school fees.

She would like to become more successful, as educating her children is important to her. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Agness

texts.en:
Meet 47-year-old Agness from Kandeh town Bo in Sierra Leone. She is widowed with four children. Two of her children are going to school.  In 2005, Agness established her retail business. She began her business because she needs to generate income to take care of herself and her family. She works at the business every day, from morning to night.  She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and transportation.

Agness requires a loan in order to purchase palm oil, gari and general stock. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and repay her loan. In the future, Agness plans to see her business to a higher level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil, gari and general stock.

loans.name: Alfunur

texts.en:
Alfunur is a 53 years old and the mother of four children. She is an IDP (internally displaced person) from Jabrayil and lives with her husband and children in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. She is a hardworking person who takes care of her family by doing business in animal sales. Alfunur raises cattle to sell the meat. She has been in this business for 12 years. Her husband supports her in the business. The business takes a lot of effort, but together they run it successfully. Alfunur sells the meat in the central bazaar, where the demand for meat is high. People in Azerbaijan consume meat a lot, because it is used in most dishes. Some traditional meals like kebabs, dolma and others require beef in their preparation. Her profit is 130 AZN monthly. 

Alfunur is applying for new loan of 1,800 AZN, in order to expand the business by buying calves. She plans to raise these calves, fatten them and sell more meat for the coming traditional holidays, when the demand for beef will increase.

loans.use: to expand the business by buying calves.

loans.name: Elida

texts.en:
Elida is a 47-year-old villager from southeastern Albania who is married and has a 24-year-old child. 

Elida is seeking lenders’ attention to help her financially in order to buy a minibus for her son. He will use the vehicle to transport passengers to different destinations, thus, this will be his business. Elida’s activity for the past seven years has been in agriculture, particularly in livestock. She has been selling milk and homemade cheese to the local market of a nearby town.

"Dairy is the staple food in Albanian villages, and cities as well. So, the demand for it remains high for as long as the poverty level doesn’t see any changes for the better. Maybe in the cities, residents consume less because they have to pay for it, but here in the villages, we don’t have to pay for it, we just have to work hard for it," Elilda said.

loans.use: to buy a minibus for her son's passenger transport business.

loans.name: Mamed

texts.en:
Fifty-one-year-old Mamed lives in Gardabani district with his 39-year-old wife and 17-year-old son. Mamed requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The family owns a commercial space, which is rented out so they can get a small monthly income. Mamed’s wife is a teacher and gives private lessons. The family income is so small that it’s rarely enough for food for them. 

Mamed requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Mamed has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his credit, Mamed will open a beauty salon. He will purchase all the needed equipment and hire professionals. Mamed hopes to make a good profit from his business so he can earn additional income for the family and provide better living conditions for them.

loans.use: To open a beauty salon.

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Ms. Irshad is a married woman. She is manufacturing shoes with buckles that are used in the embellishment of shoes. She beautifully makes shoes in different colors, designs and sizes at home and then sells them in the local market. By this time, she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. Her husband works as a laborer and earns insufficient income to support his family alone. She is a mother of two children and is motivated to provide for her family. 

To cope with the increasing demand of her customers, she requested a loan of 50,000 Pakistani rupees to purchase leather material, plastic leather and soles with spools of threads in various colors to increase her production. She hopes to get a boost in her earnings through her large sales. She is in her ninth loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. Irshad wishes to utilize part of the revenues to provide a good and quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase leather material, plastic leather and soles with spools of threads in various colors.

loans.name: Gulam  Fatima

texts.en: Ms. Ghulam Fatima is a vigorous lady and a mother of three; she has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of 25,000 Pakistan rupees from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues so she may able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her third loan cycle and is thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Sheila

texts.es: Sheila, de 36 años, es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora, esta casada y tiene 3 hijos, con quienes vive en la casa de sus padres.La actividad que realiza Sheila es la venta de golosinas variadas como chicles, caramelos, galletas, chocolates, chupetines, jugos, postres y otros. Tiene un local que alquila mensualmente en una zona muy transitada de la ciudad . Renueva sus productos de manera semanal llegando a invertir altas sumas de dinero. Lleva en esta actividad más de 7 años y en algunas ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su esposo. De manera paralela se dedica a la distribución de bebidas.Lo que le gusta de su actividad es que puede tener un ingreso económico que ella misma genera , el cual le permite solventar sus necesidades y colaborar con algunos gastos del hogar. Se siente muy feliz desarrollando su trabajo por que se siente útil a la sociedad aunque muchas veces ha querido desistir por el cansancio, sin embargo, siempre renueva sus energías y continúa trabajando con mucho optimismo.En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 1000, por tanto agradece la oportunidad y confianza que ponen en ella para recibir éste crédito, por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual.Con el préstamo solicitado comprará más golosinas como caramelos, hojuelas de maíz, chicles, galletas, bocaditos, entre otros.
texts.en:
Sheila, who is 36 years old, is a tenacious and enterprising woman. She is married and has three children with whom she lives in her parents' house. 

Sheila's business is the sale of a variety of snacks like gum, candy, cookies, chocolates, lollipops, juices, desserts, and others. She has a shop that she rents on a monthly basis in a busy part of the city. She restocks her products weekly, investing large sums of money. She has been in this business for more than seven years, and sometimes she gets help from her husband. At the same time, she also works as a drink distributor. 

What she likes about her business is that she is able to have her own income, which allows her to afford what she needs and contribute to some of the household expenses. She feels very happy carrying out her work because she feels useful to society, even though she has wanted to give up out of fatigue many times; however, she always renews her energy and continues working with great optimism. 

At this time, she is requesting 1000 nuevos soles [PEN]; she appreciates the opportunity and the trust she has been granted to receive this loan. For her part, she promises to make her payments in a punctual manner. With the requested loan, she will buy more snacks like candy, corn flakes, gum, cookies, pastries, and more.

loans.use: to purchase snacks like candies, gum, cookies, and others.

loans.name: Rufino

texts.es:
Rufino tiene 59 años de edad, esta casado  y tiene tres hijos. Se dedica a la agricultura desde su niñez; fue su padre quien le enseño a trabajar muy fuerte para llevar el alimento a su familia. El lugar en donde tiene sus cultivos esta muy lejos de su casa, debido a eso construyo una ramada para quedarse a dormir ahí y no estar viajando todos los días. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 4 bolsas de semilla de maíz, 20 quintales de abono, fertilizantes, herbicidas y pesticidas. Con la inversión, espera que su cultivo sea muy productivo y obtenga lo suficiente para cubrir con los gastos del hogar y mejorar su calidad de vida. Su deseo es que sus hijos terminen sus estudios, comprar un terreno y cultivar más hortalizas y frutas.
texts.en:
Rufino, 59, is married and has three children.  He’s worked in agriculture since childhood; his father taught him to work hard to provide food for his family.  The place where his crops grow is far from his house so he built a hut there to sleep in in order not to have to travel every day.

The loan he’s asking Fundación Campo for is to buy four sacks of corn seeds, 20 quintals of manure, fertilizer, herbicide and pesticide.  With the investment he hopes his crops will be very productive and that he’ll earn enough to cover household expenses and to improve his quality of life.  His wish is that his children complete their schooling, to buy land and to grow more vegetables and fruit.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Nellya

texts.ru:
Неля   -  женщина фермер.  С 1990 года занимается выращиванием помидор, огурцов, перца и клубники.
Справляться по хозяйству ей помогает муж и двое детей 40-ка и 38-ми лет.
Неля решила приобрести капельную ленту для полива перца и клубники.
В планах на будущее:  расширить посевные площади перца и клубники.
В личных планах: достроить дом.
Нуждается в вашей помощи для финансирования капельной ленты.
texts.en: Nellya is farm woman.  Since 1990, she has grown tomatoes, cucumbers, peppers and strawberries.  Her husband and her two children (aged 40 and 38) help her with her business.  Nellya has decided to buy irrigation hosing to water her peppers and strawberries.  Her future plans include expanding the area of land she farms.  She also wants to build a home.  She needs your help to finance the purchase of the irrigation hosing.

loans.use: To purchase farming equipment

loans.name: Aynura

texts.en:
Aynura is 32 years old and the mother of two children. She is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his husband and children in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. Aynura is a Jabrayili refugee. She is very kind, caring and also very energetic in her work. She is a farmer and grows seasonal fruits and vegetables. She has more than four years of experience in this field, which makes her experienced and skilled in this field. 

Aynura usually sells her crops in the central bazaar. People use fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthy. Many national dishes are made of vegetables, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits serve every table in the Azerbaijan family and also make fresh punch. Her monthly income is 100 AZN. Growing crops takes a lot of strength and work is outside, which is very hard for a woman. That is why her husband helps Aynura. 

She needs additional capital to invest in seeds and fertilizer. This will allow her to improve the quality of products that she grows and increase monthly turnover. For this purpose, she applied for 1,800 AZN.

loans.use: to invest in seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Gulu

texts.en:
Gulu is 48 years old and she is an IDP (internally displaced person) who lives with her husband and daughters in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. Gulu is a Fuzulu refugee. 

Gulu has been raising cattle for the past 15 years. She says this is a very difficult job. Taking care of animals takes continuous effort, but her husband is helping her to raise the cattle, fatten them and sell them in the market. Gulu has four daughters and believes she must work very hard in order to help her daughters with their weddings. 

Gulu usually buys cattle, raises them, fattens them, and sells them in central bazaar. Her monthly income is 120 AZN. This financial income is the only income source for family. She plans to expand the business in order to bring more funds into the family. Selling meat is a very profitable business in Azerbaijan, due its widespread use in everyday meals.

Gulu is applying for a loan of 2,000 AZN in order to buy more calves. This is going to be her first loan in Aqroinvest. She believes this loan will have a positive impact in the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy more calves.

loans.name: Santa Lucia Ii Group

texts.es:
La señora Santos Yolanda es madre soltera, tiene 33 años de edad, no tubo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 2 hihos y los 2 estan estudiando, ella se dedica al comercio, vende ropa para niños y bebes, inició este negocio con poco capital y hasta el momento lleva 10 años de experiencia.

Decide organizar un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de mercadería para surtir su negocio, en el futuro desea contar con un puesto mas grande y tener mas mercadería; las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a artesanía y comercio.
texts.en:
Santos Yolanda’s a single mother.  She’s 33-years-old and never went to school. She has two children both of which attend school.  She’s a merchant.  She sells clothes for children and infants.  She started the business with little capital and to date has 10 years’ experience.

She decides to form a group to request a loan she’ll use to buy merchandise to stock her business.  In future she’d like to have a larger stand and to have more merchandise.  The other group members work in crafts and in commerce.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: María Amanda

texts.es:
María tiene 50 años de edad, es viuda. Ella proviene de una familia muy humilde, no se le presento la oportunidad de asistir  a la escuela ya que sus padres y sus tres hermanos tenían que trabajar la tierra para cultivar granos básicos como el maíz, fríjoles y maicillo. Su madre le enseño a tejer petates de tule, en ese tiempo elaboraba dos a la semana y además ayudaba a su padre y a sus hermanos a cultivar en las cordilleras, debido a que el terreno es bastante quebradizo. A los 24 años de edad se caso y su esposo la apoyo mucho, instalo una pequeña tienda de productos básicos en su casa, en donde vende aceite, huevos, frijoles, azúcar, jabón, entre otros más y su esposo se dedicaba a elaborar medicina natural; pero lastimosamente su esposo falleció hace tres años y medio; ella quedo solo con una hija adoptada de 13 años de edad.

Hoy en día compra cerdos y luego los vende vivos o los destaza para vender la carne en la comunidad y le va muy bien ya que no hay muchas tiendas ni destazos. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar dos cerdos, dos quintales de arroz, dos quintales de fríjoles, dos quintales de azúcar, detergentes, aceite, galletas, pan, café, entre otros productos para la tienda. Y detergentes para limpieza del hogar, pastas dentales que serian productos nuevos para la tienda.  Con la inversión agregara productos nuevos y aumentara la cantidad disponible, debido a que en la comunidad solo hay dos tiendas y la población es bastante grande. Su propósito, es a corto plazo surtir más la tienda, comprar unas vitrinas y brindar lo necesario a su hija adoptiva ya que asiste al sexto grado en la escuela.
texts.en:
María, 50, is a widow; she comes from a very humble family so she was never able to attend school because her parents and three brothers had to work, the land to grow basic grains like corn, beans and sorghum.  Her mother taught her how to weave reed mats.  At that time she was able to do two per week; she also helped her father and brothers with the agriculture on the hillsides because the terrain is quite fractured.  

At the age of 24 she got married and her husband helped her much.  He installed a small grocery store at home where she sells oil, eggs, beans, sugar and soap among others and her husband worked making herbal remedies.  Sadly, he died three-and-a-half years ago and she was left alone with an adopted 13-year-old daughter.  At present, she buys pigs to then resell either alive or she butchers them to sell the meat in her community.  She does very well because there aren’t many stores or butcher shops.

The loan she’s asking Fundación Campo for is to buy two pigs, two quintals of rice, two quintals of beans, two quintals of sugar, detergent, oil, cookies, bread and coffee among other products for the store; also detergents for home cleaning and toothpaste which will be new products for the store.  

With this investment she will add new products and increase the amount available because there are only two stores in the community and the population is quite large.  Her short-term goal is to stock the store more, to buy some display cases and to provide what’s necessary for her adopted daughter who is in sixth grade in school.

loans.use: to buy two pigs and stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Kumushoy

texts.ru:
Кумушой женщина в возрасте 38 лет.  Она замужем, имеет троих детей, живет в Дж. Расуловском р-не.    Кумушой предприниматель занимается купля продажей парфюмерии на центральном рынке Дж. Расуловского р-на.   Муж  клиентки работает плотником. Кумушой  начинала свою  деятельность с 2000 года. По началу было очень тяжело но   по совету своих знакомых  с 2004 года начала кредитоваться в ООО МДО "Арванд".    После того как она стала кредитоваться в Арванде она на много расширила свой бизнес и увеличила свой доход.  Этот вид деятельности ей очень нравиться потому что продавая парфюмерию и косметику она делает женщин еще красивее.  
На данный момент Кумушой планирует закупить  новый ассортимент косметики и увеличить свой товарооборот.  Кумушой заранее благодарит Арванд за финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Kumushoy is a 38-year-old woman.  She's married, has three children and lives in the J. Rusalov region of Tajikistan.  Kumushoy is a businesswoman who buys and sells perfumes at a central market in J. Rusalov.  Her husband works as a carpenter.  She started her business in the year 2000.  In the beginning, it was difficult but following the advice of those close to her, she started borrowing through Arvand in 2004.  After she began using loans, she expanded her business considerably and increased her income.  She loves the fact that her business selling perfumes and cosmetics helps women look their best.  At the moment, Kumushoy plans to buy a new assortment of inventory to increase her turnover.  She is grateful for the financial support of Arvand.

loans.use: to buy perfumes and cosmetics

loans.name: Ilene

texts.en: Greetings from Zimbabwe!  This is 32-year-old Ilene from Harare. She is married and has two children, one of whom attends school. Ilene runs a retail business selling chemicals, batteries and stationary. The business has been in operation for five years. She says the main challenge she faces is the lack of capital. Ilene has requested a loan of $800 to buy more chemicals, batteries and stationary for resale. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to finish roofing her house. Ilene is currently operating her business from rented premises and plans to have her own premise.

loans.use: to buy more chemicals, batteries and stationary.

loans.name: Kalsoom's Group

texts.en:
Kalsoom is a 37-year-old married woman with three children. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan.

Kalsoom’s husband owns a cosmetics shop, which is the family’s only source of income. Because his monthly income is inadequate to meet the family’s needs, they live in miserable conditions.

The shop is in need of a variety of products including hairbrushes and dyes, lipsticks, nail polish, etc. to sell. However, due to the family’s lack of money it’s difficult to make these purchases. Therefore, as a member of a two-person group Kalsoom is applying for a 65,000 PKR loan through Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to buy needed stock for her husband's shop.

Kalsoom is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy needed stock for her husband's cosmetics shop.

loans.name: Enos

texts.en:
Enos is 29 years old and married with four children. He is an agriculturalist who majors in coffee growing and cattle fattening. He has been in this business for eight years and has earned a lot from it. He has managed to pay school fees for his three school-going children and construct a house for his family.

Enos is applying for a loan of 2,000,000 UGX to buy organic fertilizer for his coffee and banana plantations to add to the manure from his cattle fattening business.

His major challenges are soil infertility, low yields from his coffee crop, and inadequate land for the expansion of his businesses. His dream is to own one of the biggest coffee plantations in his region.

Enos is honest and hard working.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Sayavus

texts.en:
Sayavush is 33 years old and the father of two children. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his wife and children in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. He is a Fuzuli refugee. 

For the past five years, he has been raising sheep because mutton is in high demand in this region. Sayavush  is a retired person with an income of 140 AZN monthly from this business. This is a very profitable business and he is doing it together with his wife. He keeps a flock of sheep in his own yard. He fattens them and takes their meat to the central bazaar, where butchers and customers purchase from him. People use mutton for traditional dishes like kababs, dolmas, pilovs, etc.

Sayavush  is applying for a loan of 1,800 AZN in order to buy 12 sheep. He is optimistic about this loan, because in summer more people consume meat, due to the holidays.

loans.use: to buy 12 sheep.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase pigs.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana tiene 30 años de edad y vive en la ciudad de Pilcopata, ella es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que sale adelante. Su actividad económica principal es la agricultura y la crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas. Desde hace varios años que pertenece al banco comunal “Chacoq” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más cuyes.  

(La ciudad de Pilcopata es la capital del distrito de Kosñipata dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo dentro del departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Juana is 30 years old and lives in the city of Pilcopata. She is a hardworking and enterprising person who makes ends meet. Her main economic activity is agriculture and raising young livestock like guinea pigs and chickens. For several years, she has belonged to the communal bank "Chacoq"; at this time, she needs a loan to buy more guinea pigs.

(The city of Pilcopata is the capital of the district of Kosñipata, which is in the province of Paucartambo, in the department of Cusco, Perú.)

loans.use: to buy more guinea pigs.

loans.name: Ruziboy

texts.ru: Рузибой житель района Кубадиён. Ему 40 лет. Он женат и имеет одного сына. Он занимается земледелием. Рузибой решил обратиться за кредитом. Он хочет начать животноводческую деятельность и заняться купле-продажей крупнорогатого скота. У него имеются условия и место для разведения скота. Рузибой планирует закупать по 2-х голов бычков, откармливать в течение одного месяца и продавать с наценкой на скотном рынке. Чтобы реализовать свою цель он просит кредит в размере 700 долларов для закупа двух голов крупнорогатого скота и его корма.
texts.en: Ruziboy is a resident of the Qubadiyon region of Tajikistan.  He is 40 years old, married and has one son.  He works in the farming industry.  Ruziboy has decided to take out a loan.  He wants to start an additional business in livestock and begin buying and selling cattle.  He has everything he needs for it, including the space to breed the animals.  He plans to buy two bulls, fatten them over the period of a month and then sell them at a premium at a livestock market.  In order to make this goal happen, he's asking for a loan of 700 USD to buy the two animals as well as their feed.

loans.use: to buy and sell cattle

loans.name: Saba

texts.en:
Saba is a 28-year-old married woman. She is a vigorous lady and for the past three years has been running a business selling clothing. She buys clothing made of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale prices, and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. 

Saba is requesting a loan of 35,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of clothing in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and plans to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of clothing in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en:
Samina is a 41-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. She has had a beauty parlor business for ten years. She offers many services to her customers, such as makeup, hair styling and facials. By providing her best services, she has become very famous on her street. 

In order to meet the increasing demands of her customers, Samina is interested in buying more variety of cosmetics products for the beauty parlor. Since she has a low amount of cash in hand, she contacted Kashf Foundation to apply for loan. She needs a loan of 35,000 PKR to buy hair care products, skin products and creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities. She is hopeful to cater to more customers on a regular basis. She is in her second loan cycle with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products and creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities.

loans.name: Saba

texts.en: Saba is an energetic woman and a mother of two; she has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of 20,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy a new sewing machine with more spools of threads in different colors and packs of laces, zippers and buttons in order to create a means of increasing revenues so she may able to generate a healthier source of income. She is thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine with more spools of thread in different colors and packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Samai

texts.en: This is 55 year-old Samai. He is married and has six children ages 32, 30, 28, 18, 10 and 7 years.  He has five additional dependents who are his apprentices. In 1985, Samai established his tailoring business. He began his business as an income-generating activity. His business is located in the middle of city and his main customers are neighbors and passersby. He works seven days a week and 16 hours a day. He would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. He requires a loan in order to buy sewing inputs. He hopes that this loan will help him to develop his shop. He plans to change his business as he gradually approaches old age. In the future, Samai plans to expand his business. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for sewing inputs

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en: Carolina is applying for a loan of (USD) $ 800.00 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She runs a business selling fish in front of her house. She will use the loan to buy fish to sell. She is making good money from selling and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future.

loans.use: to buy fish
